This member is a young, single mother of 22 years old and with a six year old son, whom receives financial support from his father. She lives in her parents' home and contributes towards the household costs. Ms. Martha coordinates the children centers of her community. She works very few hours and doesn't have a fixed work schedule since she has to travel to far areas and must leave her home very early and return very late. During her free time, she weaves, a skill that her mother taught her and also something she learned through weaving courses. She is a very charismatic member of the communal bank and is in her fifth cycle there. With the credit that she is seeking, she is going to buy cement and sand in order to construct another room in her house. Her goal is to finish her university studies in Educational Computing, which she abandoned in her second year.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cement, sand, and bricks.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es: Paulino, de 29 años, es casado y tiene cinco hijos, una pequeña y cuatro mayores. Juntos residen en una comunidad ubicada en la selva cuzqueña, donde tienen su casa  propia hecha a base de madera.Paulino se caracteriza por ser un agricultor decidido, se dedica a la siembra de café. Su producto es considerado como uno de los mejores en su valle, sin embargo, la única dificultad que tiene es que produce en poca cantidad, pero trata de aprovechar todo el terreno que falta ocupar en su chacra. Su estrategia a largo plazo consiste en adquirir más terrenos de cultivo con la finalidad de incrementar su productividad y atender futuras demandas. Por lo general vende su producto  en los centros de acopio de su comunidad, a un precio competitivo; y le esta resultando muy rentable. Para la buena labor que logra cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa e hijos, y su rutina diaria empieza a  las 6  de la mañana, y termina a las 6  de la tarde.Este es el cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP, y  se compromete en pagar sus cuotas durante las fechas establecidas, además se siente orgulloso con el trabajo de su banco comunal, porque todos trabajan para el bienestar  conjunto.Con el dinero solicitado Paulino tiene planeado comprar productos comestibles para instalar  una pequeña bodega, pues quiere  seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Paulino, age 29, is married and has five children. One is small and four are older. They live together in a community in the Cuzqueña jungle. They have their own house there, which is made of wood. Paulino is characterized as being a determined farmer. He devotes himself to growing coffee. His product is considered to be one of the best in his valley. Nevertheless, the only difficulty he has is that he produces a small amount. He tries to take advantage of all of the unused land on his farm. His long term strategy consists of getting more land for crops. He will do that in order to increase his productivity and to meet future demands. He normally sells his product at community centers where people gather, and he sells at a competitive price. The result is very profitable for him. He counts on his wife and children for help with the good work that he does. His daily routine starts at six in the morning and ends at six in the evening. This is his fourth loan with MFP. He commits to making his payments on time. He is proud of the communal bank’s work because they all work together for their well-being. Paulino will use the requested money to buy food in order to set up a small grocery store. He wants to keep progressing.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food products to set up a store

loans.name: Gloria Esperanza

texts.es:
La Sra. Gloria Z. es socia del banco comunal San José hace 5 años, fue invitada por una amiga de la cual esta muy agradecida ya que los prestamos le han ayudado para superarse en su hogar; vive en la comunidad de Inga Pirca que es perteneciente a la parroquia de Santa Ana, esta parroquia se caracteriza por que su gente en su mayor parte se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, muchos de sus habitantes salen a la ciudad en busca de una mejor oportunidad de trabajo, realizan las labores de albañiles y arreglo de casas.

Doña Gloria se dedica a trabajar en un  Centro de Desarrollo Infantil en el cual se dedica a cuidar y realizar actividades dinámicas con niños, en este trabajo ya tiene 6 años, labora de 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m., de lunes a viernes; también se da un tiempo para criar animales como pollos los que vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad.

Nuestra socia tiene 26 años de edad, vive en unión libre, concibio 2 hijos que tienen 10 y 8 años de edad, estudian en una escuela de la comunidad, su esposo es de profesión albañil y juntos han logrado construir su casa propia.

 Con su nuevo crédito que recibe por parte de la fundación ESPOIR lo va a utilizar para hacerle unos arreglos a su casa, su meta es sacar a su familia adelante y a sus hijos darles una buena educación.
texts.en:
Miss Gloria Z. has been a member of the San José community bank for 5 years. She was invited by a friend and she is very grateful since the loans have helped her to improve her home. She lives in the community of Inga Pirca which belongs to the parish of Santa Ana. This parish is known for the majority of the people working in agriculture and livestock. Many of the habitants go out to the city in search of better work opportunities, doing work in construction and housekeeping. Miss Gloria works in a Child Development Center where she leads dynamic activities and cares for children. She has worked there for 6 years, working from 8am-6pm, Monday to Friday. She also works part time raising animals such as chicken which she sells when she needs to. Our member is 26 years old and has a common-law marriage with her husband. She has 2 children who are 10 and 8 years old and they study in the community school. Her husband is a professional builder and together they have been able to build their own house. She plans to do some household repairs with her new loan that she will receive from the ESPOIR foundation. Her goal is to provide a better life for her family and her children and give them a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bricks, cement, and sand

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina tiene 30 años de edad, convive con su pareja y su hijo, Brayan de 4 años de edad. Juntos viven en la comunidad de Manitea Alta,  ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donde tienen su casa propia a base de madera. Desde su niña siempre le ha gustado ayudar a sus padres, sea en el hogar o en el campo. Hasta que cayeron económicamente. Dina sentía el dolor de sus padres, pero poco a poco se sobrepusieron. Actualmente tienen una tienda, instalada en su propio domicilio y afirma que aprendió muchas cosas de sus padres, como a estar preparado en lo momentos mas difíciles, es por ello que siempre es precavida en las decisiones que toma. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su pareja, pero usualmente trabaja por cuenta propia. Su mayor anhelo es ampliar su tienda con la finalidad de captar mayor clientela. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a pagar de acuerdo a su cronograma de pagos, además resalta la unión entre todos los compañeros de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería que tenga mayor demanda con el propósito de satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dina is 30 years old and she lives with her partner and her son Brayan who is 4 years old. They live together in the community of Manitea Alta, located in the beautiful ayacuchana jungle, where they have their own house made of wood. Since she was a little girl she has always liked helping her parents, whether it be in the house or in the fields, until they had an economic downfall. Dina felt the pain that her parents felt, but little by little they persevered. Now she has a store in her own home. Dina says that she learned many things from her parents, such as how to be prepared in the most difficult moments. It’s for this that she is always cautious of the decisions she makes. Sometimes she gets help from her partner, but he usually does his own work. Her biggest goal is to make her store bigger with the end goal of having more customers. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she promises to pay according to the payment schedule. Also, she highlights the relationships shared between all of the members of her community group. With the loan that she is asking for, she will invest in the purchase of merchandise that has the highest demand with the purpose of satisfying the needs of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various products to stock her store

loans.name: Hilda Florencia

texts.es:
La Sra. Hilda Illescas es socia del banco comunal San José, vive en la comunidad de Inga Pirca, que es perteneciente a la parroquia de Santa Ana, esta parroquia se caracteriza por que su gente se dedica en su mayor parte a la agricultura y ganadería muchos de sus habitantes salen a la ciudad en busca de una mejor oportunidad de trabajo, en la cual realizan las labores de albañiles y arreglo de casas.

Nuestra socia tiene 29 años de edad, vive en unión libre y fruto de esa unión ha concebido 1 hijo que se encuentra de 9 años de edad, estudia en una escuela de la localidad, su esposo es maestro albañil y con el trabajo conyugal han comprado una casa.

La Sra. Hilda trabaja limpiando casas en la ciudad de Cuenca, labora de 8 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m., de lunes a viernes, y los sábados hasta el medio día, actividad que la realiza hace 15 años.

 Se encuentra en la banca comunal hace 2 años, fue invitada por su mamá y los créditos le han beneficiado en su hogar, con su nuevo crédito de la fundación ESPOIR lo va a invertir para comprar pollos y así empezar con este lucrativo negocio.

 Su meta es comprarse un vehiculo.
texts.en:
Miss Hilda Illescas is a member of the San José community bank. She lives in the community of Inga Pirca, which belongs to the parish of Santa Ana. This parish is known for its people who work primarily in agriculture and livestock. Many of the inhabitants go to the city in search of better work opportunities, where they do work in construction and housekeeping. Our member is 29 years old, and she lives in a common-law marriage. They have one child who is 9 years old and studies in the local school. Her husband is an instructor for bricklaying and with their combined work they have bought a house. Miss Hilda works cleaning houses in the city of Cuenca. She works from 8am to 5pm, Monday through Friday, and Saturdays until noon. She has worked in this way for 15 years.She has been a member of the community bank for 2 years. She was invited by her mom and the loans have helped her improve her home. She is going to use her new loan from the ESPOIR foundation to purchase chicken and begin with this lucrative business.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chicken

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco Comunal Virgen del Carmen son del Distrito D. Pacaycasa que se encuentra a 30 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Petronila es la presidenta del Banco Comunal y lo que mas le gusta del Banco Comunal son las capacitaciones en temas D. familia.
Petronila es casada y tiene 2 hijos que estudian, Petronila junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación D. ladrillos artesanales que venD. crudos para luego ser quemados. También se dedica a la compra D. tara y cochinilla en las diferentes comunidades D. su distrito, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda D. su hijo y tiene un carro con el cual acopian estos productos, sus ventas los realiza a un mayorista. Además Petronila venD. comida los días sábados y domingos en el estadio D. su comunidad, prepara varios platos típicos D. la zona. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. ají, papa, arroz por sacos. Petronila desea comprar un terreno para la construcción D. una casa para sus hijos y tener mas capital.
texts.en:
The members of the Virgen del Carmen Communal Bank are from the Pacaycasa district, which is 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Petronila is the president of the communal bank. What she likes the most about the communal bank are the trainings about families. Petronila is married and has two children who go to school. Petronila and her husband make handmaD., unbaked bricks. They sell them to be baked later. She also buys “tara” (a Peruvian plant whose tannins are most commonly used in the manufacture of furniture leather) and “cochinilla” (an insect used to make a red dye) in the different communities in her district. Her son helps her. She has a car where she keeps the products that she sells wholesale. Petronila also sells food on Saturdays and Sundays in the stadium in her community. She makes various dishes that are typical in her area. The loan is to buy chili peppers, potatoes, and sacks of rice. Petronila wishes to buy land in order to build a house for her children and to have more capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chili peppers, potatoes, and sacks of rice

loans.name: Musuq Wasi Group

texts.es:
Flor D. Maria es presidenta del Banco Comunal Musuq Wasi que significa Nueva Casa en quechua, las socias son D. la Comunidad D. Santo Domingo que se encuentra a 20 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, es un pequeño valle en donD. se produce verduras y también se dedican a la crianza D. animales menores.
Flor D. Maria vive en la casa D. sus padres y su mayor sueño es tener una casa propia para su hijo, Flor es soltera y tiene 1 hijo que esta estudiando, Flor D. Maria se dedica a la crianza D. cuy en su casa tiene 40 galpones, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su papa, sus ventas los realiza a los restaurantes. Además Flor D. Maria se dedica a la siembra D. verduras, hortalizas y sus ventas los realiza en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad.
Su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. semilla y abono. Flor D. Maria desea ampliar sus galpones y tener una empresa, su hijo sea un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Flor D. Maria is the president of the community bank Musuq Wasi, which means "new house" in Quechua. The bank members are from the community of Santo Domingo, which is located 20 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. It is a little valley where they produce vegetables and also raise small animals. Flor D. Maria lives in the house of her parents, and her greatest dream is to have her own house for her son. Flor is single and has one son, who is a student. Flor D. Maria raises guinea pigs. She has 40 cages at her house. She carries out this activity with the help of her father. She makes her sales in restaurants. In addition, Flor plants greens and other vegetables and sells them in the public market in the city. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of seeds and fertilizer. Flor wants to add to her cages and have a business, and she wants her son to have a good career.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 42 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace mas de 8 años posee una tienda, instalada en su misma casa, en donde sus hijos la apoyan en la atención. Disfruta mucho su trabajo, por que le permite  tener sus propias ganancias y poder disponerlas en los diversos gastos de su hogar y también porque le gusta atender a su clientela. Durante este tiempo de  experiencia ha visto las buenas rentas que le han generado por lo que quiere tener una tienda mucho más amplia y abastecida de mayor variedad de mercadería. Es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, es muy responsable con sus pagos y agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de mercadería para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Gloria is 42 years old and lives with her 3 children in her own house. For more than 8 years she has had a store in her home where her children have helped to look after the business. She enjoys her work very much because it allows her to have her own earnings and enables her to put it towards the various household expenses. She also likes to serve her customers. During this time, she has generated good revenues, so much that she wants to expand her business and stock her store with a wider variety of merchandise. This is the third time that she is going to receive credit from MFP. She is very responsible with her payments. She thanks the people that will be providing her with her loan request because it will be very useful for her in the advancement of her business. With the credit she is seeking, she will purchase merchandise to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Dina Bach, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
Maria integra el Banco Comunal Brisas y lo que mas le gusta son las capacitaciones y el incentivo al ahorro.
Maria es casada y tiene 8 hijos de los cuales 3 están estudiando, Maria tiene un cafetín en la base policial de la ciudad, en donde vende comida, golosinas, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus hija. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de gaseosas y galletas.
Su mayor deseo es que sus hijos tengan un negocio de donde vivir y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Brisas (Breezes) communal bank; what she enjoys the most are the training sessions and the savings incentive. María is married and has 8 children, three of whom are in school. She has a small coffee shop in the city’s police station where she sells food, sweets and fruit every day; her daughter helps her. She will use the loan to buy cookies and soft-drinks. Her greatest wish is that her children have a business to support themselves and to enlarge her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft-drinks and cookies.

loans.name: Nelba Jeovana

texts.es:
Nelba estudio muchas carreras como educación primaria, enfermería técnica, estilista y podología, Nelva tiene una clínica Podológica en un local alquilado, negocio que inicio hace 2 años, recibió una especialización en la Habana, realiza tratamiento de pies, cirugías menores. Nelba es socia del Banco Comunal Brisas y lo que mas le gusta son las capacitaciones que le ayudan a seguir progresando. Nelva solicita un crédito de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicamentos para una campaña podológica que piensa realizar.
Nelba sueña con estudiar la carrera de medico podólogo, seguir especializándose y hacer crecer su clínica.
texts.en:
Nelba studied several professions like: elementary school teaching, technical nursing, hair stylist and podiatry. She runs a podiatry clinic in a rented locale; she started this business two years ago after receiving specialized training in Havana. She provides foot treatments and minor surgeries. She is a member of the Brisas (Breezes) communal bank and what she likes best about it are the training sessions that help her to continue to progress. Nelba is asking for 3000 soles to buy medicines for a podiatry campaign she plans to carry out. Nelba dreams with studying to become a medical podiatrist, to continue specializing, and to have her clinic expand.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medicine.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja tiene 6 hijos que están estudiando y su mayor sueño es educar a sus hijos, Maruja es conviviente. Maruja pertenece al Banco Comunal Brisa y lo que mas le agrada son los prestamos fáciles y aprendió a ser puntual.
Maruja es conviviente, tiene 6 hijos y están estudiando, Maruja viaja a la ciudad de Ica en donde vende cereales, panes, productos que compra en el mercado de abastos, sus ventas los realiza en las diferentes haciendas de la zona. Además Maruja tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras y carnes. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
texts.en:
Maruja has 6 children that are students and her dream is to educate her children. Maruja lives with her partner. She also belongs to the Brisa Communal Bank and what she like most are the easy loans from which she has learned to be punctual. Maruja travels to the city of Ica where she sells grains, bread and products that she buys at the fresh food markets. She sells her goods at the various farms in the region. In addition, Maruja has a store in her house where she sells groceries, mostly vegetables and meats. She will use her loan to buy rice and sugar.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maruja will use the loan to buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel vive en casa alquilada y su mayor sueño es comprar un terreno para construir su casa, Maribel es conviviente, tiene 20 años y 1 hijo que le gustaría que sea profesional.
Maribel es socia del Banco Comunal Brisas y lo que mas le agrada es el incentivo del ahorro.
Maribel vende quesos en su casa y barrio, los quesos los adquiere en los diferentes pueblos a donde viaja, además Maribel vende leña que adquiere de los productores. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de leña y quesos.
texts.en:
Maribel lives in a rented house and her biggest dream is to buy a plot of land to build a house of her own. Maribel is 20 years old; she is in a common-law marriage and has a son who she hopes will grow up to become a professional. Maribel is a member of the Brisas Communal Bank, and what she likes most of all is the encouragement to save. Maribel sells cheese from her home and around the neighborhood; she buys the cheeses in different villages where she travels. Maribel also sells firewood. She will invest the loan into the purchase of firewood and cheeses.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of firewood and cheeses

loans.name: Susy Mercedes

texts.es:
Susy es la presidenta del Banco Comunal Las Brisas y sus prestamos obtenidos hasta el momento le ayudaron mucho en su negocio. 
Susy es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, estudio Administración Hotelera y su mayor sueño es tener su empresa de juegos infantiles. Susy tiene juegos infantiles que alquila, su negocio se ubica los fines de semana en un parque de la ciudad en donde alquila sus juegos. Susy necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pelotas. Susy tiene proyectado abrir una tienda u otro negocio mas estable.
texts.en:
Susy is the president of the Las Brisas communal Bank, and the loans she has received so far have helped her immensely in her business. She is married and she has three children, and she is studying hotel administration. Her biggest dream is to have a children's sports equipment company. She has children's toys that she rents. Her business is setup in a park in the city on weekends, where she rents her equipment. Susy needs a loan of 2,000 Soles which she will invest in the purchase of more balls. Her plan is to open a store, or some other business which is more stable

Translated from Spanish by Aaron Cannon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of balls

loans.name: Lila

texts.es:
Lila es fiscal del Banco Comunal Las Brisas y lo que mas le gusta son los prestamos fáciles. Lila es soltera y tiene 1 hijo, Lila vende abarrotes, golosinas que reparte a diferentes tiendas al por mayor sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima, además Lila trabaja en un empresa como vendedora. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y volver a estudiar su carrera de psicología.

Lila necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles que será invertido en la compra de golosinas variadas.
texts.en:
Lila is the Procedures Officer of the Communal Bank of Las Brisas; her favorite part about group membership is how easy it is to take out a loan. Lila is unmarried and has one child, Lila sells groceries and candies that she delivers to different stores, mostly within Lima. Additionally, Lila works in a company as a sales woman. Her dream is to grow her business and go back to studying psychology. Lila needs a loan of 1000 soles which will be invested purchasing various candies.

Translated from Spanish by Halea Meese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of candies

loans.name: Nang's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Nang L. is the group leader selected by four people located in Ba Srae village in Takeo province. All the members will use a small piece of the loan for different purposes to improve their businesses in the future. Mrs. Nang L. was born in 1949. Now she is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land where she can cultivate rice to sell to support her family. She is a pig breeder, too. Since her breeding is going well, she wants to expand. So to improve this breeding, Mrs. Nang L. is requesting a loan to buy pig food. She is a widow with a child who is an ice cream seller.

loans.use: To buy pig food

loans.name: Pren

texts.en: Every day, Mrs. P. hurries to wake up before dawn and travels to where the fishermen work. She buys their fish in bulk and comes back to sell the fish at the small market for a profit. Her husband earns an income climbing palm trees to tap juice and boilit  into sugar for sale. The couple work  together to generate enough income to support their three school-aged kids. They have an older child who is now married. Mrs. P. will be using her first loan to buy more fish to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Savy

texts.en: Mrs. Savy H. is 30 years old and lives in Trapeang Ta Uy village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Sothy Koam, are farmers who own two hectares of land and a plowing machine to support their crop. In order to increase their income to improve the family living conditions, Mrs. Savy H. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. This couple has three children. Two of the children attend the local school and the youngest one is just two years old.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Sorm's Group

texts.en:
Two women comprise this loan group, both residents of a commune in Siem Reap Province. Mrs. Sorm R., a 57-year-old local farmer who raises pigs, leads the group. Married and currently responsible for six children, all of whom are attending school, she is the family's main income-earner. To help meet the family's expenses, her husband works as a construction worker.

Sorm R. hopes to use the loan she has requested to buy a motorbike to provide transportation for the family. The other borrower, Mrs. Y., is a pig breeder seeking a loan to buy more piglets for her stall.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to provide transportation for family.

loans.name: Sreyyi

texts.en: Mrs. Sreyyi H. is 61 years old and lives in Mea Neak village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Yarng Pen, are farmers who own three hectares of land and a threshing machine to support their farming crop. This couple can earn a small income when someone rents their threshing machine. Mrs. Sreyyi H. now is requesting a loan to buy two wheels for the threshing machine. This couple has two children. One of the children is a seamstress in a garment factory and the other one is a student in the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy two wheels

loans.name: Savet

texts.en: Mrs. Savet P. is 30 years old and lives in Mea Neak village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Chhoeun Tith, are farmers who own five hectares of land to cultivate rice. For this farm, Mrs. Savet P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the farming crop. Aside from farming, Mrs. Savet P. is a grocery seller and Mr. Chhoeun Tith is a teacher in the local school. With these businesses, they can earn a small income to support and improve their family's living conditions. This couple has two children who attend the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Mrs. Nop Seng Village Bank Group

texts.en: Ten people located in Svay Sar village in TaK. province have selected Mrs. Nop S. as the village bank president. All those members make up a village bank loan and they will each use a small piece of the loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Nop S. is 29 years old. She is a pig breeder and she is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to support her family. Now she has a problem because her field has infertile soil. So to improve production, Mrs. Nop S. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer. Her husband, Mr. Em Thorn, is a construction worker. She is a mother of two children. One of the children is a student in the local public school and the other one is just three years old. Mrs. Phoeurn Nak is a group guarantor so she is presented in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Yumjirdulam

texts.en:
Yumjirdulam A., 39, lives with her husband and two sons in a traditional housing tent called a ger in Uvurhangai Province in Mongolia. Since 2001 she has been operating a meat-trading business, purchasing meat at wholesale prices. She has a rented stall in the biggest market of the province, while her husband provides transportation services with his own car.

An open-hearted and generous woman, Yumjirdulam says, “ I am trying my best to keep my business stable.” She is now requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase meat and livestock at wholesale prices

loans.use: To purchase meat and livestock to sell

loans.name: Rum

texts.en: Mr. Rum N. is 33 years old and lives in Mea Neak village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns two hectares of land to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, he is also a duck egg breeder who earns a small income to support his family. To support these businesses, Mr. Rum N. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and to buy duck food for duck breeding. His wife, Mrs. Sophea Khann, is a grocery seller, who owns a small store to support her business. This couple has two children who attend the local school. His wife is in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and duck food

loans.name: Mrs. Lean Khut Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has eight people who live in Svay Sar village in Takeo province. They will each use a small piece of the loan for a different purpose to improve their businesses. All the other members have selected Mrs. Lean K. as the village bank president. She was born in 1975. She is a farmer who owns 2.3 hectares of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. She is a pig breeder, too. Now she has a problem because her pigs are too small to sell and she did not have enough money to support them. So to improve this business, Mrs. Lean K. is requesting a loan to buy pig food. Her husband, Mr. Koeun Yim, owns a rice mill at his home. With these businesses, they support four children who are all students in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy pig food

loans.name: Phen's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phen S., 45, is a married woman and raises a few pigs to earn a living. Phen S. lives with her 44-year-old husband who has been distilling white wine, and they are able to earn the formal revenue to support any daily expenses of their family. The couple is blessed with six children, of whom two are now married and the others are single. 

Phen S. has applied for a loan to add to her savings in order to purchase a used motorbike, so she can use it to travel without hiring a taxi. Mrs. Phen S. is the group leader for a two-member group who will jointly repay the Kiva loan. Mrs. C., 31, is a farmer. C. is requesting a loan to repair an old motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorbike

loans.name: Kear

texts.en: Mrs. Kear H. is 46 years old and lives in Ream Andaeuk village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Mon Marng, are farmers who own two hectares of land to cultivate rice and cane for a living. For this farm, Mrs. Kear H. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support her crops. Aside from farming, Mrs. Kear H. is also a Khmer noodle seller in the local village. She earns a small income to support her family. This couple has five children. One of the children is a seamstress in a garment factory and the other four are students and also support their parent's businesses. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Arstaddulam

texts.en:
Artsaddulam C., age 40, lives with her family in a traditional housing tent called a 'ger' in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Their living conditions are good. She started her business career making shoes. Her husband is a driver and has been transporting raw materials from other sub-provinces. 

Artsaddulam is an easy-going, friendly, and precise woman. She says, “We would like to complete our house by this autumn and my dream is to have my own workplace.” She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase raw materials and complete her house.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and complete her house

loans.name: Rotana

texts.en: Mrs. Rotana P. is a 27-year-old married woman who lives in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Reth Mov, are farmers who own one hectare of land and a plowing machine to cultivate rice. In order to support this farm, Mrs. Rotana P. decided to ask for a loan to purchase a water machine and the rest of the loan she wants use to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and pesticide and to pay for a laborer to plow her farm. Aside from farming, Mr. Reth Mov, is also a construction worker where he receives a small salary to support his family living. This couple has two children. One of the children is a student and the other one is too young to study or work. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To purchase a water machine, fertilizer, rice seed, and pesticide and to pay for laborer to plow her farm.

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeun K. is 50 years old and lives in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Choun Chea (who is shown with her in the photo), are farmers who own 1 hectare (2.5 acres) of land they use to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, they also breed ducks for duck eggs and are able to earn a small income to support their family.

To support both businesses, Mrs. Soeun K. decided to ask for a loan to pay for a laborer to plow her farm, to buy rice seed and fertilizer to support the farm crop, and to buy duck feed for their ducks.

This couple has a child who is a duck breeder who supports the parents’ businesses.

loans.use: To pay a laborer to plow her farm, to buy rice seed and fertilizer, and to buy duck feed

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam S. is 35 years old and lives in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 2.5 hectares (6.25 acres) of land she uses to cultivate rice for a living. Beside being a farmer, she is also a vegetable and meal seller who owns a small store to support her business. With these two businesses she can earn a small income to support her family.

In order to support her farm crop and her grocery business, Mrs. Sam S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and rice seed to support her farming and more vegetables and meal for her store.

Mrs. Sam S. is a widow with two children who both attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer and pesticide for her farm plus vegetables and meal for her store

loans.name: Mrs. Navy Kha Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of fifteen people who are villagers in Ta Khon village in Takeo province. Mrs. Navy K. is the village bank president, selected by the other members. Each member will use a small piece of the loan for their different purpose.

Mrs. Navy K. owns a general store at her home where she can earn some money from selling groceries. She is the mother of four children who are all enrolled in the local public school. Her husband, Mr. Saret Sau, is a teacher.

Although this couple tries to work hard, they earn less income than needed to support their family. So, to improve this condition, Mrs. Navy K. is asking for a loan to buy a mother pig and piglets for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: To buy a mother pig and piglets

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy N. is from Barangay Upper Magsaysay, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 28 years old, is married, and has one infant child. Joy owns and operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP when she sells a raised pig. In 2010, Joy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: So Nai

texts.en:
Mrs. So Nai P. is a 25-year-old married woman who lives in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1 hectare (2.5 acres) of land she uses to cultivate rice. She is also a pig breeder at home and is able to earn a small income to support her family.

In order to support both businesses, Mrs. So Nai P. decided to ask for a loan to pay a laborer to plow her farm, to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her farm crop, and to buy pig feed for her pig breeding business.

Mrs. So Nai P.’s husband, Mr. Makara Ban, is a vet who earns a small income to add to his wife’s savings to improve the family living. Her husband is shown with her in the photo. They does not have any children.

loans.use: To pay a laborer to plow her farm, to buy fertilizer and pesticide, and to buy pig feed

loans.name: Enhmagnai

texts.en:
Enhmagnai D., 42 years old, lives with her husband and two sons in their own house in Uvurhangai province. Since her husband started his business in 2007 transporting raw materials, they have expanded the business type to coal, firewood transport, and trading. They are interested in enlarging the operation still more. 

Enhmagnai is very generous and tidy. She is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a car in order to develop her business activity.

loans.use: To purchase a car to develop her business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn B. is from the village of San Manuel, Naguillan, Isabela. She is 33 years old. Marilyn is married and has three young children. To make a living, Marilyn operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling vegetables in the local community. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 3,200 Philippine pesos a month from it. In 2009, Marilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the second loan taken out by Marilyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small-scale entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhom P. is a 45-year-old villager who lives in Andoung Samretth village in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 3 hectares of land in which to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, she is also a grocery seller and owns a small store to support her business. 

With both businesses, she can earn a small income to support her family. In order to support both businesses, Mrs. Sokhom P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, rice seed and pesticide, and to pay for a laborer to plow her farm. With the rest of the loan, she wants to buy more groceries to expand her business activities. 

Mrs. Sokhom P. is a widow with one child, who is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed and pesticide, and to pay for a laborer to plow her farm

loans.name: Mandahtuya

texts.en:
Mandahtuya T. is 48 years old and lives with her son in a traditional housing tent called a 'ger' in Hovd province, western Mongolia. Her daughter is married and another son is working on a road project in Bayan-Ulgii province. During the monitoring, she has been living alone. 

Since 1989, she has been working as a retailer and has obtained much experience in this field. Mandahtuya is a reliable client of XacBank with a good loan profile. She is a hard-working woman with a good manner and behavior. She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase and import food products such as rice, sugar, and flour from China.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. Heng C. is a 57-year-old villager who lives in Andoung Samretth village in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 3 hectares of land in which to cultivate rice and she can also earn some income through selling cakes.

In order to increase her income to improve her family's living conditions and in order to support her farming, Mrs. Heng C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. With the rest of the loan, she wants to buy fertilizer, pesticide and rice seeds for her crop. Mrs. Heng C. is a widow with two children; one is an iron welder while the second one is a farmer.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding and to buy fertilizer, pesticide and rice seeds

loans.name: Thoeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoeurn T. has been selling various types of fish and some vegetables at the market for years. She typically generates an income of $3.33 per day. Additionally, she built a stall next to her house where she fattens a few pigs for extra profit. She has been married for a long time and has four kids. Two of her children are now married and the remaining two are single. Most of them are employed and contribute a small income to the family. 

Thoeurn T. has a life partner in her husband who earns income, fishing and cultivating rice. Thoeurn T. is taking out her loan to increase her business capital. With any remaining cash from the loan, she will buy more implements for her husband use to fish.

loans.use: To increase the business capital.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn D. G. is from the village of Brgy.Buliwao,Quezon,Nueva Vizcaya. She is 34 years old. Jovelyn is married and has four infant children. To make a living, Jovelyn raises livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for breeding. Jovelyn has been engaged in her business for more than eight years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jovelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jovelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Jovelyn is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Jovelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Mrs. Chhon Nheb Village Bank Group

texts.en: Sixteen people from Ta Khon village in Takeo province are requesting a village bank loan. They will each use a portion of the loan for different purposes, most buying something to improve their businesses. Mrs. Chhon N. is the group leader selected by the other members. Her position is a fish seller at her local market. Her husband, Mr. Choeurn Chea, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he grows rice to sell to support his family. Now she has some problems because the soil in her husband’s field is infertile, and it is far away from an irrigation system. To improve production, Mrs. Chhon N. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline, and to rent a plow to plow the rice field. The rest of the loan will be used to buy more fish to resell. She is the mother of two children who are attending a local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline, and fish; to rent a plow

loans.name: Neang Chhay

texts.en: Mrs. Neang Chhay S. is 34 years old and lives in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 3-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice. She also sells groceries at her home to earn additional income to support her family. Mrs. Neang Chhay S. is requesting a loan to pay a laborer to plow her farm and to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her crops. She wants to use the rest of the loan to buy piglets for breeding and pig feed. Mrs. Neang Chhay S. is a widow with a child, who is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To pay a laborer to plow her farm, to buy fertilizer and pesticide, and to buy piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta M. is from the village of Brgy Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 38 years old and married with three small children. To make a living, Marieta has a retail store selling AVON and MSE (Marikina Shoe Exchange) products. She has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Marieta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marieta is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Marieta from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Mindulam

texts.en:
Mindulam J. is 29 years old and lives with her family in a traditional housing tent called a 'ger' in Uvurhangai province, central Mongolia. There are five members in the family. Her parents are retired. 

Since 2000, she has been purchasing glass bottles standing outside of the provincial market and supplying them to the beverage and brewery manufacturing concerns and Ulaanbaatar, the capital city as well. Mindulam is an even-tempered, kind, and hard-working woman. The family wishes they could pay the tuition fees of the youngest son of the family who is a student in Ulaanbaatar and expand their business into farming. 

Mindulam J. is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase various types of glass bottles at retail prices.

loans.use: To purchase glass bottles

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Mrs. Oun H. is 40 years old and lives in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 4 hectares (10 acres) of land she uses to cultivate rice while her husband, Mr. Kov Khim, earns a small income to support his family through breeding ducks for duck eggs. Her husband is shown with her in the photo.

For supporting both these businesses, Mrs. Oun H. decided to ask for a loan to pay a laborer to plow her farm, to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her farming, and to buy duck feed for her husband’s duck business.

This couple has three children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory while the other two are students in the local school.

loans.use: To pay a laborer to plow her farm, to buy fertilizer and pesticide, and to buy duck feed

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita B. is from the village of San Manuel, Naguilian, Isabela. She is 63 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Nenita owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling vegetables in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2008, Nenita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fifth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nouch

texts.en:
Mrs. Nouch H. is 41 years old and lives in Lieb village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Ven Morm, are farmers who own 2.5 hectares (6.25 acres) of land they use to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, Mr. Ven Morm is also a fish seller, able to earn a small profit to support his family. He is shown in the picture with his wife.

Mrs. Nouch H. is now requesting a loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer and to pay a laborer to plow her farm. With the rest of the loan, she wants to buy more fish to support her husband’s business.

This couple has five children: one is a laborer at the Thai border, three are students in the local school and also support their parents’ farming activities, while the youngest one is 4 years old.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer, to pay a laborer to plow her farm, and to buy fish for her husband's business

loans.name: Mrs. Nouch Hin Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twelve people make up this village bank loan in Chy Chrab village in TaK. province and the members have selected Mrs. NO. H. as the village bank president. She was born in 1979 and now she is a farmer who owns a two-hectare (5-acre) plot of land she uses to cultivate rice to support herself and her family.

Now Mrs. NO. H. has a problem because she wants to buy a buffalo but she has a little money to buy it. So, to achieve this purpose, she is seeking a loan to add to her money to buy a buffalo.

She is single with a member household.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo

loans.name: Ely

texts.en: Ely G. is from the village of San Manuel, Naguilian, Isabela. She is 53 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Ely owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Ely joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Ely is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophat B. is 51 years old and lives in Preal village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Seng Soam, are farmers who own 2 hectars of land where they grow corn, beans and rice. Mrs. Sophat B. also sells groceries at home to earn a small profit and support her family.

In order to support the farming crops and her grocery business, Mrs. Sophat B. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and corn and bean seeds to help her grow crops. With the rest of the loan she will buy more groceries to enlarge her business activities.

Mrs. Sophat B. is a mother of four children; one is a laborer in Malaysia, one works at a garment factory, and the other two attend the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and corn and bean seed.

loans.name: Jaycel

texts.en:
Jaycel T. is from the village of San Manuel, Naguillan, Isabela. She is 22 years old and single. To make a living Jaycel sells mobile phone credit loads in the local community. Jaycel is just starting this business.

In 2008, Jaycel joined ASKI to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jaycel successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from ASKI. She is requesting her fourth loan, for 9000 PHP, which she will use to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue to expand her business.

About ASKI

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Mrs. Run Sing Village Bank Group

texts.en: The eleven people in this group loan have selected Mrs. Run S. is the village bank president in Chy Chrab village in TaK. province. All the members in this group loan will use a small piece of the loan for different purposes, with the goal of improving their business. Mrs. Run S. was born in 1974. She is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell, the proceeds of which she uses to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Ramorn T., is a motorbike taxi driver. They try to work hard, yet she struggles to improve her income. So to improve the living conditions of her family, Mrs. Run S. is applying for a loan to buy two piglets for breeding in order to start a new business, while the rest of the loan she will use to buy fertilizer and rent the plow machine to tend her field. She is a mother of three children, all of whom are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy two piglets for breeding to start a new business.

loans.name: Tay

texts.en:
Tay P., age 27, lives in a rural area of the province of Siem Reap, which is the best territory for farming. She is a single woman who currently resides with her youngest sister in the family home. Her sister is an employee in a guest house. 

Tay P. owns a medium-sized farmland that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows various crops as well as raising a few pigs on it. For the coming rainy season, when farming is possible, Tay P. needs a loan to buy farm supplies for the purpose of growing crops.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for the purpose of growing crops

loans.name: Nhinh

texts.en: Mrs. Nhinh P. is 49 years old and is a villager in Tuol Kandal village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Keo Nget, are farmers who own 2.50 hectares of land to cultivate rice. In order to support their crop, Mrs. Nhinh P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay to rent a water machine. Aside from farming, Mr. Keo Nget also owns a truck for soil digging, which can earn a small income to support his family's living conditions. This couple has a child, who works as a soil digging truck driver.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay to rent a water machine.

loans.name: Soth

texts.en: Mrs. Soth D. is 51 years old and is a villager in Melong Khang Cheung village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 2 hectares of land to cultivate rice. For this farm, Mrs. Soth D. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support her farming crop. Her husband, Mr. Thin Chin, owns a wedding and funeral store which he rents, allowing him to earn a small revenue to support his family. This couple (pictured together) has three children; one is a teacher, another a driver, while the last one is a student.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline.

loans.name: Hing

texts.en:
Mrs. Hing M. is 39 years old and is a villager who lives in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 2 hectare of land where she cultivates rice and vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Samnang Brakk, is a police officer who receives a small salary to support his family.

In order to increase income to improve the family's living standard, Mrs. Hing M. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. With the rest of the loan she wants to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her farming crops.

The couple has two children who are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding and also to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa I. is from the village of San Fermin, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 59 years old. Jesusa is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Jesusa runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Aside from that, she also sells rice in her store. Jesusa has been engaged in her business for more than 14 years and earns approximately 9,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jesusa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jesusa is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Jesusa from ASKI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: An

texts.en:
Mrs. An L., 37 years old, lives in the province of Siem Reap, Cambodia, where she owns and farms a plot of land next to her house, growing mushrooms to sell when they come to maturity. She plants her crops twice a year, and she was taught how to grow mushrooms by her grandparents. She has been married for many years to her husband, but this couple has no children yet. Her husband assists with her in planting mushrooms. In addition, he also teaches his nearby villagers how to plant mushrooms well for a fee. 

Mrs. An L. has requested a loan to purchase essential equipment that she uses to establish more locations for growing mushrooms.

loans.use: To establish more locations for growing mushrooms

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita V. is from the village of Brgy. Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 37 years old. Emerita is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Emerita raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising chickens for sale. Emerita has been engaged in her business for more than eight years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos a month from it.

In 2007, Emerita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emerita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. 

Emerita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Emerita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Mrs. Koem Seng Sar Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of 15 people who live in Srae Pou village in the Takeo province. Mrs. Koem Seng S. is the village bank president who was selected by the other members, all of whom will use a small piece of the loan for different purposes. She was born in 1980. Her position is a weaver at her home. Her husband Mr. Sokchea Toun is a farmer who owns a 3-hectare plot of land on which he grows rice to sell to support his family. Her problem is that her husband’s field has infertile soil and it is far away from an irrigation system. So to improve production, Mrs. Koem Seng S. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. 

She is a mother of three children, two of whom are attending a local public school, while the youngest one is 2 years old. Mrs. Net Choub is a group guaranty, so she is presented in the picture. All the members are shown in the picture but one of them is blocked.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Julie Ann

texts.en:
Julie Ann C. is from the village of Brgy. Sto. Domingo, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 36 years old. Julie Ann is married and has 4 infant-aged children. To make a living, Julie Ann owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Julie Ann has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,400 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Julie Ann joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julie Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Julie Ann is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand the product offering. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Julie Ann from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Mr. Vorn T. and his wife, Mrs. Soeun Norn, have been married since 1980 and have eight children: six sons and two daughters. One of them is married and lives outside the family home; two children are silk weavers, and two other children attend school, one has full-time employment, and one is a garment factory worker, while another child is young and stays at home. Vorn was not there for the photo, but his wife was available instead. 

Vorn is a farmer. He grows corn, sesame, cucumbers, and ginger. His wife has been a silk weaver since she was 20 years old. He hopes to continue increasing the volume of his produce, so he is requesting a loan of US$ 300 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm

loans.name: Jonelyn

texts.en:
Jonelyn D. V. is from the village of Brgy. Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 34 years old. Jonelyn is married and has 3 infant-aged children. To make a living, Jonelyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale. Jonelyn has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jonelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jonelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Jonelyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Jonelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield.

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en:
Arthur B. is from the village of Brgy. Upper Magsaysay, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 34 years old. Arthur is married and has 4 infant-aged children. To make a living, Arthur owns & operates a business venture in the services sector providing transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from motorcycle transport services. Arthur has been engaged in his business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Arthur joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arthur is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair existing vehicles to provide better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Arthur from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicles to provide better service.

loans.name: Mrs. Sokha Mul Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fifteen people selected Mrs. Sokha M. as the village bank president of their group, located in Srae Pou village in Takeo province. The group members will each use a small piece of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sokha M. is 41 years old. She is a farmer who owns a one point four-hectare plot of land where she can grow rice to sell to support her family.

Now she has some problems, because her field is infertile and it is far away from an irrigation system. So to improve production, Mrs. Sokha M. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. Her husband, Mr. Vy Horm, is a mechanic at his home. She is a mother of four children, one of whom is a motorbike taxi driver, while the others are attending the local public school. Mrs. Sarat Soung is a group member, so she is presented in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha P. (pictured here), age 36 years old, is a widow with one son and two daughters. She lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penn, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Sokha has been operating a business selling jasmine flowers since she was young. She grows them on her own and buys some from her village and transports them to sell in Phnom Penh market. 

Sokha does not have enough capital to purchase jasmine flowers under contract for resale, so she is requesting her first loan in the amount of US$ 500 to increase her capital.

loans.use: To buy jasmine flowers under contract for resale

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
56-year-old Lerma G. is a very simple and well-mannered woman. She dreams of having a life that is plain and peaceful along with her very loving and supportive husband and children.

Without much in the way of educational achievements and exposure to other people, Lerma was shy and reserved. However, to raise her children well and have them attain a college degree, she tried to overcome her inferiority complex. Her husband supports all her endeavors to develop her self-confidence.

Aside from dreaming of having her own business to augment the income of her husband as a technician in the Department of Agriculture, Lerma also dreams of seeing herself making friends with other women in their village and wishes to become an inspiration to her fellow poor mothers.

In 1998, Lerma joined ASHI and received a loan. It was the first time she joined an institution and she felt excited receiving the loan she requested. With that loan, and succeeding loans she received, the hog-fattening and hog-breeding business she put up with the support of her husband has grown bigger.

They became known to people in town and from other towns because of the good quality of the piglets they breed for selling. They also have a boar-for-hire business which is managed by Lerma’s husband and her youngest son. With that business, Lerma has been able to have a cash flow for the education of her children.

Lerma was inspired to work really hard because she saw a lot of potential in her children and they were very determined to have a college degree. Now all of them have their own families to support, yet Lerma is very happy because they have all graduated from college. At least now, she can focus to making her business stable and put up a savings fund for her and her husband’s old age. She doesn’t want to bother her children anymore about their financial needs because she understands that they have their own lives to take care of.

loans.use: To purchase high-breed piglets for her hog breeding and fattening business

loans.name: Vei

texts.en:
Mrs. Vei V. is a 45-year-old farmer who lives in a rural area of Siem Reap Province. She is married to Sim Song, age 45. This couple, who work together in their farming business, has five children: one of the children is married and four are single.

The family plants its crops twice a year, and they were taught how to grow mushrooms by their grandparent.

Due to the coming farming season, Vei V. wants to have a cultivating machine to provide a plowing service for other farmers. As she lacks the money to buy one, she has decided to request a loan from Kiva. She will use these funds to buy a machine to begin providing her service. As well as that. she will use the machine to plow her own farmland.

loans.use: To buy a cultivating machine

loans.name: Chita

texts.en: Mr. Chita S. is 40 years old and lives in Smaong Village in Takeo Province. He and his wife, Mrs. Srytouch Cheng, are farmers who own 1.50 hectares of land upon which they cultivate rice. He is also a cow middleman, earning additional income to support the family.  Chita is now requesting a loan to buy ten piglets and pig food for pig breeding in order to improve the family's living standard. This couple has three children, all students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy ten piglets and pig food

loans.name: Eleonora

texts.en:
Eleonora J., from the village of Brgy. Sto. Domingo, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya, is 42, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Eleonora owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over 15 years, she earns approximately 6500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Eleonora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 22,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be Eleonora's ninth loan from ASKI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy L. is from the village of Malasin. She is 41 years old, is married, and has six school-aged children. Mercy owns and operates a business selling fruits and vegetables in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Mercy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to have additional inventory and working capital. Mercy is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her seventh from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas.
