Seven years ago with the initial investment of 10000 soms ($216.82) Zhiparkul’s husband started his car repair business and now earns 30000 soms ($650.47) per month. With money received from the loan they are planning to purchase spare parts to repair the vehicles. In the future Zhiparkul and her husband hope to expand their business to improve their living conditions.

Zhiprakul S. 44, is the treasurer of the group. Her husband works as a shoemaker, and they have a 16-year-old-son who is a student. Four years ago Zhiparkul got a loan of 12000 soms ($260.19) and began selling children’s clothes on the market and now earns 24000 soms ($520.38) per month. She applied for the loan to purchase summer season clothes and increase the turnover.

Aida T., 30, is married to a taxi-driver. They have a three-year-old son and five-year-old daughter. Aida works as a teaching assistant in a kindergarten classroom. She and her husband make 7100 soms ($153.94) per month. With money received from the loan, Aida wants to purchase a washing machine in order to improve their living conditions.

Mairamkul I. 40, has three daughters, two of them studying at school while the third is just three years old. Her husband works as a railroad assistant engineer. In order to make money, Mairamkul has been selling fish for six years, earning 15000 soms ($325.23) per month. With money received from the loan, Mairamkul plans to purchase two beds and buy more fish to resell.

Karypbek S., 55, is married to a factory worker earning 7500 soms ($162.61) per month. They have three children, all attending school. With money received from the loan, Karypbek wants to purchase a fridge to improve their living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young, ambitious and socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). Mol Bulak is the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the Mol Bulak Finance staff.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to repair vehicles

loans.name: Nam

texts.en: Mrs. Nam S. is 44 years old and lives in Kor village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Soeung Cheng, are farmers who own 1.50-hectare of land to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, Mrs. Nam S. is also a pig breeder and a silk weaver at home who can earn a small income to help care for her family. In order to support her pig breeding and silk weaving businesses, Mrs. Nam S. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig food and also to buy more silk for weaving. This couple has four children: one is a silk weaver, two are attending the local school, and the youngest one is 3 years old. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food for pig breeding

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey P. is a 25-year-old married woman who lives in Prey Ta Pong village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Vannak Khun, are farmers who own a plot of land they use to cultivate rice for a living. Beside farming, Mrs. Srey P. is also a pig breeder at home and is able to earn a small revenue to support her family.

For supporting both these businesses, Mrs. Srey P. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig feed for her pig-breeding and to buy fertilizer and gasoline to support her farming.

This couple has two children, who are 4 and 7 years old.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig feed plus fertilizer and gasoline for her farm

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en: Danilo M. is from the town of Surallah. He is 42 years old. Danilo is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Danilo raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Danilo has been engaged in his business for more than 14 years and earns approximately 4,500 Philippine pesos a month from it. Danilo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Danilo has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Danilo is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and other farm inputs. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Danilo from CEVI, a Kiva partner. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children and supplement his family's income. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also offers savings, insurance and training programs, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Dionita

texts.en: Dionita A., 68 years old, is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Dionita raises livestock. The main source of income for her business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Dionita has been engaged in her business for more than six years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos a month from it. In 2005, Dionita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dionita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI, a Kiva partner. Dionita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Dionita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also offers savings, insurance and training programs, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Rastam Group

texts.en: M. Bashir is the group leader of the Rastam group. He lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married. He has three children and they are in school. He wants to take a loan for his bakery business. He wants this loan to make his shop larger to expand and progress his business. This will help his family and he thanks AFS, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: Expand and progress his business

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
41-year-old Dolores C. is from the town of Surallah. She is married and has four school-aged children.

Dolores owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She also raises some hogs. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-three years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

Dolores joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Dolores is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure and feed for the hogs. This loan will be her sixth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure and feed for her hogs

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda C. is a 44-year-old active member of ASHI. As a matter of fact, she has been a member for thirteen years now and is one of the very good ones in terms of repayment, attendance at weekly center meetings and in maintaining the business she started using the first loan she received.

Merlinda obtained her loans to finance the sustainability of her business of creating sweet delicacies for “pasalubong” (a Tagalog word meaning "keepsake" or "presents". It is a souvenir brought for loved ones or friends.) - which is a part of typical Filipino culture.

The proceeds Merlinda made from her business enabled her to purchase a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) for a transportation business managed by her husband. Her four children have been able to obtain their immediate needs because of the income generated by Merlinda and her husband.

Now, Merlinda works harder to increase her profit by growing her business as well as maintaining the business of her husband to support the education of her two youngest children who are in high school and college until they earn a degree and have a better career. She hopes they do not follow the footsteps of their two elder siblings who have not finished their college education and became a tricycle driver and a contract-based sales lady in one of the stores in town instead.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of sweet delicacies for additional products as well as to repair her tricycle

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo A. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 57 years old, is married, and has one adult child.

Edgardo owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. He also owns a farm that he tills for planting rice crops. He has been engaged in his business for over eighteen years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

Edgardo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Edgardo is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and also farm inputs. This loan will be his ninth from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell and also farm inputs

loans.name: Mien

texts.en:
Mien H., 26, is a low-income person currently living in Siem Reap Province. To earn a living, she sells vegetables that she grows herself on her own farmland; additionally, she buys fresh fish in bulk to sell retail. Typically, she earns an average of $2 a day as support for her family.

Mien H.’s husband is currently selling firewood that he obtains from the forest. However, he faces the fact that he doesn’t have a cart to transport his firewood from the forest. In order to solve this problem, Mien H. requests a loan to purchase a cart her husband can attach to a horse to use to pick up the wood.

This young couple has been married for years, but they do not have any children.

loans.use: To purchase a cart for her husband's business

loans.name: Azizahon's Group

texts.en: Azizahon S. is the leader of this group. She is 53 and her husband works as a builder. They have a son who is 22 and he works in construction, too. Azizahon has been cultivating fruits and vegetables and breeding cattle for twenty-one years. When the other members of the family are free, they help her with these activities. By selling some fruits and vegetables, and sometimes cattle, she makes 2,500 soms (approximately 54 USD) per month. Now she wants to obtain a loan to purchase more farm animals for breeding and fattening. In the future, she plans to build a new house and purchase a vehicle. Nazhimidin M. is 52 and has two sons and a daughter: his daughter works as a teacher at the school; his older son works in construction; and the second son went to Russia to work to make some money. Nazhimidin and his wife breed cattle; they started this activity twenty years ago with the initial investment of 1,800 soms (approximately 39 USD) and now, by selling some cattle after fattening, they make 2,500 soms (approximately 54 USD) a month. Nazhimidin applied for the loan, because he needs money to purchase a bull-calf for breeding. In the future he plans to build a new house and purchase a vehicle. Sobirahon M. is 49 and her husband works as a private driver. They have two daughters and a son: the older son went to Russia to work to make some money and the daughters are students. Seventeen years ago, with the initial investment of 4,500 soms (approximately 97 USD), Sobirahon bought cattle and, from that time, she started to breed and sell them after fattening. In this way she makes 3,000 soms (approximately 65 USD) per month. With the money received from this loan, Sobirahon wants to purchase a cow for breeding. Holidahon A. is 25 and is the treasurer of the group. Her husband works as a baker and they have a daughter and a son, both of whom go to school. Holidahon has a piece of land where she cultivates potatoes, rice and corn. With the money received from the loan she wants to pay for tractor services and buy fertilizer for her farm. In the future, Holidahon plans to open a kiosk and sell convenience goods. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase farm animals for breeding

loans.name: Sangin

texts.ru: Назаров Сангин проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 51 год. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Сангин имеет средне - специальное образование, "Продавец". Работает по профессии. У него магазин, где он продает продукты питания. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 15 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Sangin N. lives in the Vahdat district. He is 51 years old, married and has 4 children. His wife is a homemaker. Sangin has a secondary-specialized education as a salesperson. He works in his field. Sangin has a store, where he sells food products. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. He is requesting this loan in order to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Mirzoali

texts.ru: Нормаматов Мирзоали проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 41 год. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Жена работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сам Мирзоали подрабатывает строительными работами по найму. Кроме того занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет небольшой участок земли, где сажает овощи для перепродажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 7 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Mirzoali N. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 41 years old, married and has 3 children. His wife works at a dekhan farm. Mirzoali does construction work for hire. Besides this, he is also involved in agriculture. He has a small plot of land by his house, where he plants vegetables for subsequent resale. Mirzoali has been involved in this business for over 7 years. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Benkelema I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe BENKELEMA I sont des femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 5 enfants et  vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à SOKOURANI un des villages de la commune de KADIOLO préfecture  de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième collaborations avec l’institution, les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : l’arachide (par CHITAN T.), le maïs et le haricot. 
Avec son nouveau prêt, CHITAN T. compte acheter des intrants et les petits matériels pour entretenir 2 Hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de KADIOLO et de ZEGOUA après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150.000FCFA après la campagne, qui sera utilisé pour soutenir les frais de scolarité des enfants et les soins de santé  de la familles.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group BENKELEMA I are married women who, on average, are 40-years old and have 5 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in SOKOURANI, one of the villages in the commune of KADIOLO in the Sikasso prefecture (3rd administrative region of Mali). They work in collaboration with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance organization to carry out their agricultural activities during the winter. This is their fourth time collaborating with the organization, and past loans were repaid without incident. The crops cultivated are peanuts (by CHITAN T.), corn and beans. With the new loan, CHITAN T. will purchase planting supplies and small farming tools to maintain 2 hectares. The crops are sold in the village to both male and female customers at the KADIOLO and ZEGOUA markets. Once the crop year is over, she hopes to make an average profit of 150.000 FCFA, which will be used to pay for the children’s tuition fees and the family’s healthcare expenses.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of planting supplies and small farming tools

loans.name: United Women Group

texts.en: Mekie K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called United Women. She is 37 years old, single and has three children between nine and 19 years old, all of them in school. She also cares for one sibling. Mekie was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial difficulties. For 10 years, she has been selling used clothes on Camp Johnson Road, down town Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bags of used clothes. Her hope is to improve her business and take good care of her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes.

loans.name: Yes Yes Group

texts.en: Nancy J., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Yes Yes. She is 30 years old, single and has two children, 7 and 13 years old. She was only able to attend school through 9th grade due to poverty. All of her children are in school. For 5 years, she has been selling crushed rocks at the S.K.D Boulevard on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy shovels and hammers for rock crushing. Her dream is to leave rock crushing and move to a more lucrative venture.

loans.use: To buy shovels and hammers for rock crushing.

loans.name: Benkelema Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe BENKELEMA II sont des femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à SOKOURANI un des villages de la commune de KADIOLO préfecture  de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième collaborations avec l’institution, les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : le riz, l’arachide (par MAMOU O.), et le haricot. 
Avec son nouveau prêt, MAMOU O. compte acheter des intrants et des petits matériels pour entretenir 1Hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de KADIOLO et de ZEGOUA après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 80.000 FCFA après la campagne, qui sera utilisé pour soutenir les frais de scolarité des enfants et les soins de santé de la  famille.
Cette femme du groupe BENKELEMA II souhaite entretenir  sa collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’exploiter son champ au mieux pour en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The ten members of the BENKELEMA II group are married women who, on average, are 40 years old and have five children. Most are part of polygamous families in SOKOURANI, a village of the KADIOLO commune, in the Sikasso prefecture (Mali's 3rd administrative region). They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to carry out their agricultural activities during the winter. This is their fourth experience with the institution and the past loans went well. The crops cultivated are: rice, peanut (by MAMOU O.) and beans. With the new loan, MAMOU O. plans to buy supplies and small tools to maintain 1 Hectare. After harvest, the production will be sold in the village and in the KADIOLO and ZEGOUA markets to both men and women. She plans to make an average profit of 80.000 CFA after the crop year, which will help pay for the children's schooling and family health costs. This woman from the BENKELEMA II group wishes to maintain her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so as to make the most of her field and make more profit.

Translated from French by Loïc Haméon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying small supplies and small agricultural tools.

loans.name: Balaba

texts.fr: Balaba G. est une femme de 46 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DIAOBE MANDING dont elle est la trésorière depuis le 10 juin 2002 et a 15 fois de suite reçu de crédit. Elle fait de la production et vente de pâte d'arachide depuis plus de 10 ans. Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer sa production et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Son mari étant malade pendant plusieurs années, son objectif est d'assurer les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Balaba G. is a 46-year-old woman. She is married and a mother of 6. She is a member of the DIAOBE MANDING village bank, of which she is the treasurer since the 10th of June 2002. She received loans 15 times and she has been making and selling peanut paste for more than 10 years. Her new loan will allow her to increase her production and to better satisfy her customers. Her husband has been sick for several years, so she aims to pay for the family's daily expenses and her children's schooling.

Translated from French by Loïc Haméon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her working capital

loans.name: Benkelema Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe BENKELEMA III sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans, 3 enfants et vivant dans des  familles polygames à SOKOURANI un des villages de la commune de KADIOLO préfecture  de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième collaborations avec l’institution, les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : le riz (par AWA B.), l’arachide et le haricot. 
Avec son nouveau prêt, AWA B. compte acheter des semences, des engrais herbicides, des petits matériels et payer des frais de labour et de sarclage  pour entretenir 1Hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de KADIOLO  et de ZEGOUA après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 70.000 FCFA après la campagne, qui sera utilisé pour soutenir les frais de scolarité des enfants et les soins de santé  de la famille.
AWA B. du groupe BENKELEMA III souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso  fin d’exploiter au maximum sa parcelle culturale au mieux pour en tirer plus de bénéfices.
texts.en:
The five members of the BENKELEMA III group are married women averaging 28 years of age with three children, who live in polygamous families in SOKOURANI, one of the villages in the commune of KADIOLO, prefecture of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali). They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farming activities during the winter. This is their fourth project with Soro Yiriwaso, and the previous loans have all been successfully repaid. The crops cultivated are: rice (grown by AWA B.), peanuts and beans. With her new loan, AWA B. plans to buy seeds, fertilizer/weed-killer, small equipment and also to pay for labor and hoeing charges to maintain 1 hectare. Following the harvest, produce is sold in villages, at the KADIOLO and ZEGOUA markets, to both men and women. AWA B. plans to make an average profit of 70,000 CFA francs after the harvest, and will use the money to pay for education for her children and health care for her family. AWA B. of the BENKELEMA III group wants to continue her work with Soro Yiriwso in order to make full use of her agricultural land so as to increase the benefit from the land.

Translated from French by Sarah Puchner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for labor, seeds, fertilizers, hoeing and small farm equipment

loans.name: Jiguitougou I Group

texts.fr:
Les huit membres du groupe JIGUITOUGOU I sont des femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à YINASSO un des villages de la commune de KADIOLO préfecture  de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième collaborations avec l’institution, les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : le mil, l’arachide (avec SALY O.) et le haricot. 
Avec son nouveau prêt, SALY O. compte acheter des intrants et des petits matériels pour entretenir 4Hectares . 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de KADIOLO et de ZEGOUA après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 275.000FCFA après la campagne, qui sera utilisé pour soutenir les frais de scolarité des enfants et les soins de santé de la  famille.
Elle  souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’exploiter ses espaces culturales au mieux pour en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The eight members of the JIGUITOUGOU I group are married women with a mean age of 40 and an average of 5 children. They live mostly in polygamous families in YINASSO, one of the villages in the the town of KADIOLO, prefecture of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to see their agricultural activities through the rainy season. They are in their fourth collaboration with the institution and past loans have all been repaid. Their crops include: millet, peanuts (from SALY O.) and beans. With her new loan, SALY O. plans on buying fertilizer and small equipment to maintain the 4 hectares. After the harvests, the crops are sold in the village at the KADIOLO and ZEGOUA markets to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to earn a profit of approximately 275,000 CFA after the harvest, which will be used to pay the school fees for the children and health care for the family. She hopes to continue this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso in order to make the most of her cultivation area and collect more earnings.

Translated from French by Meghan Davignon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and small agriculture equipment

loans.name: Daler

texts.ru: Хусейнов Далер проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 23 года. Женат, детей не имеет. Жена, преподает в средней школе. Сам Далер имеет среднее образование. Более 6 лет занимается растениеводством. Имеет небольшой участок земли, где сеет пшеницу, овощи для перепродажи. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Daler H. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 23 years old, married and has no children. His wife teaches at a secondary school. Daler has a secondary education. He has been involved in agriculture for over 6 years. He has a small plot of land, where he sows wheat and vegetables for resale. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Kadiatou

texts.fr: Kadiatou N. est une femme de 49 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants en charge et tutrice aussi de 5 autres qui lui sont confiés par des parents et des proches. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DIAOBE MANDING depuis le 10 juin 2002 et a 15 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Elle vend sur étale des légumes et produits halieutiques au marché et fait la transformation et vente de pâte d'arachide depuis son adhésion dans le Banc Villageois en 2002. L'objectif visé par son crédit est de satisfaire les besoins de la famille en terme de scolarité, santé et nourriture.
texts.en:
Kadiatou N. is a 49-year old woman, married and the mother of five dependent children; she also has five other children entrusted to her care by relatives. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Diaobe Manding since June 10, 2002, and obtained credit 15 times in the past. She retails vegetables and seafood products at the local market and also prepares and sells peanut sauce, a line of business she has been in since joining Banc Villageois in 2002. The reason for her loan is to help meet her family’s needs as regards schooling, healthcare and food.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening and promoting her business

loans.name: Jiguitougou Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les huit membres du groupe JIGUITOUGOU II sont des femmes mariées  ayant en moyenne 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à YINASSO un des villages de la commune de KADIOLO préfecture  de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième collaborations avec l’institution, les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
Les spéculations cultivées sont :le riz, le maïs (par DIATA B.), l’arachide et le mil. 
Avec son nouveau prêt, DIATA B. compte acheter des intrants (semences, engrais, herbicides) payer les frais de sarclage, de labour et des petits matériels pour entretenir 2 Hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de KADIOLO et de ZEGOUA après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 140.000 FCFA après la campagne, qui sera utilisé pour soutenir les frais de scolarité des enfants et les soins de santé  de la famille.
DIATA B. souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’exploiter ses espaces culturales au mieux pour en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The eight members of the JIGUITOUGOU group are married women, on average 40 years old with five children. Most live in polygamous families in Yinasso, one of the villages of the Kadiolo commune in the Sikasso prefecture (the third administrative region in Mali) . The women work with the microfinance partner Soro Yiriwaso to help with their agriculture during the low season. This is their fourth loan with Soro Yiriwaso; all the previous loans were repaid without incident. The crops the group cultivates are rice, peanuts, millet and maize (by DIATA B.). This loan will help DIATA B. buy supplies (seeds, fertilizer, herbicide), pay for the costs of weeding, labour, and other small items that are needed to maintain her two hectares. The crops will be sold in the village, and at the KADIOLO and ZEGOUA markets, to both men and women. She hopes to make about 140,000 francs (CFAF), which she will use to pay for her children's schooling and for her family's medical costs. DIATA B. wants to continue working with Soro Yiriwaso so she can make the best use of her land for agriculture.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying seed and supplies for agriculture

loans.name: Sabougnouma I Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA I sont des femmes mariées  qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans,  5 enfants et vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à DANGUELEDOUGOU un des villages de la commune de KADIOLO préfecture  de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième collaborations avec l’institution, les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : le riz, le maïs (par MARIAM K.), l’arachide et le haricot. 
Avec son nouveau prêt, MARIAM K. compte acheter, des intrants, des petits matériels agricoles et  les frais de labour pour entretenir 1Hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de KADIOLO et de ZEGOUA après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95.000FCFA après la campagne, qui sera utilisé pour soutenir les frais de scolarité des enfants et les soins de santé de la famille.
texts.en:
The seven members of the SABOUGNOUMA I group are married women who, on average, are 43 years old with 5 children. Most of them live in polygamous families at DANGUELEDOUGOU, one of the villages of the KADIOLO commune, Sikasso prefecture (3rd administrative region of Mali). They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to carry out their agriculture activities during the winter. This is their fourth collaboration with the institution; previous loans have been repaid. The crops cultivated are: rice, corn (by MARIAM K.), peanuts and beans. With her new loan, Mariam K. intends to pay for planting supplies, small farming tools and labor costs to maintain 1 hectare. After the harvest, the crops are sold at the village level, at the Kadiolo and Zegoua markets to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 95.00 francs CFA after the crop year, which will be used to support the children’s school fees and the family’s health care.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for planting supplies, small farming tools and labor costs.

loans.name: Maroune

texts.fr: Maroune K. est une femme de 29 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants en charge et de 04 autres qui lui confiés par des parents et de amis. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de DIAOBE MANDING depuis le 27 janvier 2006 et a 04 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle est productrice de pâte d'arachide et son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer sa production afin de se procurer de plus de bénéfices qui lui permettront de participer à l'épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en:
Maroune K. is a 29 year-old woman, married and the mother of 3 dependent children and 4 others who have been entrusted to her care by relatives and friends. She has been a member of the DIAOBE MANDING Banc Villageois since January 27, 2006 and has been granted 4 successive loans and never had a problem repaying. She is a producer of peanut paste and her new loan will allow her to increase her production so as to make a larger profit, enabling her to contribute to the success of her family.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build her business

loans.name: Sabougnouma Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA II sont des femmes mariées  qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 38ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à DANGUELEDOUGOU un des villages de la commune de KADIOLO préfecture  de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième collaborations avec l’institution, les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
Les spéculations cultivées sont :le riz,  l’arachide (par MINIGNA K.), mil et maïs. 
Avec son nouveau prêt, MINIGNA K. compte acheter des intrants et des petits matériels pour entretenir 1Hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de KADIOLO et de ZEGOUA après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 85.500 FCFA après la campagne, qui sera utilisé pour soutenir les frais de scolarité des enfants et les soins de santé de la  famille.
texts.en:
The seven members of SABOUGNOUMA II group are married women who on average are 38 years old and have 3 children. Most of them live in polygamous families at DANGUELEDOUGOU one of the villages in the commune of KADIOLO which is in the prefecture of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali). They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to bring their agricutural activities to fruition during the winter period.They are on their fourth collaboration with the institution,the previous loans ended well. The products cultivated are: rice, groundnut (by MINIGNA K.), millet and maize. With her new loan, MINIGNA K. hopes to buy farming supplies (seeds,fertiliser and other products) and small machinery for maintaining 1 Hectare. After the harvest the goods are sold in the village and at KADIOLO and ZEGOUA markets to a clientele of men and women. She hopes to make an average profit of 85.500 FCFA after cultivation, which will be used to support school fees for the children and health care costs for the family.

Translated from French by Barbara Belli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds,fertiliser etc. and small farm machinery.

loans.name: Adji Penda

texts.fr: Adji Penda D. est une femme de 34 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants et tutrice de 03 autres qui lui confiés par des parents. Elle est membre du banc villageois de DIAOBE MANDING depuis le 21 juillet 2005 et a 10 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et a toujours bien remboursé. Elle est détentrice d'une petite boutique où elle vend divers produits, tels du riz, de la farine de blé, des biscuits, des lampe torches, de l'huile de palme etc. son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer sa capacité d'investissement et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Son objectif principal est de soutenir son mari dans les différentes charges familiales.
texts.en:
Adji Penda D. is a 34-year-old woman,she is married and mother of 5 children and guardian of 3 others entrusted to her by their parents. She has been a member of the Diabobe Manding ‘banc villageois’ loan group since 21st July 2005 and has received 10 consecutive loans which she has always repaid correctly.She is the owner of a small shop where she sells various products such as rice, wheat flour, biscuits, torches, palm oil etc. her new funds will allow her to improve her investment capacity and better satisfy her customers. Her main objective is to support her husband in the various family expenses.

Translated from French by Barbara Belli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To continue her business and improve the products she offers.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA III sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et  2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à DANGUELEDOUGOU un des villages de la commune de KADIOLO préfecture  de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième collaborations avec l’institution, les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : le riz (par SOGONA K.), l’arachide et le haricot. 
Avec son nouveau prêt, SOGONA K. compte acheter, des intrants et des petits matériels pour entretenir  0.75 Hectare . 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de KADIOLO et de ZEGOUA après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 75.000 FCFA après la campagne, qui sera utilisé pour soutenir les frais de scolarité des enfants et les soins de santé de la  famille.
Elle souhaite entretenir  sa collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’exploiter  une superficie culturale plus grande pour en tirer plus de gains et pouvoir couvrir tous les charges de leurs besoins.
texts.en:
The seven members of the group SABOUGNOUMA III are married women who, on average, are thirty years of age and have two children. For the most part, the women live in polygamous families in Dangueledougou, one of the villages in the town of Kadiolo, in the Sikasso prefecture (The 3rd administrative region of Mali). The women work with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully complete their agricultural activities during winter. This is their fourth time working with the institution, having well handled their past loans. The crops cultivated are: rice (by Sogona), peanuts, and beans. With her new loan, Sogona expects to buy the location and small tools needed to maintain .75 Hectares. The women's products are sold after the harvests at the village level at the markets in Kadiolo and Zegoua to male and female customers. After the planting, they expect to make an average profit of 75,000 FCFA, which will be used to support the costs of their children's schooling and their families' healthcare. The group expects to maintain its partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to work a larger area of cultural land, from which to make greater profit and to be able cover all the costs of their needs.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies and small agricultural materials.

loans.name: Nye Nyame Den Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Agnes describes herself as a very focused woman. She is 40 years old and she is the leader of the “Nye Nyame Den” (translated as 'It is possible with God') borrower group. Agnes lives in Dormaa and sells maize in the community market. She has been selling maize for 4 years and also does part time work with the water company in her community. She is excited to be taking out this loan, which she will use to purchase maize in bulk to serve her customers. 

Agnes is a widow and the mother of four children. She hopes to be financially able to support her family and also provide tertiary education to all her children. As the leader of the group, Agnes ensures that all members attend meetings and submit their repayments.

loans.use: To purchase maize in bulk

loans.name: León

texts.es:
El señor León F. H. tiene 52 años, es viudo con tres hijos que viven con el, vive en la comunidad Dami Rancho ubicado a 75 Km aproximadamente de Cochabamba sobre la carretera antigua a Santa Cruz en la Provincia Tiraque del Departamento de Cochabamba.

La principal actividad del señor León F. H. es la agricultura que trabaja juntamente con su familia ellos producen papa, haba, arveja y cereales, los cuales despues vende en la feria de Tiraque. Las condiciones en las que vive es una casa que está construida de barro con techo de paja son agua de pozo y lamentablemente no tienen luz en su domicilio. Esto es debido a lo alejado de su domicilio.

El crédito que ha solicitado es para comprar los insumos agrícolas para la producción agrícola de esta año, el objetivo del señor León es producir mas este año para mejorar sus ingresos y de esa manera poder mejorar un poco sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. León F. H. is a 52 year old widower, who lives with his three children. They live in Dami Rancho, a community in the province of Tiraque, located approximately 75 Km away from Cochabamba, on the old road to Santa Cruz. Their house is built out of clay, with a thatched roof, no water well and unfortunately, without electricity due to the remote location. Mr. F. H.’s main activity is agriculture. Together with his family, he grows potatoes, beans, peas and cereals. He later sells these crops at the fair in Tiraque. He has requested a loan to buy the agricultural supplies for this year’s production. His goal for this year is to produce more and improve his income. By doing this, he looks forward to slightly improving his living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Liliana Matos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies for the harvest

loans.name: Gyedie Mu Aba Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Timothy describes himself as very hard-working. He is 44 years old and he is the leader of the “Gyedie mu aba” (translated as 'Seed of Faith') borrower group. Timothy is a manufacturer of local soap popularly known as ‘Azuma's blow’ because it looks like the blow of the renowned Ghanaian boxer called Azuma Nelson. The soap is prepared by combining materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil and hardener. The soap can be used for bathing and washing. It is relatively affordable and much patronized in the rural communities. Timothy has operated the business for the past three years. He is excited to be taking out this loan, which he plans to use to purchase ingredients for soap making.

Timothy is married to a woman who is a farmer and he is the father of two children. The other members of Timothy’s group sell footwear, peanuts, maize and 'kenkey' (a traditional fermented maize dish).  They plan to invest the loan to purchase inventory in bulk to grow their businesses. They hope to make more savings to be able to provide good education for all their children.

loans.use: To purchase soap ingredients in bulk

loans.name: The  Value Boys Group

texts.en: Nathaniel B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called The Value Boy. He is 27 years old and single with a two-year old child. Nathaniel is a high school graduate who hopes to continue his education through college. For two years he has been selling slippers at Mechlin Street, downtown Monrovia, Liberia, having started by selling cold drinks. His working capital is about 35,000 Liberian Dollars. Nathaniel attracts customers by organizing his goods well on his sales table. He plan to use his 6000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to purchase more slippers. He dreams of owning a store in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase more slippers.

loans.name: Kouta

texts.fr: Kouta C. est âgée de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de DIAOBE MANDING depuis le 20 juin 2003 et a bénéficié de 15 crédits qu'elle a toujours bien géré et remboursé à temps. Elle est productrice et vendeuse de pâte d'arachide depuis plus de 6 ans et son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer son activité et de réaliser plus de bénéfices. Elle soutien son mari dans les différentes charges familiales par exemple la scolarité des enfants, la santé et la nourriture.
texts.en:
Kouta is 43 years old, married, and a mother caring for ten children. She has been a member of the Villagers' Bank of Diaobe Manding since 20 june 2001 and has received 15 loans, which she has always managed well and paid back on time. She has produced and sold peanut butter for more than six years and her new loan will allow her to strengthen her business and to make greater profit. She supports her husband in his different obligations to the family, such as the education of their children, their health and their feeding.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her commerical activities.

loans.name: Dorcas Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Felicia describes herself as determined. She is 45 years old and she is the leader of the 'Dorcas' borrower group. Felicia lives in a town near Dormaa and sells dried fish and maize in the community market. She has been running her fish business for 2 years. She is excited to be taking out this loan, which she will use to purchase one and half baskets of dried fish. 

Felicia is married to a farmer and together they have one child who is 18 years old. She hopes to grow her fish business to be able to provide good education for her child.  

As the leader of the 'Dorcas' borrower group, Felicia ensures that all members attend meetings and submit their repayments. The other women in the group operate businesses selling food, earrings, and fish.

loans.use: To purchase one and half baskets of dried fish.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El señor Luis F. R. tiene 42 años,  viven con su familia en la comunidad Dami Rancho ubicado a 75 Km aproximadamente de Cochabamba de la Provincia Tiraque del Departamento de Cochabamba.

Su principal actividad es agricultura trabaja con su familia en su comunidad algunas veces con ayuda de sus vecinos, es casado tiene cuatro hijos que viven con ellos. La vivienda que tiene es de barro con techo de paja 
no tiene los servicios básicos, es decir que no cuentan con luz ni con agua potable.

El Crédito que está solicitando es para comprar los insumos agrícolas como la semilla de papa y abono de gallina. El señor Luis F. tiene interés de mejorar sus ingresos, para mejorar en futuro las condiciones de vida que tiene el y su familia y talves tambien poder contar con agua y luz.
texts.en:
Luis F. R., age 42, lives together with his family in the Dami Rancho community located about 75 km from Cochabamba in the Tiraque Province of the Department of Cochabamba. Luis's main occupation is agriculture; he works with his family, sometimes with the help of neighbors. He is married and has four children who all live with him and his wife. His current home is constructed from clay blocks, with a roof made of straw - it does not have basic services such as electricity or potable water. Luis is requesting a loan for the purchase of agricultural supplies such as potato seed and manure. He is interested in improving his income so that he could provide a better life for his family and maybe also to have water and electricity in his house.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of potato seed and manure

loans.name: Emere Pa Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Comfort describes herself as very determined. She is 42 years old and she is the leader of the “Emere pa” (translated as 'good time') borrower group. Comfort lives in Safwi and has been selling porridge and donuts for the past 6 years. Porridge known as ‘koko’ is a local food popularly enjoyed as breakfast. It is prepared with corn dough or millet grains, boiled with a lot of water to make it semi-liquid and eaten hot with sugar, milk, and bread. It can also be eaten with 'kosse', a tasty donut-like food prepared from milled beans mixed with spices and fried in oil. Comfort is excited to be taking out this loan, which she will use to purchase bags of flour, sugar, maize and other food ingredients to improve the quality of her food.

She wants to use the extra profits she anticipates as a result of this loan to open more porridge-selling eateries.

She is married to a farmer and together they have six children. Comfort hopes to make more savings to be able to provide quality education for all of her children, hopefully through university level.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients like maize, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Villa Concepción Group

texts.es:
El comité “Villa Concepción” tiene  más D. 2 años D. formación y trabajo con la Fundación Paraguaya, la mayoría D. sus integrantes ya  realiza actividades productivas, pero incluyen entre sus integrantes a 4 señoras que emprenderán actividades. 
Incluyen entre las actividades realizadas la venta D. frutas y verduras, venta D. comestibles artesanales como empanadas D. carne, empanadas D. pollo, empanadas D. jamón y queso, venta D. mercaderías varias como: fideo, azúcar, harina, aceite, jabón, entre otros artículos, venta D. ropas, venta D. remedios etc. 
Anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos es por eso que se esfuerzan el doble para facilitarles los materiales para su desarrollo y formación.
Una D. las integrantes es la señora Margarita M. quien se dedica a la venta D. ropas en un salón que posee en su casa. .
Ella atienD. su salón y además se ocupa D. su casa, es una señora muy trabajadora y procura mucho para que sus hijos salgan delante D. la mejor manera posibles culminando sus estudios. .
Ella comenta que el sueño que tiene es ver a sus hijos todos profesionales y por ella seguirá trabajando para luchar por sus objetivos. .
Agradece por el apoyo que encuentra  en la Fundación Paraguaya y solicita el crédito para la compra D. remeras, pantalones, jeans, camperas, buzos, calzados y otros.
texts.en:
The group Villa Concepción was founded over two years ago and has been working with Fundación Paraguaya. The majority of its members already have their own businesses, but the group also includes four women who will be just starting out. The members are engaged in various retail activities which incluD.: sales of fruits and vegetables, sales of homemaD. empanadas (filled with chicken, meat, ham and cheese), sales of general merchandise such as pasta, sugar, flour, cooking oil, soap as well as sales of clothing and medicines. All the members desire a better future for their children, and for this reason they make twice the effort to be able to proviD. them with everything necessary for their education and development. One of the members is Margarita M.; she sells clothing from a vending post that she maintains in her home. Her dream is to see her children grow up to become professionals, and for this reason she will continue to work hard to proviD. them with everything they need. Margarita appreciates the support that she receives from Fundación Paraguaya and is requesting a loan which will be used to purchase T-shirts, pants, jeans, jackets, sweatshirts, footwear, and other inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of T-shirts, pants, jeans, footwear, jackets, sweatshirts, and other items

loans.name: Elsa Betty

texts.es:
La Señora Elsa Betty C. D. C.  está casada por más D. 20 años con el Señor Silvio C. Coca,  tienen 2 hijas las cuales acuden a la universidad D. la ciudad D. Cochabamba, ambas estudiando carreras relacionadas con el cuidado D. animales. Y en el tiempo libre ayudan a su mama y papa con el cuidado D. las vacas que tienen.
La Señora Elsa vive en la Zona conocida como Maica Chica en Cochabamba, donD. tiene vacas, cuya leche venD. a una empresa que se encarga D. elaborar diferentes productos lácteos. El credito que solicita espara la compra D. una cabeza D. ganado lechero.

La Señora Elsa ya obtuvo 3 créditos anteriores con nuestra institución y demostró ser una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, además desD. el primer crédito hasta la fecha duplico su producción D. leche y la cantidad  D. vacas que tiene. Nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es ver a sus hijas ser buenas profesionales y que tengan una vida mejor que la que tuvo ella.
texts.en:
Elsa Betty C. D. C. has been married for over 20 years. Her husband is Silvio C. Coca, and together they have two daughters who are attending a university in the city of Cochabamba. Both are studying for a career in livestock farming. In their free time, the daughters help their mom and dad care for their cows. Elsa lives in the area known as Maica Chica in Cochabamba; this is where she keeps her cows and sells their milk to a company that produces various types of dairy products. She is seeking a loan for the purchase of one more dairy cow. Elsa has already had three loans with our institution and demonstrated that she is a very hard-working and responsible person. Furthermore, in the time since her first loan she was able to double the production of milk and the headcount of her cow herd. Elsa's biggest dream is to see her daughters grow up to become good professionals so that they could have a life that is better than the one she had.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Bendia Group

texts.en:
Alice Q., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called "Bendia". For 11 years, she has been selling used clothing for children at the Redlight Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She is 47 years old, single, and has four children who range in age from 8 to 28 years old. She was not able to attend school due to poverty. All of her children are in school.

Alice plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar (LRD) portion of this 30,000 (LRD) group loan to buy more used clothes for children. Her goal is to improve her business and to continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Kumba is inset at the  lower right because she was absent during the interview.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes for children

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more plastic bowls and plates

loans.name: Yehowa Nsa Da So Group

texts.en:
Moses is truly a hard worker. He is 62 years old, a mechanic who repairs electronic appliances such as radios. For the past 38 years, Moses has been repairing radios to make income to support his family. He also engages in farming as his secondary business. He plans to invest the loan to purchase radio parts and electronic accessories to improve his business. His future goals include selling radio sets in addition to the repair work.

Moses is married to a woman who is a farmer. They have seven children from age 9 – 36 years. He says that he dreams of being able to generate enough profit so that he will be able to educate his children to at least the tertiary school level.

Moses is also the group leader of “Yehowa Nsa Da So” (translated as 'Jehovah has a hand in it') borrower group made up of 4 members. The other members have businesses such as the sale of eggs, basket-weaving, and the sale of clothes.

loans.use: To purchase electronic parts in bulk

loans.name: One Family Group

texts.en:
Eyea G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called One Family. She is 50 years old, married and has two children, who are 12 and 24 years old. She was not privileged to attend school due to poverty. She cares for two siblings. 

For 10 years, she has been selling alcoholic drinks in Jacob's Town Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 10,000-Liberian-Dollar portion of this 37,000-Liberian-Dollar group loan to buy more alcoholic drinks to sell. 
 
Her goals are to improve her business, to build a house and to continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more alcoholic drinks to sell

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
El Señor René V. tiene 62 años y esta casado con la Señora Valentina Villarroel por más de 40 años, tiene un hijo que estudia en nivel secundaria, el esposo es agricultor produce papa, papalisa en su terreno que tiene 2.5 hectáreas en la comunidad de Liriuni, la esposa ayuda en la actividad agrícola, cuidando de el ganado vacuno y de la casa. 
Don  René V. y su familia viven en una comunidad Liriuni a 1 km de colomi  muy alejado de la ciudad  de Cochabamba por lo tanto para ellos es muy difícil acudir a los banco para un préstamo de dinero. El CIDRE tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esta zona rural, y se descubrio que Don René V. necesitaba capital para ampliar y aumentar la producción de papa, papalisa, ya que él tiene terrenos que no están siendo cultivados. 
Don René  nos comenta que quiere ampliar la producción de papa, papalisa así tener ingresos suficiente para ahorrar dinero para que su hijo termine de estudiar en la universidad y ser profesional, el sueña ver a sus hijo profesional ya que el no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar por falta de recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Mr. René V. is 62 years old and has been married to Mrs. Valentina Villarroel for over 40 years. They have one son who is in secondary school. Mr. René V. is a farmer who grows potatoes and other root vegetables on his 2.5 hectares of land in the Liriuni community. His wife helps with the farm chores, raising cattle and taking care of the home. Mr. René V. and his family live in the community of Liriuni which is 1 km from Colomi. The community is far from the city of Cochabamba which makes it very difficult to go to the bank for a loan. EL CIDRE had the initiative to go to this rural area. The group discovered that Mr. René V. needed capital in order to increase and expand the production of root vegetables. He currently has land that is not being cultivated. Mr. René V. told us that he would like to expand the production of root vegetables in order to have sufficient income to save money for his son’s university education. His dream is for his son to have a professional career as he himself did not have such an opportunity due to a lack of economic resources.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Santa Lucía Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su 7° ciclo, ellas se encuentran trabajando muy satisfechas y aprovechan el crédito para la invertir en la mejoras D. sus actividades y otras en las mejoras D. sus viviendas, compra D. artículos personales entre otras cosa.
 Podemos hablar D. la Sra. María Luz A.  con 32 años,  tiene 2 hijo se dedica en la venta D. ropas en el mercado para ello sale muy temprano D. su casa y al final del dia vuelve a su casa en ómnibus  por la tarD..
Es una señora muy sufrida que tiene un día a día muy pesado  por que al llegar D. su trabajo debe D. realizar las tareas D. la casa y todo lo hace para salir adelante  con su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra  D. remeras, short, camisillas, pantalón, pollera.
texts.en:
The group pictured here is currently in the 7th loan cycle. Its members are very satisfied with their work; some are using the loans to invest in their businesses, while others are using them to make improvements to their homes as well as for purchase of personal items. For instance, Maria Luz A., age 32, has two children. She sells clothing in the market, and for this reason she leaves her home very early and at the end of the day returns home by bus. Maria is a very hard-working woman whose typical day is very exhausting since upon returning from work she must also take care of all the household chores. She does all of this for the well-being of her family. Maria is seeking a loan for the purchase of T-shirts, shorts, tank-tops, pants, skirts.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pants, jackets, t-shirts, hats, socks, winter clothing

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
EL SEÑOR JUAN CARLOS T. F. TIENE 33 AÑOS Y VIVE EN EL BARRIO 4 DE JULIO DE LA CIUDAD DE TARIJA. JUAN CARLOS ES CASADO CON LA SEÑORA CARMEN SUSANA UZTARES CON QUIEN TIENE 1 HIJO DE  11 MESES. JUAN CARLOS SE DEDICA AL MANTENIMIENTO DE EQUIPOS MEDICOS Y EN LAS NOCHES TRABAJA COMO GARZON EN LOS DIFERENTES RESTAURANTES DE LA CIUDAD DE TARIJA ACTIVIDAD QUE REALIZA DESDE HACE MAS DE 10 AÑOS . 
                                                                                                                                                                        JUAN CARLOS NOS CUENTA QUE QUIERE TENER SU PROPIO NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE CARNE A LA PARRILLA. EL CREDITO QUE ESTA SOLICITANDO SERA DESTINADO A LA COMPRA DE UN PARRILLERO, MESAS, SILLAS, ETC. PARA DE ESTE MODO PODER INICIAR SU NEGOCIO Y PODER TAMBIEN INCREMENTAR SUS INGRESOS .    
                                                                                                                                                                                                                   JUAN CARLOS DICE QUE SU MAYOR SUEÑO ES PODER DARLES LA COMODIDAD A SU ESPOSA E HIJO PARA QUE SEAN FELICES . TAMBIEN NOS DICE QUE EL PROXIMO CREDITO QUE SOLICITE QUISIERA UTILIZARLO PARA LA COMPRA DE UN LOTE DE TERRENO.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos T. F., 33, lives in Tarija’s 4 de Julio neighborhood. He’s married to Carmen Susana Uztares and they have an 11-month-old son. Juan Carlos works as a medical equipment repairman and in the evenings he works as a waiter in several restaurants in Tarija; he’s been in this line of work for over 10 years. Juan Carlos tells us that he’d like to have his own grilled meat sales business. He is asking for funds to buy a grill, tables, chairs, etc. so that he can start his business thus increasing his income. Juan Carlos says that his greatest dream is to be able to provide his wife and son with comfort so that they will be happy. He also tells us that he’d like to use the next loan he requests to buy a piece of property.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy equipment for grilled meat sales.

loans.name: Women Of Vision Group

texts.en:
Vagula M., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Women Of Vision. She is 45 years old, married and has four children. She was not able to attend school due to financial difficulties. Two of her children are in school.

For 10 years, she has been selling potato greens and charcoal at the Pipeline in Paynesville Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. 

She plans to use her 7,000-Liberian-Dollar portion of this 35,000-Liberian-Dollar group loan to buy more potato greens and more bags of charcoal. Her hope is to empower her children for a brighter future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Korpo is inset at lower right because she was absent during the interview.

loans.use: To buy more potato greens and more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Ndèye Sow

texts.fr: Ndèye Sow W. est une femme de 40 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DIAOBE MANDING depuis 2002. Elle est vendeuse de bijoux et d'encens, elle mène cette activité depuis plus de 5 ans. Elle tire profit de l'existence du marché hebdomadaire pour s'approvisionner en marchandises et ensuite vendre dans les villages environnants. Elle soutien son mari dans la prise de la famille tout en renforcent son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Ndèye Sow W. is a 40 year old married mother of four young children. She has been a member of the DIAOBE MANDING Banc Villageois since 2002, and has been selling jewelry and incense for over five years. She buys merchandise at the weekly market and then sells it in local villages. She helps her husband support the family and adds to his savings.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rice and oil

loans.name: Montang

texts.fr: Monatng MANKANG est une femme de 31 ans, elle est mariée et mère de dix (10) enfants en charge. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de DIAOBE MANDING depuis le 10 juin 2002 et a 15 fois de suite reçu de crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle fait de la production et vente de pâte d'arachide depuis plus de 7 ans. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des enfants et de toute la famille en général.
texts.en:
Montang Mankang is a 31-year-old woman, married and mother and caregiver of 10 children. She has been a member of the “Banc Villageois” Diaobe Manding since June 10, 2002. She has received 15 consecutive loans and has never had a problem paying back. She has produced and sold peanut butter for seven years. Her goal is to support her husband in providing for the children and the family in general.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop and promote her income generating activity.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more phone cards

loans.name: Henrry Julio

texts.es:
El señor Henrry P. tiene 33 años se encuentra casado con la señora Rosmery Almanza tienen 3 hijos, viven por la zona de la Caspichaca Av. Capitán Ustariz una zona rural de la provincia Cercado del departamento de Cochabamba.
El señor Henrry trabaja en el empresa Companex como chofer, y su esposa en una fábrica de fideos como obrera, ambos esposos son personas muy dedicadas al trabajo. El Sr. Henrry se levanta muy de madrugada pues deben ir a su trabajo a las 6:30 a.m., y su esposa trabaja por turnos, es decir no siempre están en casa para poder despachar a sus hijos a la escuela, ni para poder prepararles el almuerzo. Sus hijos tienes edades comprendidas entre 7 y 14 años, que aun van a la escuela, por fortuna la escuela es cerca de su casa. Los clientes lograron adquirir con mucho esfuerzo, un vehículo que no se encuentra en las óptimas condiciones, pero desean poder refaccionarlo, de modo que le pueda servir como herramienta de trabajo y dedicarse al servicio de transporte, de este modo tener una fuente más de ingreso. 
El señor Henrry P. se apersono a nuestras oficinas solicitando un crédito para poder pagar la refacción de su vehículo, el cual le ayudara a generar más ingresos y su esposa podrá dedicarles más tiempo a sus hijos, si bien el Sr. Henrry tendrá dos fuentes de ingresos, también deberá esforzarse más y trabajar el doble, pero para él cualquier esfuerzo será grato si así logra la felicidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Henry P., 33, is married to Rosmery Almanza and they have three children; they live around Capitán Ustariz Avenue, Caspichaca, a rural area in Cercado province, Cochabamba department. He is employed as a driver for the firm Companex and his wife works in a pasta factory; both spouses are very dedicated to their work. Henry rises very early in the morning because he has to be at work at 6:30am. His wife works irregular shifts so they can’t always be home to get their children ready for school or to prepare them lunch. The children are between 7 and 14 years of age and are still in school; fortunately, their school is close to home. Through much effort, they were able to acquire a vehicle which isn’t in the best condition. They want to repair it so that it will serve as a work tool providing public transportation services thus providing an additional source of income. Henry P. came by our offices to request a loan to repair his vehicle which will help him generate additional income and his wife will thus be able to spend more time with their children. Although Henry will have two sources of income, he will have to work twice as hard but for him, no effort is too great if it means making his family happy.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle repair.

loans.name: Alcira

texts.es: Alcira, de 42 años, esta casada con Belarmino (52), ambos tienen 2 hijos, pero sólo viven con uno, en la casa de un familiar. A unos kilómetros de donde vive, tiene una casa que es propia, que habitará muy pronto.Desde hace 18 años, siembra diferentes flores y maíz, junto a su esposo y su hijo. Durante  fechas festivas comercializa sus productos. Y para transportar su mercadería contrata un auto para trasladar sus productos empaquetados, que vende en el mercado central de su ciudad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es retirar la mala yerba y dejar limpios los surcos sembrados, para que sus cultivos crezcan fuertes, sin embargo, le molesta cosechar porque sus siembras a veces son muy débiles, por eso aprendió a tener paciencia, además obtiene buenas ganancias, que le permiten sacar adelante a su familia. Alcira tiene muchas metas por cumplir y una de ellas es sembrar en cantidad, además paralelamente quiere alquilar un establecimiento en su ciudad para instalar una tienda de comestibles para vender sus productos al por mayor, porque es consciente de que no siempre vivirá de la agricultura.  Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y  asegura que está feliz de trabajar en su banco comunal, porque labora con personas responsables,  puntuales y con ganas de salir adelante.Alcira tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado, en la compra de  varios sacos de abono e insecticidas para fumigar sus cultivos de alverja y flor de gladiolo.
texts.en:
Alcira, 42, is married to Belarmino, 52, and they have two children, only one of whom still lives at home with them; they live in a relative’s house. She owns a house a few kilometers from where she is currently living and will move into it soon. For the last 18 years she has farmed a variety of flowers and corn with her husband and son. She sells her products during festivals. In order to transport her merchandise she hires a car to move her packaged goods to sell at the city’s central market. What she likes best about her work is to remove the bad weeds and leave her furrows planted so that her crops will grow strong. On the other hand, harvesting sometimes annoys her because her crop yields are poor. She has therefore had to learn to be patient for she does make enough profits to support the family. Alcira has a lot of goals to strive towards one of which is to increase her plantings. She also wants to rent a space in the city to set up a grocery store so that she can sell her product at wholesale because she realizes that she won’t be able to support herself by farming her whole life. This is her 2nd loan from MFP and she assures us that she’s very happy to work with her communal bank because she works with responsible, punctual people who want to get ahead in life. Alcira plans to use the requested funds to buy several sacks of manure and insecticide to fumigate her pea and gladiola crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure and insecticides for her crops.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su primer ciclo actualmente se encuentran desarrollando las capacitaciones del primer ciclo.

En el grupo se encuentra  la Sra. Olga B. que con sus 40 años tiene 1 hijo, ella tiene una pequeña panadería en su domicilio, además vende quiniela (juego de azar) en su casa por pedidos de sus clientes.

Su marido es el encargado de preparar con ella los panificados y ella luego atiende al cliente. Tiene  una casa no muy grande en el barrio Zeballos Cue de Asunción, motivo por el cual esta ahorrando para poder construir una pieza más para su negocio. 

Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de herramientas para su panadería una mezcladora y amazadora.

Nota: Hay algunas personas extras en la foto porque algunas señoras estaban con sus hijas el dia que se sacó la foto.
texts.en:
This group is in its first cycle: essentially, they are following the steps to qualify for the first cycle. Ms. Olga B. is a member of this group. She is 40 years old and has one son. She runs a small bakery in her house, on top of selling quiniela (football pools) in her house at the request of her customers. Her husband works with her: his task is to prepare the bakery products she then serves to their customers. Her house, located in Zeballos Cue, is not very big, therefore she is saving in order to succeed in building an extra room for her shop. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy tools for her bakery: a mixer and a kneading machine. Note: There are several extra people in the photo since some of the women were accompanied by their daughters the day the photo was taken.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a mixer and a kneading machine

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Angel tiene 57 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo dependiente que se encuentra en edad escolar, vive junto a su familia en el anexo Los Sanchez del caserío Lagartera, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, caracterizado por tener a la mayor parte de su población situada en zonas rurales que distan mucho una de la otra.

Se dedica desde muy joven a trabajar en labores agícolas, suele sembrar con maíz una pequeña parcela de su propiedad y también trabaja como peón agrícola en los campos cultivo de la zona, el realiza esta actividad diariamente y con ella solventa los gastos diarios de su familia, adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales para complementar sus ingresos y sacar a su familia adelante.

Angel suele criar ganado ovino y porcino en algunos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive.

Angel desea adquirir fertilizantes para brindarle mantenimiento a su maíz y también alimento balanceado para que sus animales se desarrollen correctamente, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles.

Angel es una persona honrada y trabajadora, se ha esforzado siempre para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Angel is 57 years old, he is married and has a son who, being of school age, is still economically dependent on him. He lives with his family in Los Sanchez, an outbuilding of the Lagartera country house, in a rural area of the Mórrope district, a region where the largest part of the population lives in rural areas scattered far away from one another. He has been working in the agricultural business since he was very young. He usually sows corn in a small portion of his land, on top of working as farm labourer in the crop fields of the area.
