This is his daily activity, thanks to which he settles the daily expenses of his family. He moreover breeds and sells animals to increase his earnings and thus provide for his family. Angel normally breeds sheep and pigs in some farmyards located close to his house: once they have reached the proper age, he sells them to the traders always visiting the area where he lives. Angel wishes to buy fertilizers to protect his corn, as well as balanced food to feed his animals and have them grow in the correct way. To reach his goal he has asked a loan of 1200 nuevo soles to Edpyme Alternativa. Angel is an honest and hard-working man, who has always made efforts to offer his family a better quality of life. He has already worked with our institution, proving himself to be punctual and responsible whit his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to protect his corn crops.

loans.name: Primo Isaac

texts.es:
El Sr Primo V. H. se encuentra casado, tiene 3 hijos, viven por la zona de la Maica Norte parada 7, zona rural de la provincia de Cochabamba.
El Sr. Primo se dedica a la producción de leche cruda, cuenta con su propio ganado, son 20 cabezas de ganado lechero, de los cuales, solo 9 se encuentran actualmente en producción, pues el resto se encuentran en estado de preñez. Toda la leche que logra producir se la entrega al módulo de la Planta Industrializadora de Leche PIL. Es así que logra percibir un ingreso fijo por la venta de su producto. Además cuenta con plantaciones de Alfalfa, con lo cual alimenta a su ganado, y además logra vender a sus vecinos, de este modo logra generar otros ingresos más. El Sr. Primo trabaja solo pues su esposa la Sra. Rosa se encuentra enferma, tiene problemas de los riñones, que aun no le han podido diagnosticar exactamente a qué se debe su problema, es así que la Sra. Rosa no puede colaborar con la obligaciones de su hogar, toda la familia del Sr. Primo están muy pendientes de la salud de doña Rosa.
El Sr. Primo se apersono a las oficinas para solicitar un crédito, pues desea abastecerse de forraje, aprovechar que es época de poder comprar a precios accesibles, de este modo alimentar al ganado que se encuentra en estado de preñez, para que dentro de unos meses puedan empezar a producir la leche necesaria y suficiente.
texts.en:
Mr. Primo V. H. is married, has three children and lives in the Maica Norte (stop nr. 7), a farming area in the Cochabamba province. Primo produces raw milk, has his own cattle, composed of 20 dairy cows: only 9 are in the production phase, as the rest is actually pregnant. He gives all the milk he succeeds in producing to PIL – Planta Industrializadora de Leche (Milk Processing Plant). In this way he succeeds in obtaining a fixed income selling his product. He also owns plantations of alfalfa that he uses to feed his cows, on top of selling it to his neighbours, thus earning some more money. Primo provides for the family alone, as his wife Rosa is sick: she has a kidney condition, the cause of which has not been clearly diagnosed yet; Rosa cannot comply with the duties of her household, and Primo and his family are always keeping an eye on Rosa’s health conditions. Primo came personally to our offices to ask for a loan: he wishes to buy enough forage, taking advantage of the current affordable prices, in order to feed his pregnant cows, so that in a few months they will be able to start producing enough milk.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy forage for his cows.

loans.name: Sény

texts.fr: Sény S. est née le 04 aout 1990, elle est âgée de 20 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, elle est aussi tutrice de 06 autres enfants confiés par des proches et amis de son mari. elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DIAOBE MANDING depuis le 21 juillet 2005 et a 5 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle fait de la transformation et vente de pâte d'arachide, une activité qu'elle mène depuis son adhésion dans le Banc Villageois. Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Sény S. was born on August 4, 1990 ; she is 20 years old, married and the mother of two children. She also has six other children in her care entrusted to her by relatives and her husband’s friends. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Diaobe Manding since July 21, 2005 and obtained loans five times in the past, without ever having any issues with repayment. She prepares and sells peanut sauce, an activity she has been engaged in since joining Banc Villageois. Her goal is to help improve the life conditions of her family and to boost her savings.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her business capital

loans.name: Maria Elisa

texts.es:
La señora María Elisa tiene 31 años vive con su conviviente y tienen un hijo de 10 años, está en la escuela, son una familia de escasos recursos económicos ya que no cuentan con una casa propia, viven en la casa de sus padres que en el futuro les heredara. La señora María Elisa vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la comunidad de Chinchilla, a media hora de la ciudad.

La principal actividad del cliente es la producción de la leche cruda, cuyo producto entrega a una empresa que se dedica a la producción de productos lácteos, actualmente tiene 5 cabezas de ganado lechero en producción, así como también el esposo trabaja de chofer para una persona que se dedica a la venta de agregados.

El préstamo será destinado para la compra de una cabeza de ganado lechero, con lo cual incrementara su producción y de esa manera mejorara sus ingresos.

Entre sus sueños y metas es aumentar la producción de la leche, tener una pequeña granja de por lo menos 20 cabezas de ganado lechero y el esposo desea tener su vehículo propio y dedicarse a la misma actividad que realiza su patrón, su meta principal  es realizar una construcción nueva y más amplia en la casita vieja que le heredo sus padres.
texts.en:
María Elisa is 31 years old, she lives with her partner and has a 10 year-old son who goes to school. The economic resources of this family are not many: in fact, as they don’t have a place of their own, they have to live at her parents’ house, that they will inherit in the future. María Elisa lives in the town of Cochabamba, in the Chinchilla community, half-an-hour away from the city. Her main activity is the production of raw milk, that she then brings to a dairy products factory. She now owns 5 heads of cattle, all in the production phase. Her husband works as a driver for a person who sells aggregates. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy one head of cattle in order to increase her production and consequently improve her income. One of her dreams and aims is to increase the milk production and to own a small farm of at least 20 heads of cattle; her husband wishes to own a vehicle of his own and to work independently in the same business of his current employer. They main goal is to build a new and wider room in the old house her parents will leave them.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy one head of cattle.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Desde que era niña se dedicó a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales menores, en la actualidad y todos los fines de semana, realiza la compra y venta de animales y durante la semana se encarga de ver sus cultivos de alfalfa y maíz. Éste último lo hace secar al sol y luego lo vende en la feria local de su zona, asimismo vende la alfalfa. Es así que todos sus esfuerzos logran el sostén económico de su familia y su esposo también trabaja en estas tareas. Su mayor anhelo es tener una granja grande de animales menores y producir mayores extensiones de terreno en alfalfa y maíz. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, es muy responsable con sus pagos, como lo ha hecho en anteriores veces. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para sembrar maíz y alfalfa.
texts.en:
Rocío is 39 years old and she lives in her own house with her husband and their 4 children. Since she was a child she has dedicated herself to agriculture and to the breeding of small animals (rabbits, guinea pigs, ect.): essentially, every week-end she buys and sells animals, while during the week she takes care of her alfalfa and corn crops. She lets the corn dry in the sun and then she sells it in the local trade fair of her area, where she also sells alfalfa. Her husband works in the same business as well, and through all her efforts she succeeds in providing economic support for her family. Her main wish is to own a big farm of rabbits, guinea pigs and other small animals and to crop alfalfa and corn on a wider area of land. This is her sixth loan with MFP, and with her previous loans she has demonstrated being very responsible with her payments. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy sacks of fertilizer to sow corn and alfalfa.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to crop alfalfa and corn.

loans.name: Las Exitosas Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su Primer ciclo y están pleno de trabajo de integración y distribución de trabajos ya que además de trabajar de forma independiente en sus actividades quieren organizar trabajaos para contar con un fondo en común para cualquier urgencia del comité.
Se puede hablar de la Sra. Marta S. tiene 50 años con  9 hijos, vende choclo,  frutas y verduras en la zona de San Antonio sale a vender por la tarde con sus hijos.
 Es una señora muy guapa y le gusta lo que hace y agradece por el apoyo que le brinda la Fundación por el crédito que se le otorga.   
Tiene una casa pequeña que desea ampliar, por ende ella pone mucho empeño en su trabajo.
Solita el préstamo para la compra de frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
This group is currently in its first cycle and is fully occupied with the business of integration and distribution of work. In addition to the members’ independent occupations, the group wants to organize communal work in order to have a communal fund for committee emergencies. Mrs. Marta S. is a good representative. She is 50 years old and has 9 children. She sells corn, fruit and vegetables in the San Antonio district. Every afternoon she goes out to sell along with her children. She is a very courageous woman and she enjoys what she does. She is grateful for the help that the Foundation brings her by granting her a loan. She has a small house that she would like to expand and consequently works with a lot of determination. She is soliciting the loan in order to buy fruit and vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy apples, pears, strawberries, bananas, oranges, tomatoes, peppers and onions.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El Señor Jorge M. C. 55 años de edad, es separado y es padre de 4 hijos de los cuales uno vive y es dependiente de él, al cual cría y ayuda en su educación, la madre de sus hijos lo abandono y se concubino con otra persona ya como 10 años de eso, él vive en Ivirgarzama con su hijo.
  
Jorge M. C. es un señor muy dedicado a su trabajo, tiene un lote agrícola  pequeño en el Sindicato Cerro Verde que está a 20 Km de la carretera Cbba.- Sta. Cruz, Quinta sección, el cultiva mandarina, naranja plátano palmito y otros cultivos, el cliente trabaja diariamente para el sustento de su hijo para que en un futuro próximo el siga con el cultivo de los productos que el produce. 

Joaquín se apersono a las oficinas en busca de un crédito para un reintegro para la compra de un vehículo para así poder facilitar el transporte de sus productos e incrementar la producción de cítricos y así poder tener más ingresos para el bienestar de su hijo y un futuro mejor para su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Jorge M. C. is 55 years old, separated from his spouse, and the father of four children. One child still lives with him and is a dependent, so Jorge raises him and helps with his education. The mother of his children abandoned them ten years ago when she became involved with someone else. Jorge and his son live in Ivirgarzama.

Jorge is very dedicated to his work. He has a small plot of farmland in the neighborhood of Cerro Verde, Quinta section, which is 20 kilometers away from the Cochabamba-Santa Cruz Highway. He grows tangerines, oranges, bananas, hearts of palm, and other crops. Jorge works every day to support his son so that in the near future, he can take over growing the crops that he produces.

Jorge visited the offices of CIDRE to apply for a loan in order to buy a vehicle to help transport his products and increase his production of citrus fruits. This will enable him to earn more income for the welfare of his son and a better future for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a vehicle to transport his goods

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin tiene 45 años, su actividad es la venta y elaboración de muebles. Hace más de 12 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que  El trabajo al que se dedica es muy pesado pero le gusta, en un principio y hace mucho tiempo empezó esta actividad como aprendiz y con el tiempo aprendió todos los secretos para hacer muy buenos muebles. La pasión que le pone a su trabajo lo ha convertido en un buen carpintero y por ello se ha ganado los reconocimientos de todos los que lo conocen. El siempre está viendo la manera de mejorar su trabajo y sus herramientas, por tal motivo solicita este crédito para comprar algunas herramientas, madera, clavo, barniz, pega y maque. Pues siempre ha soñado con ampliar su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Edwin is 45 years old. He has been making and selling furniture for more than twelve years. Even though the work is exhausting, he enjoys doing it. At first he spent most of his time working as an apprentice, but he eventually learned all the secrets behind making great furniture. The passion he brings to the job has enabled him to become a good carpenter, which is why he has earned the recognition of everyone who knows him.

Edwin is always looking to improve his work and his equipment. For this reason, he is requesting this loan to buy tools, wood, nails, varnish, glue, and lacquer. He has always dreamed of expanding his business and improving the conditions for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools, wood, nails, varnish, glue, and lacquer

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es:
El Señor Joaquín ascarragal tiene 30 años de edad, es soltero y es padre de  2 hijos, a los cuales cría y ayuda en su educación, la madre de sus hijos lo abandono ya como 4 años, él vive en Villa Cristal con su mama y sus 2 hijos.  

Joaquín es un señor muy dedicado a su trabajo, tiene un lote agrícola muy pequeño en el Sindicato de Santa Ana D que está a 2 ½ Km de la carretera Cbba.- Sta. Cruz, el cultiva   mandarina y otros cítricos y por las noches se dedica al servicio de moto taxis en un sindicato de moto taxista “Carrasco” en Ivirgarzama porque él vela y mantiene a sus dos hijos y ayuda en sus estudios, el mayor tiene 7 años  y el menor tiene 5 años.  

El señor Joaquín se apersono a las oficinas en busca de un crédito para la compra de plantines de naranja para poder incrementar la producción de cítricos y así poder tener más ingresos para el bienestar de sus hijos y un futuro mejor para su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Joaquín Ascarragal is 30 years old, single, and the father of two children he is raising and sending to school. The mother of his children abandoned them four years ago. He and his children live with his mother in Villa Cristal.

Joaquín is very dedicated to his work. He has a small plot of farmland in the township of Santa Ana D, which is 2½ kilometers from the Cochabamba-Santa Cruz Highway. He grows tangerines and other citrus fruits. At night he provides motorcycle taxi services as a member driver of the Carrasco taxi union in Ivirgarzama. This enables him to support and educate his two children, ages 7 and 5.

Sr. Joaquín visited the offices of CIDRE to apply for a loan in order to buy orange tree saplings so that he can increase his citrus fruit production. This will enable him to earn more income for the welfare of his children and a better future for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase orange tree saplings

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma tiene 54 años de edad, ella vive en su casa propia con sus dos hijos, quienes ya son mayores y no dependen económicamente de ella. El trabajo al que se dedica es la venta de productos de belleza, además a la confección y venta de ropa, actividad que viene realizando desde hace 6 años. Desde entonces obtiene grandes beneficios económicos y satisfacción, puesto que lo realiza dentro de su domicilio recibiendo a clientes, entre vecinas y amistades. No tiene responsabilidad sobre algunos de sus hijos y eso le da la tranquilidad que necesita, ahora lo que busca es estabilizarse y apoyar a sus hijos cuando sea necesario, con el fin de que tengan una mejor calidad de vida, puesto que ellos son su principal aliciente en la vida. Es su quinto crédito con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por la puntualidad a la hora de los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza y también en materiales para la elaboración de sus prendas.
texts.en:
Irma is 54 years old and lives in her own home with her two adult children who are no longer financially dependent on her. She sells beauty products and also makes and sells clothing, an activity she started six years ago. Since then she has received great financial benefits and satisfaction from her work since she is able to stay at home and meet with her customers, which include neighbors and friends. Irma has peace of mind now that she is no longer responsible for her children. However, she still looks for ways to provide them stability and support when necessary since they are her main source of encouragement in life.

This is her fifth loan with MFP. Irma has always been known for being prompt with her payments. The loan she requested will be used to purchase beauty products and also materials for making clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products & materials for making clothes

loans.name: Partner Brothers Business Group

texts.en:
For 10 years, Leon T. has been selling sports materials like jerseys, boots, caps, gloves, etc., at the Redlight Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. He sells in a friendly manner which keeps customers returning. He is 29 years old, married and has two children who range in age from 6 to 10 years old. He also cares for one sibling. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support. 

Leon plans to use his 6,000 Liberian dollar (LRD) portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more sports materials. His plan is to expand his business and continue to support his family.

Leon T. who is holding the sign is the leader of a group of five borrowers called "Partner Brothers Business".

loans.use: To buy more sports materials like jerseys, boots, caps, gloves, etc.

loans.name: Rositas  De Final Castillo Group

texts.es:
“Rositas de Final Castillo”  es un grupo de 9 señoras que asisten a sus reuniones en el Centro Focal “Juan Pablo II”,  se agruparon hace poco por  la necesidad de acceder al préstamo ya que todas necesitan incrementar su capital de trabajo. Todas tienen diversos negocios de producción, servicio y comercio. Una de las integras es Florencia Amalia H. de 48 años, ella vende ropa  hace 10 años en diferentes ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, de 7 de la mañana a 12 del medio día.
Florencia con los ingresos de este negocio ha podido sacar adelante a sus 6 hijos de los cuales 3 son casados y 3 dependen de ella.

Florencia necesita el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, sobre todo en ésta época de invierno las prendas abrigadas tienen mayor demanda.
texts.en:
“Rositas de Final Castillo” (Final Castillo Roses) is a group of nine women who meet at Juan Pablo II focus center. They got together recently in order to access a loan since they all need to increase their working capital. Each has a different production, service or commercial business. One of the members is Florencia Amalia H., 48. She has sold clothing in various markets in El Alto for the last 10 years. She works from 7am until noon. Income from this business has made it possible for Florencia to raise her 6 children, three of whom are married and 3 who still are dependent on her. Florencia needs the funds to buy merchandise, especially during this winter season when warm clothing is in great demand.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy warm winter clothing.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío tiene 25 años de edad, comparte su vida con esposo Joel de 28 y sus 3 hijos y juntos viven en su casa propia. El trabajo al que se dedica es la venta de comida en un puesto que tiene cerca a un paradero de buses, ofreciendo variedad de platillos como salchichas a la parrilla con mayonesa, papa rellenas, anticuchos. Rocío esta muy contenta con su trabajo,  puesto que le da los ingresos necesarios para solventar los gastos de su hogar, ya que el sueldo de obrero de su esposo a veces no le es suficiente. Confía en que ambos puedan salir adelante y sabe que lo hará trabajando para llevar un ingreso extra a su hogar. Su mayor anhelo es comprar un puesto en algún mercado, que sea muy concurrido, para así ganar más clientes y aumentar sus ventas. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, quiere comprar mayor cantidad de ingredientes para la preparación de sus platillos y además reestructurar su puesto de venta para que sea más cómodo para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rocío, 25, shares her life with her husband, Joel, 28 and their three children; they all live together in their own house. She sells prepared meals in a stand she has near a bus stop. Her menu includes a variety of dishes like: grilled sausage with mayonnaise, stuffed potatoes, anticuchos (grilled, skewered beef heart). Rocío is very happy with her work because it provides enough income to meet household expenses since her husband’s earnings as a laborer are often insufficient. She trusts that both will be able to make progress and she knows that they will if she works to bring extra income into the home. Her greatest wish is to buy a stand in a busy market so that she can have more customers and increase sales. This is her 1st loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. She will use the requested funds to buy larger amounts of ingredients for her dishes as well as to remodel her stand so that it will be more comfortable for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her dishes and to remodel her sales stand.

loans.name: Jazmina De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Doña Jazmina es madre de familia de un hijo, mujer trabajadora se dedica ala venta de ropa y cosméticos, desde hace varios años, iniciando con financiamientos el cual ha logrado mantenerse en equilibrio, aparte de sus ventas, hace manualidades, a si como ha comenzado a trabajar medio tiempo en servicio domestico, a un tío para ganar mas dinero , lo cual le ha permitido invertir mas en su negocio de ropa.

Para ella no es fácil ya que es madre soltera, es por eso se esfuerza para lograr captar clientes y poder obtener las ganancias para pagar los gastos básicos, estudio  y alimentación de su hijo.
Con este préstamo comprara: ropa, zapatos en estilo variado y cosméticos  para seguir aumentando su inventario, el cual le permitirá la captación de clientes nuevos.
texts.en:
Doña Jazmina is the mother of one child. She is a hardworking woman who has been selling clothing and cosmetics for several years. Jazmina started her business with loans to help keep everything in balance. In addition to her sales, she makes handicrafts and works part-time as a housekeeper for an uncle to earn extra money. This has allowed her to invest more into her clothing business.

It is not easy being a single mother, so Jazmina strives to attract customers so that she can earn income for basic expenses and to feed and educate her child. With this loan she will buy clothing, shoes of various styles, and cosmetics so that she can increase her inventory. This will allow her to attract new customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing, shoes, and cosmetics

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: La Señora Maria De Los Ángeles es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo menor de edad. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de leña y cerdo, por lo que esta muy contenta con su negocio, pues ella es la propia dueña del local. Por lo que siempre está  atenta con su trabajo y lo que sus clientes le soliciten nunca deja de lado los trabajos que se le presentan, pues es muy empeñosa y siempre trata de salir adelante. En un futuro le gustaría establecer un negocio como pulpería, por ahora continuará trabajando y vendiendo sus productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima necesaria.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria De Los Ángeles is a single mother of a young child. For the past four years she has been selling firewood and pigs, and is very happy with her business since she is the owner of her location. Maria is always focused on her work and her customers’ requests. She is a hard worker who never neglects her job and always tries to get ahead. In the future she wants to establish a business, such as a grocery store, but for now she will continue working to sell her products. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy the materials she needs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Anita

texts.es: Anita tiene 38 años, vive cerca de una de sus dos hijas, pues la otra tiene su propia casa a unas cuadras más, es independiente y tiene su propia familia. Desde muy joven ha trabajado arduamente para sacar adelante a sus hijas, es así que vio en un trabajo rentable,  la confección de prendas. Hoy continúa con esta labor, pero sin preocupación ya que ambas hijas son independientes, el verlas con sus propias familias le reconforta, ya que ella les enseñara como salir adelante por sus propios medios. Ahora trabaja para solventar sus propios gastos, pues un trabajo que la dignifica y la mantiene ocupada e independiente.Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con los pagos como lo viene siendo su hija, quien es un cliente muy puntual. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de materiales para la elaboración de sus prendas y así cumplir con sus pedidos.
texts.en:
Anita is 38 years old and lives near one of her two daughters. The other daughter has her own home located a few blocks away, lives independently, and has her own family. As a young woman, Anita worked extremely hard so that her daughters could get ahead. She discovered making clothes was a profitable way to earn a living. Today she continues in this same line of work, but she no longer worries about her daughters since both of them are independent. Seeing them with their own families provides her comfort since she taught them how to succeed by themselves. Anita now works to pay for her own expenses. In addition, working is a dignified way for her to stay busy and remain independent.

This is her first loan with MFP. Anita promises to be prompt with her payments just like her daughter, who is also a punctual client. The loan she requested will be used to buy a large quantity of materials for making clothing so that she can fulfill her orders.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making clothing

loans.name: Ahoto Firi Nyame Group

texts.en:
Sakina describes herself as a very focused woman. She is 45 years old and she is the leader of the “Ahoto Firi Nyame” (translated as 'Good living comes from God') borrower group. Sakina is a petty trader who has been selling foodstuffs like maize, plantains, and peppers for the past 4 years. She also engages in farming as her secondary business to make extra income. She is excited to be taking out this loan, which she will use to purchase plantains, bags of maize, and baskets of peppers in bulk. She dreams of being able to extend her trade to major market centers in the country.  She is married to a farmer and together they have two children who are 4 and 12 years old. Sakina hopes to support her children to attain an advanced education.

The other members are also engaged in trades such as food selling, maize and rice selling and the sale of footwear.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs in bulk

loans.name: Happy Day Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Martha is currently the group leader of 'Happy Day Trust' bank group made up of 6 members. Martha is clearly a hard worker. She is 52 years old and sells bales of used clothes to customers in her community. She also engages in farming to supplement her income. Martha has been operating her business for 30 years and is eager to be taking out this loan. She plans to invest the loan to purchase bales of assorted used clothes for adults and children to meet customers’ demand. Used clothes are most patronized since brand new ones are expensive for the majority of low income people. This has created a market for many women like Martha.

Martha is a widow and she is the mother of three children from age 8-20 years. She says that she dreams of being able to generate enough profits that she will be able to improve her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes in bales

loans.name: Sunrise Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Cynthia is currently the group leader of Sunrise Trust bank group made up of 4 members. Cynthia is clearly a hard worker. She is 30 years old and sells cosmetics to customers in her community market. She also engages in farming to supplement her income. Cynthia has been operating her business for four years and is eager to be taking out this loan. She plans to invest the loan to purchase assorted cosmetics like make-up, bracelets, etc. to meet her customers’ demand. It is one of her dreams that one day she will be able to rent a shop to ease her stress of trekking. 

Cynthia is married and she is the mother of seven children from age 1-12 years. She says that she dreams of being able to generate enough profits that she will be able to provide tertiary education to her children.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Concepción tiene 40 años, empezó con el negocio para ayudar con los gastos familiares de su casa. Y está ubicada en su vivienda para ofrecer una amplia variedad de productos, compro víveres para el hogar, granos básicos, golosinas entre otros así puede ofrecer lo que sus clientes le solicitan y mantener su tienda bastante surtida. Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos necesarios para materia prima. En el futuro quiere obtener otro medio de ingreso para su familia.
texts.en:
Concepción is 40 years old and started her business so that she could help with her family’s household expenses. Her store is located in her home and she offers a wide variety of products. She buys household products, basic grains, and candy among other items to offer to her customers who request them. Concepción seeks to maintain a well-stocked shop. In the future, she wants to find another means of generating income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy merchandise

loans.name: Ada

texts.es: Ada es una amable y trabajadora mujer, ella tiene 48 años y comparte su vida en su casa propia, con Efraín su esposo D. 47 años, sus hijos adolescentes Joaquín y Saúl, además convive con su madre que es anciana. Ella realiza diversas actividades, como: el tejido D. prendas, venta D. cosméticos. Actualmente  y gracias a las ganancias obtenidas por su trabajo logró comprar una máquina D. coser, con la cual brinda servicios D. confección y arreglos D. prendas D. vestir. DesD. entonces trabaja tranquilamente desD. su casa, por lo cual se siente más cómoda, ya que este trabajo le permite cubrir las necesidades D. sus hijos. Ada quiere seguir trabajando y apoyando a su esposo con su trabajo, cree que juntos se le hará más fácil salir adelante, por lo que espera concretizar sus planes. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y siempre se caracterizó por ser muy responsable con sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará materiales como telas, hilos, para continuar con el trabajo D. costura.
texts.en:
Ada is a friendly hardworking woman who has her own home. She is 48 years old and shares her life with her husband Efrain (age 47) and their teenage children, Joaquin and Saúl. Her elderly mother also lives with them. Ada is involved in different activities such as weaving clothes and selling cosmetics. Thanks to the earnings she obtained from her work, she was able to buy a sewing machine so that she could offer services such as designing apparel and mending garments. This allows her to work peacefully from the comfort of her home since this activity enables her to meet the needs of her children. Ada wants to continue working and support her husband through her business. By working together with her husband, she believes it will be easier to move forward and solidify her plans.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Ada has always been known for being very responsible with her payments. The loan she requested will be used to buy materials such as fabrics and thread so that she can continue her sewing business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics & thread

loans.name: Knowledge Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Celestina describes herself as hard-working and someone who loves selling and serving customers. She is 54 years old and is the leader of the 'Knowledge' borrower group, made up of eight members.  Celestina sells vegetables and spices like tomatoes, onions and peppers in the community market, the business through which she makes income to support her family. Tomatoes, onions and peppers provide much flavor to local sauces and soups and almost every local dish contains these ingredients, making it a good business to sell them. 

Celestina is excited to be taking out this loan, which she plans to invest in the purchase of tomatoes in bulk to expand her market. Celestina also engages in farming as her secondary business. She hopes to mobilize more savings to rent a store and sell groceries.

Celestina is married to a farmer and they have three children who are 10, 13 and 18 years old. She hopes to support her youngest child through university education. The other members of the group are mostly farmers. She describes her group members as being punctual and as the leader she ensures regular meeting attendance and repayment of loan installments.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes, onions and peppers in bulk

loans.name: Emma

texts.es: Emma, es una madre muy trabajadora, vive junto a su hijo en su casa que es propia.Se dedica a la preparación de tamales y humitas (platillos típicos peruanos); muele granos de maíz  y los amasa  para preparar sus productos. Después de su separación, emprendió este negocio, y ya lleva 8 meses comercializando sus tamales y humitas. Vende en el mercado aledaño a su barrio, y otras veces en lugares donde se realizan espectáculos folklóricos y algunas veces, le hacen pedidos, que vende muy bien a sus fieles clientes. Se siente motivada con su negocio, aunque le resulte difícil moler los granos con su máquina que esta un poco antigua. Su mayor anhelo es ampliar su negocio, y también quiere captar mayor cantidad de clientes, y después planea comprar sus artefactos electrodomésticos con el fin de mejorar  su negocio.Este es el primer préstamo con MFP, y sabe que el dinero  le será muy beneficioso para aumentar su capital de trabajo, por ello se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas oportunamente.Enma tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en comprar insumos, para continuar  elaborando sus tamales y humitas, y de ese modo busca consolidar sus clientes.
texts.en:
Emma is a hardworking mother who lives in her own home with her son. She prepares and sells tamales and “humitas” (traditional Peruvian dishes). Emma grinds the corn and mixes the dough that is used to make her products. She started this business after she separated from her husband and has already been selling tamales and humitas for eight months. Emma sells her products at the market near her neighborhood and occasionally in places where folkloric performances are held. Sometimes she accepts orders since her food sells well among her loyal customers. She is motivated by her business, but finds it difficult to grind the corn using her outdated machine. Her greatest wish is to expand her business and also attract more customers. Afterwards, she plans to buy electrical appliances to help improve her business.

This is her first loan with MFP. Emma knows that this money will be beneficial to increasing her operating capital, so she promises to submit her payments promptly. She plans to buy ingredients needed to continue making tamales and humitas so that she can strengthen her customer base.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients used in preparing her dishes

loans.name: Evgenia

texts.en:
Evgenia is married and has two adult children. She owns a retail business that sells various kinds of cosmetics. Her business is located at a small store that she rents at the central market. 

Evgenia has been in this business for 12 years. She used to work as salesperson. When she lost her job, she decided to use her experience and start her own business. Today, Evgenia has a large business location with electricity inside that helps her to prevent her inventory from freezing. 

Evnegia has used Kiva loans before and found them very helpful for the business. This time, Evgenia would like to borrow 20,000 Ukrainian Hryvnia to go to the bulk market in another city and purchase inventory at a lower price.

loans.use: To purchase inventory in bulk

loans.name: Determination Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Rose describes herself as hard-working and someone who loves selling and serving customers. She is 59 years old and is the leader of the 'Determination' borrower group, made up of six members.  Rose trades in vegetables like tomatoes in the community market, the business through which she makes income to support her family. 

Like many vegetables, tomatoes provide much flavor to local sauces and soups and almost every local dish contains tomatoes. This makes selling tomatoes a profitable business. Rose is excited to be taking out this loan, which she plans to invest in the purchase of  four boxes of tomatoes to expand her market. Rose also engages in farming as her secondary business. She hopes to mobilize more savings to rent a kiosk to improve her business

Rose is married to a farmer but they do not have any children. The other members of the group are mostly farmers. She describes her group members as being loyal and as the leader she ensures regular meeting attendance and repayment of loan installments.

loans.use: To purchase boxes of tomatoes

loans.name: Ofori

texts.en:
A. is forty years old and married with three children who are between the ages of nine years and eighteen months. The first three are currently in the basic school. A.’s wife trades to support him financially to provide for the family. 

A. is also a trader. He trades in clothes. He has been in this business for thirteen years and is experienced. It is the experience A. has amassed in this particular trade that drives him to keep on in this line of work. He buys bales of the second-hand goods from nearby towns and sells in a store in his community. 

It is A.’s dream to develop his business to the extent of opening branches elsewhere. Apart from the clothing business, hard-working A. also runs a transport business which fetches him additional income to provide for the family and meet other personal needs.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes in bales

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is married with one small son. She sells women's clothing at the central market in Stryi and her average profit is 5,000 UAH per month.

Mariya has been in this business for nine years and has her kiosk in a very good place at the market. She sets affordable prices and provides very good client service. This brings many repeat clients to her business and helps her to make enough money for her family needs.

Mariya would like to borrow 12,000 UAH to increase her inventory. She hopes to make additional profits and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To increase her assortment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase supplies & equipment for his business

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es:
Néstor R. García es un gran trabajador del campo que siempre se ha dedicado a la siembra  cultivos y a la cría  animales, pero últimamente  vende de carne de cerdo y productos agrícolas que siembra por  temporada como maíz, yuca y ñame, que de hecho constituyen sus mayores ingresos de manera constante porque los productos del campo son estacionarios.   
Néstor expresa que los ingresos que obtiene por la comercialización de estos productos, le han servido  para el sostenimiento de su familia y para financiar la siembra de cultivos. Él ya había recibido 2 préstamos de la  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, y con el nuevo crédito por valor de $1.300.000 COP, que es su tercero, espera invertir en carne de cerdo en pie, comprar r aguacate, ñame y otros productos que forman parte de la canasta familiar y que comercializa con mucha facilidad.

Hablando de su vida, dice que vive con su esposa en un pueblo cercano a Cartagena y que su principal desafió fue la crianza de cinco hijos, durante una época muy difícil en la comunidad, pero eso es cosa del pasado y ellos tienen ya entre de 32 y 40 años de edad y  ahora están casados y tienen su familia. Su sueño es mantener el negocio en crecimiento, comprar cerdo por cantidades y poder ofrecer a otros negocios similares a un buen precio. También quiere sacar adelante a su familia, sobre todo a algunos  nietos y nietas que están a su cargo.
texts.en:
Néstor R. García is a hardworking farmer who is dedicated to growing crops and raising animals. Lately most of his income has come from selling pork and seasonal agricultural products such as corn, cassava, and yams since these items have stable demand. Néstor says that the income he earns from selling these products is used to support his family and finance the planting of his crops. He has already received two loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this new loan in the amount of 1,300,000 COP, which will be his third, Néstor plans to buy pig’s feet, avocados, yams, and other products that are commonly used for family meals and can be easily sold.

Speaking of his life, Néstor says he and his wife reside in a town near Cartagena. His main challenge was raising five children during a difficult time in his community, but those events are now in the past. At the moment, his children are between the ages of 32 and 40. They are married and have their own families. His greatest wish is to keep his business growing. He plans to buy pork in large quantities and then sell his product to other businesses at a good price. In addition, he wants to move his family forward, especially the grandchildren who are under his care.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pig’s feet, avocados, yams, and other products

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is a married mother with a 5-year-old child. She and her husband own a business that offers ceremonial services and sells ceremonial inventory. She has been in this business for five years and is very focused and determined. She is grateful for the loans she has received from HOPE Ukraine which have helped her business expansion.

This time, Nataliya is requesting a loan of 11,000 UAH to purchase additional materials for manufacturing funeral wreaths, e.g. artificial flowers, wire and ribbons. The loan will be beneficial for Nataliya’s family business by keeping it competitive and promoting further growth.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for manufacturing funeral wreaths

loans.name: Ada

texts.es:
La Sra. Ada tiene 32 años. Tiene dos hijos menores de edad. Esta casado con el Sr. Eladio Acosta.
La Sra. Ada tiene una despensa en su domicilio propio hace 8 años.
Su marido el Sr. Eladio tiene un pequeño tambo cerca de su domicilio donde tiene 6 vacas lecheras y 2 novillos, se dedica a la venta de leche que quita de sus vacas hace 8 años.
 La Sra. Ada necesita de este crédito para adquirir mercaderìas( fideos, harina, azucar, panificados, aceites, arroz y otros) en cantidad a menor precio. 
 En el futuro desean agrandar su despensa y comprar mas ganados para la mayor venta de sus leches y producir también queso.
texts.en:
La Señora Ada is 32 years old. She is married to el Señor Eladio Acosta and has two minor children. She has had a small store in her home for 8 years. Her husband, el Señor Eladio, has a small milking yard near his home where he has 6 dairy cows and 2 young bulls. He has sold milk from his cows for 8 years. La Señora Ada needs this loan to purchase merchandise (pasta, flour, bakery goods, oils, rice, etc.) in quantity and at wholesale. In the future, they would like to expand their store and purchase more livestock to increase milk sales and also produce cheese.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pasta, sugar, bakery goods, dairy products, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Confiando En Dios Group

texts.es:
el grupo Confiando en Dios esta integrado por tres personas, vecinos del barrio Alto Verde de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, se han constituido como grupo para solicitar un credito, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:

la señora Asuncion Agustina F. H. tiene 38 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Sebastian Morales, dependen de ellos tres hijos, no tienen casa propia,  alquilan el lugar en donde viven, la señora Asuncion se dedica a elaboracion y venta de golosinas como ser tajaditas de platano con chismol, pastelitos, tacos etc. esta solicitando el credito para compra de la materia prima para elaborar las golosinas. 
su mayor sueño es tener su casa propia.

el sr. Carlos Agusto M. H. tiene 31 años de edad, es soltero y vive con sus padres. se dedica a moler maiz, tiene un molino con motor, tiene 6 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
el credito lo va a utilizar para la compra de repuestos para el molino.

la señora Santos Francisca F. H. tiene 33 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Juan Manuel Cruz, dependen de ellos 2 hijos, Santos Francisca se dedica a la venta de refrescos, charamuscas, churros, etc. el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas refrescos, churros y materiales para fabricar las charamuscas.
texts.en:
The "Confiando en Dios" ("Trusting in God") group is made up of three individuals who are neighbors in the Alto Verde neighborhood in the city of San Lorenzo. They have come together as a group to request a loan. Details of their different activities are as follows: Ms. Asuncion Agustina F. H. is 38 years old and lives in a common-law marriage with Mr. Sebastian Morales. They have three children and they do not own their own house, so they rent their living space. Ms. Asuncion makes and sells snacks like sliced banana with chismol (salsa), pastries, tacos, etc. She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients to make her snacks. Her greatest dream is to own her own house. Mr. Carlos Agusto M. H. is 31 years old, single, and lives with his parents. For the last six years, he has worked milling corn flour. He has a motorized mill and he will use this loan to buy spare parts for his mill. Ms. Santos Francisca F. H. is 33 years old and lives with her common-law husband, Mr. Juan Manuel Cruz. They have two children. Santos Francisca sells sodas, charamuscas (plastic bags of frozen juice or soda), churros, etc. She will use this loan to buy more sodas, churros, and materials to make charamuscas.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood, sugar, bananas, butter, vegetables, sodas, corn flour, oil, spare parts for a flour mill, plastic bags, fruit, and artificial flavors

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ceferino

texts.es:
El señor Ceferino M., tiene la edad de 56años, habita en La Concepción, barrio Los Martinez, es casado, su esposa se desempeña como comerciante de frutas  y verduras en el M. de Masaya y así lo apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene hijos ya todos mayores de edad.

Don Ceferino desde hace 31 años se dedica a la agricultura, las mayor problemática hacia el cultivo son la condiciones del tiempo y la sequía que afectó el año pasado, con el primer crédito otorgado logró establecer un cultivo de piña y gracias a la asistencia técnica y a trabajos arduos en el campo están en muy  buenos condiciones lo que le permitió vender y cancelar su primer crédito; ahora con este segundo crédito quiere darle mantenimiento ya que necesita comprar fertilizantes e insumos  que requieren el cultivo.
texts.en:
El señor Ceferino M. is 56 years old and lives in La Concepción, Los Martinez neighborhood. He is married and his wife sells fruits and vegetables in the Masaya market. Thus, she helps with household expenses. They have children who are all adults. Don Ceferino has worked in agriculture for 31 years. His greatest problem has been weather and last year's drought. With his first loan, he established plantings of pineapple; thanks to technical assistance and hard work in the field, they are in very good condition, which allowed him to retire his first loan. Now, with his second loan, he wants to maintain his plantings. He needs to purchase fertilizer and other products that cultivation requires.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of agricultural consumables such as fertilizer for the maintenance of pineapples

loans.name: Franklin Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Franklin R. tiene la edad de 30 años, habita en el municipio de  Ticuantepe, su esposa labora como empleada domestica en una casa privada; para apoyarle con los gastos de hogar ya que ellos tienen tres hijos los cuales estudian y necesitan del apoyo de sus padres.

Don Franklin se dedica desde hace dos años a manejar una moto Taxi que es el medio de transporte  más rápido en el municipio, pero debido a tantas  motos que hay circulando los  ingresos no son iguales, y esto no le permite recoger para la compra de materiales de construcción y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

El necesita la cantidad de C$ 5,000.00 , para la compra de zinc , arena , bloques, entre otros productos para la construcción y mejora de su vivienda. Agradece a la institución por el apoyo que le brinda y la confianza  para mejorar su vivienda .
texts.en:
Franklin R., 30, lives in Ticuantepe; his wife works as a domestic employee in a private home to help him meet household expenses because they have three children who are in school and need their parents’ support. For the past two years Franklin has driven a mototaxi (three-wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo) which is the city’s fastest mode of transportation. However, due to the large number of these vehicles in circulation, income isn’t always enough. He is unable, therefore, to afford to buy building materials and supplies to improve his family’s living conditions. He needs 5,000 colones to buy zinc, sand and concrete blocks among other items to make some home improvements. He is grateful to the institution for the support and trust it offers him to improve his dwelling.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sand, zinc metal sheeting and concrete blocks.

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es: Ingrid, de 25 años, es una joven muy trabajadora, vive en la casa de sus padres junto a sus 2 hermanos.Trabaja como cajera,  y lo que más desea es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, como es la hermana mayor considera que tiene  la responsabilidad de ayudar a sus padres, en los gastos del hogar. Tiene planeado comprar un motocarro, para dárselo  a su hermano para que trabaje. Durante  todos los meses, separa parte de su sueldo, y junta el dinero para hacer realidad su propósito. Se siente muy contenta  porque tiene la mitad del dinero ahorrado en poco tiempo. Su mayor anhelo, es apoyar a sus hermanos ya que  después quiere sacar su titulo como profesora.Este es el primer préstamo con MFP, y sabe que el crédito le será muy beneficioso para aumentar su capital de trabajo, por ello se compromete en pagar sus cuotas oportunamente.Además Ingrid tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en comprar un  motocarro, para  progresar con su familia.
texts.en:
Ingrid, who is 25 years old, is a very hardworking young woman. She lives at her parents' house with her two siblings. She works as a cashier and what she would like most is to improve her family's quality of life. Since she is the oldest child, she considers it her responsibility to help her parents out with the household expenses. She plans to buy a three-wheeler van to give to her brother so that he can work. Every month she puts aside part of her earnings and is saving up this money to make her dream a reality. She is very happy because she has saved up half of the money needed in a short time. Her biggest wish is to to support her siblings, because afterwards she would like to get her license to be a teacher. This is Ingrid's first loan with MFP and she knows that it will be very beneficial in raising her working capital. For this reason, she is committed to paying her installments in a timely manner. Ingrid plans to invest the requested funds on buying a three-wheeler van in order to help her family progress.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a three-wheeler van so that her brother can work

loans.name: Concepcion Rosario

texts.es:
la señora Concepcion Rosario A. R. tiene 56 años de edad es casada con el sr. Lorenzo Funez. su esposo se dedica a vender las tajaditas y chicharras que ella fabrica, las vende en pulperias y mercaditos cercanos a su vivienda, ademas se dedica a vender verduras y algo de abarroteria.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar abarroterias para surtir la pulperia, tambien desea comprar platanos verdes y chicharras.
su mayor sueño en estos momentos es que que su esposo se le mejore ya que tiene problemas de salud.
desde hace poco comenzo de nuevo con el negocio de pulperia ya que por motivos de poca venta hace varios meses atras la habia cerrado, pero ahora tiene toda la confianza que su negocio va a crecer y va a salir adelante con el.
texts.en:
Concepción Rosario Álvarez R., 56, is married to Lorenzo Funez who sells the fried banana chips and fried pork rinds that she makes to grocery stores and small markets near their home; she also sells vegetables and a few groceries. She will use the funds to buy groceries to stock her store; she also wants to buy green bananas and pork skins. Her greatest wish is that her husband recovers from his health problems. A short while ago she reopened her grocery store which she had closed a few months ago due to low sales. Now she’s confident that the business will grow and she will make progress with it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El sr Daniel se dedica a la compra y ventas de artículos de despensa como azúcar , aceite , huevo , etc.
  Esta casado con la Sra. María tienen un hijo en edad escolar , ella se dedica a la compra y ventas de ropas , calzado deportivos.
 Con un poco de su ahorro pudo montar su negocio y actualmente le va  bien y trabaja mucho para mejorar sus ventas. 
 El  necesita de este crédito para la compra de mas mercaderías como camperas, pantalones, sueter, calzados ya que tiene varios pedidos ya esta ampliando su negocio con la venta de ropas. 
En el futuro  desea abrir su propio local ya que actualmente esta alquilando el local, y seguir distribuir sus mercaderias  a mas clientes.
texts.en:
Daniel buys and sells grocery items like sugar, cooking oil, eggs, etc. He’s married to María and they have a school-age child. María is a clothing and athletic footwear merchant. With a bit of savings she was able to set up her own business and is doing well; she works hard to improve sales. He needs this loan to buy more merchandise like: sweaters, pants, sweatshirts and shoes because he has several pending orders and he’s expanding his clothing sales business. In the future he’d like to open his own store from which to sell his merchandise to more customers because he’s currently renting space.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted clothing, shoes and other items.

loans.name: Aniceto

texts.es: Aniceto, se caracteriza por ser un hombre laborioso, tiene 55 años, casado con Donata de 54 años, con quien tiene 3 hijos ya independientes. Está pareja vive en su vivienda propia. La siembra de papa, representa gran parte de su vida, pues desde muy pequeño sus padres le enseñaron las técnicas agrícolas para ser un buen productor de tubérculos como lo es ahora. Cuando es temporada de cosecha, su esposa lo ayuda. Generalmente se encarga de cuidar sus animales, como: carneros, vacas, toros, cerdos y asnos, actividad que lo realiza desde que se casaron, además el venderlos les ha salvado de crisis económica. Lo que más le gusta de la agricultura es cosechar papas y seleccionarlos por tamaños, sin embargo le molesta que los clientes le engañen en el precio, tanto trabajo sin ser reconocido económicamente. En adelante continuará sembrando, pero en mayor cantidad, además cultivará variedades de tubérculos, como la nativa y de colores que son la que tiene más demanda en el mercado. Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y como ya conoce la metodología de trabajo de su grupo comunal y por tal se siente orgulloso de pertenecer a un grupo muy unido y dispuesto a salir adelante, por ello vienen ahorrando de manera organizada. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de fertilizantes, para mejorar la producción de sus tubérculos.
texts.en:
Aniceto, 55, is characterized by being a hard-worker. He’s married to Donata, 54, and they have three children who are all now independent. This couple lives in their own home and most of their life is dedicated to potato farming. He learned farming skills when he was very young from his parents who taught him how to be a good tuber farmer. During harvest time his wife helps him. Generally, she tends to their animals like: sheep, cows, bulls, pigs and asses, an activity she’s been in since they got married. Selling animals has sheltered them from the economic crisis. What he enjoys the most about farming is harvesting potatoes and sorting them by size. What annoys him are customers that try to cheat him on the price, so much work for so little economic reward. He will continue planting but in larger amounts. In addition, he will grow a variety of tubers like the native one and the colored ones that are in highest demand in the market. This is his 4th loan with MFP and because he’s familiar with the work methodology of his communal group he feels proud to be part of a unified group that’s willing to get ahead and save in an organized fashion. He will use the requested funds to buy several sacks of fertilizer to improve his tuber production.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Carmen Luz

texts.es:
la señora Carmen Luz E. B. tiene 60 años de edad esta casada con el señor Pantaleon Flores quien se dedica a la albañileria y le ayuda economicamente con los gastos del hogar. ellos tienen una hija estudiando en la universidad. Carmen Luz se dedica desde hace 16 años a atender la pulperia y la cria y venta de pollos, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de concentrado ya que la produccion de pollos a aumentado y requiere mayor inversion para la comida de los mismos tambien comprara mercaderia para la pulperia. Carmen vive en una bonita casa y su granja de pollos esta bien
arreglada. Su deseo es que su ultima hija se le gradue de la universidad.
texts.en:
Señora Carmen Luz E. B., age 60, is married to Señor Pantaleon Flores, who works as a mason. She helps with the household expenses. They have a daughter studying at university.

For 16 years, Carmen Luz has worked running a small grocery store and in raising and selling chickens. She will use the loan to purchase chicken feed since her chicken production is increasing and requires a greater investment in feed. She will also buy merchandise for her grocery store. Carmen lives in a beautiful house, and her chicken farm is well established. Her wish is that her youngest daughter graduates from university.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chicken feed, soft drinks, sweets, sugar, rice, coffee, beans, toritllas, bread, cookies, toilet paper, soups, juicies, milk, cheese, butter, and cooking oil.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
la señora Silvia P. tiene de 35 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Romulo Meza quien se dedica a la albañileria, tienen una hija que depende de ellos,  su hija esta en la escuela.
el Negocio de Silvia es una pulperia la cual opera bajo el nombre de Nicol. Silvia se a dedicado al comercio desde hace varios años,  vende sandalias, ropa, abarroteria y pescado.
Silvia es una mujer muy luchadora y dinamica.
el credito lo utilizara para surtir un nuevo local que adquirio en la zona del comercio en coyolito.
su meta es que el negocio que va emprender sea muy exitoso.
texts.en:
Silvia is 35 years of age and lives in a free union with Romulo who is a brick layer. They have a daughter who depends on them and is still in school. Silvia's business is a general store she operates under the name of Nicol. She has been dedicated to commerce for various years, primarily selling sandals, clothing, groceries and fish. Silvia is a very determined and dynamic woman. She will use her loan to supply a new store she has acquired in the commercial zone of Coyolito. Her goal is that the business she is about to launch should be very successful.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASING MERCHANDISE, MAINLY GROCERIES, TO STOCK HER NEW STORE

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosel

texts.es: Rosel, de 35 años, es un padre de familia muy trabajador, vive  con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en la casa de sus suegros.Se dedica a  prestar el  servicio de planchado y pintura para autos. Es especialista en el lijado y el empleo de masilla,  ya que dependerá del buen desempeño de su  trabajo, el acabado final de la pintura. Por muy maltratados que estén los parachoques o cualquier parte de las presentaciones  de los vehículos, él soluciona el problema uniformemente. Además sus clientes, son empresarios reconocidos  y algunos chóferes que lo vistan en su taller, que es alquilado. Trabaja en sociedad con su hermano, y pese a eso cuenta con un ayudante, con quien trabaja en conjunto para entregar los autos en el momento indicado. Se siente a gusto con lo que hace, ya que le es muy rentable; y  ya lleva 15 años realizando  esta actividad, y su mayor anhelo, para más adelante es instalar  su propio taller.Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, y sabe que el crédito le será muy beneficioso para aumentar su capital de trabajo, por ello se compromete en  pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo.Rosel tiene planeado invertir el  dinero solicitado en la  compra de una  comprensora de aire para pintar y también un aspersor de sistema de planchados, para que sus trabajos resulten impecables.
texts.en:
Rosel, 35 years old, is the hard-working father of a family who lives with his wife and their 3 children in his in-laws house. He does auto body work and painting. He specializes in applying body filler and sanding and his success depends upon the quality of his work, especially how well he finishes and applies the paint. No matter how banged up the car is or which part is damaged, he solves the problem uniformly. Moreover, his clients are recognized business people and chauffeurs who are often seen in his rented workshop. He works jointly with his brother and, in addition, he employs an assistant with whom he works in order to deliver the cars at the indicated time. He enjoys what he does and it is very profitable. Rosel has been doing this for 15 years, and his greatest wish for the future is to install his own shop. This is his 1st loan with MFP, and he knows that credit will be very beneficial as a means of augmenting his capital. For that reason, he is committed to making all his payments on time. Rosel plans to invest the loan in purchasing an air compressor for painting and also, a paint sprayer so that his work will be impeccable.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING A COMPRESSOR AND PAINT SPRAYER FOR HIS AUTO REPAIR SHOP

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
La Señora Esperanza es mujer muy luchadora esta casada, con el Sr. Jorge tienen 2 hijos menores, ella tiene un taller D. costura  y el marido se dedica a la confección D. calzados, ella empezó a dedicarse en este rubro con una empresa conocida,  con un poco D. ahorro pudo comprar para su maquina y así logro independizarse.
Solicitó dicho crédito para la compra D. una maquina industrial y materias primas como telas , forros , cierres, accesorios para.
 En el futuro espera tener un negocio mas amplio, para poder contratar  gente, y así ayudar a su comunidad, y lo mas importante darle estabilidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a very hard-working woman. She is married to Jorge and they have 2 young children. Esperanza has a sewing workshop and her husband makes shoes. She started this work for a well-known business, and with some savings she was able to buy her machine and achieved independence. She is requesting this loan to purchase an industrial machine and basic materials like fabric, lining, clasps and accessories. In the future, she hopes to have a larger business, in order to be able to hire people and thus help her community. The most important thing is to give stability to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Industrial sewing machine and accessories

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Celestino

texts.es: Celestino, es un hombre honesto y laborioso que tiene 55 años, está casado con Juliana de 51 años, ambos tienen 2 hijos, que son su adoración, esta familia vive en su casa propia. La actividad agrícola es el oficio que practica desde hace 30 años y en este largo tiempo sembró diferentes variedades de papa. Desde entonces afrontó muchas dificultades, como el alza de precio y las perdidas de su cosecha, pero estas situaciones nunca lo hicieron rendirse, sino por el contrario,  hicieron que él ame su trabajo, labrando con bastante esmero y dedicación. En tanto su esposa, cría ganado ovino, porcino y vacuno, para luego venderlo y de cuyas ganancias la ayudan afrontar algún imprevisto económico. Considera que la agricultura es muy rentable, pues le permite vivir cómodamente y cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos, quienes son su adoración y su motivo para continuar trabajando. En adelante arrendará sus tierras para poder tener ingresos económicos y con la administración de sus hijos continuará sembrando pero en mayor cantidad, asimismo comprará más cabezas de ganado ovino, que venderá cuando necesite. Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y está contento de laborar en su grupo comunal, porque le gusta ahorrar dinero para disponerlo en el futuro. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono, que facilitarán el buen crecimiento de sus productos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Celestino is an honest and hard-working 55 year old man. He is married to 51 year old Juliana. They have two children, whom they adore. This family lives in their own house. Farming has been his occupation for 30 years. During those many years he has planted different varieties of potatoes. He faced many difficulties like prices rising and losing his crops. But, these situations never made him give up; they did just the opposite. They made him love his work. He works very carefully and with dedication. So does his wife. She raises sheep, pigs, and cows. She later sells them. Her earnings help her confront any unforeseen event. He considers farming to be very profitable. It allows him to live comfortably, and it covers his children’s necessities. He adores his children, and they are his reason for continuing to work. In the future he will rent his fields to be able to have income. Under his children’s management he will continue planting, but in greater quantities. He will also buy more heads of sheep, which he will sell when needed. This is his fourth loan with MFP. He is happy to work with his communal bank because he likes to save money for the future. He will use the loan he has requested to buy sacks of fertilizer. This will facilitate good growth of his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
ZORAIDA
Hace muchos años la Sra. Zoraida apertura un restaurant en un pequeño local el cual con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación pudo adquirirlo, pero vio la necesidad de tener su propia casa así que con sus ingresos compro un terreno y pudo construirlo ahora alquila su restaurant y en su casa tiene una pequeña tienda que la ayuda a pagar los estudios de sus hijos y los gastos en casa. Ella está muy contenta y agradecida con EDAPROSPO y KIVA  por los préstamos recibidos. Seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.
texts.en:
ZORAIDA Many years ago Zoraida opened a restaurant in a small place. She was able to get it with much effort and dedication. But, she saw the necessity of having her own house. She used her earnings to buy a piece of land, and she was able to build it. Now she rents her restaurant. She has a small store in her house, which helps her pay for her children’s education and the household expenses. She is very happy with and grateful to Edaprospo and Kiva for the loans she has received. EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Santos Angel

texts.es:
el sr. Santos Angel R. tiene un molino en el cual muele maiz y tambien vende leña, tiene mas de 4 años de dedicarse a esta actividad es soltero y es padre de 1 hija la cual ya esta casada.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar unos repuestos para el molino y tambien para comprar leña..
desea darle mantenimiento a su molino esto le permitira tener un mejor rendimiento y de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, logrando mejores ingresos los que le permitiran mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Santos Angel Rodríguez has a mill, which he uses to grind corn. He also sells firewood. He has been doing this activity for four years. He is single, and he has one daughter. She is already married. He will use the loan to buy replacement parts for his mill. He will also buy firewood. He wants to provide maintenance for his mill. This will allow him to have better output. This way he can give his customers better service. Then he will get greater income, which will allow him to improve his living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy firewood and replacement parts for the mill

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
REYNA 
Nuestra socia Reyna es una mujer luchadora ella empezó su negocio hace muchos años al principio vendía refrescos ambulatoriamente, pera las personas solicitaban postres  así que tuvo la idea de prepararlos como son arroz con leche, mazamorra de calabaza, mazamorra morada entre otros, después de mucho tiempo y esfuerzo se pudo establecerse en un pequeño mercado por su casa. Uno de sus objetivos es ampliar su negocio y ahorrar para el futuro. Ella está agradecida con el préstamo y continuara cumpliendo sus obligaciones de pago. Seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.
texts.en:
REYNA Our member, Reyna, is a tenacious woman. She started her business many years ago. At first she sold soft drinks as a traveling salesperson. But, people asked for desserts. That is how she had the idea to make desserts like rice with milk, pumpkin “mazamorra” (a typical Peruvian sweet), and corn mazammora, among others. After a long time and much effort she was able to set up a small market in her house. One of her objectives is to expand her business and save for the future. She is grateful for the loan, and she will continue to make her payments on time. EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: Chicas Lindas Group

texts.es:
El comité Chicas Lindas nace hace aproximadamente 1 año, y actualmente se encuentran trabajando muy conforme con las actividades que realizan. 
 Realizaran  actividades para ayudar y asi se ayudadan entre todas para  el pago de las cuotas de los créditos que reciben de la Fundación Paraguaya.
 Para los ingresos individuales cada una realiza una actividad, una de las ellas es la señora Francisca quien tiene una peluqueria donde ofrece sus servicios de peluqueria.
Ella hace muy buenos trabajos en su salon es muy frecuentada por las clientas.
Para ofrecer mayor a sus clientas ella queire comprar un sillón para peluquería por lo que solicita el préstamo.
texts.en:
The Chicas Lindas Communal Bank formed approximately one year ago. They are currently happily working with the activities they do. They will carry out activities in order to help. That way they help everyone to make the payments on the loans they receive from the Fundación Paraguaya. For the individual incomes each one carries out an activity. One of these women is Francisca. She has a beauty salon, and she offers hairdressing services. She does very good work in her salon, and her shop is frequented by many customers. In order to offer her customers more she wants to buy a hairdresser’s chair. That is why she is requesting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a hairdresser's chair and other tools

loans.name: Miriam Ruth

texts.es:
MIRIAM
Esfuerzo y dedicacion es lo que Miriam demuestra ya que empezo su trabajo vendiendo cosmeticos por catalogo cuando su hijo era aun pequeño, Poco a poco comenzo a incrementar su negocio y comenzo a vender bebidas como: cervezas y gaseosas. Cuando quedo embarazada por segunda vez aperturo una bodega en casa donde pudo descansar un poco, Ese negocio lo mantiene hasta ahora y la ayuda a pagar los gastos familiares. Ella tiene como objetivo ampliar su tienda ademas le gustaria estudiar un curso de enfermeria para poder ejercerlo y tener mayores ingresos. Seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.
texts.en:
When her son was younger, Miriam demonstrated effort and dedication as she started her business selling cosmetics through catalogs. She gradually expanded her business and began selling beverages such as beer and sodas. When she became pregnant for the second time, Miriam opened a store in her home so that she would have time to rest. She continues to maintain this business since it helps her pay for the family expenses. Miriam intends to expand her store and also begin studying nursing so that she can pursue this profession and earn more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Alva Rosa

texts.es:
la sra. Alva Rosa S. L. tiene varios años de dedicarse a la elaboracion y venta de pan y rosquillas, 
actividad que realiza en su casa de habitación con ayuda de una empleada, su producto lo distribuye en diferentes negocios de la zona. con los ingresos que le genera el negocio ayuda a su esposo a cubrir los gastos en el hogar, tienen tres  hijos pero solo uno esta al cargo de ellos, estudia en el colegio de la comunidad, este credito lo utilizara para comprar materiales para fabricar las rosquillas y el pan.
desea mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia.
Su esposo se dedica a la ganaderia.
Sus deseos es que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales
texts.en:
Sra. Alva Rosa S. L. has been making and selling bread and donuts for several years. She works at home and has the assistance of one employee. Her products are distributed to different business in the area. With the income that her business generates, Alva is able to help her husband with the household expenses. They have three children, but only one is still in their care and attends the local high school.
