This loan will be used to buy ingredients for making donuts and bread. She wants to improve the living conditions for herself and her family. Her husband raises livestock. They want to see their children become successful professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making donuts and bread

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: La Ilusión De Los Ríos Group

texts.en:
This comunal bank is called “La Ilusión de Los Ríos”, and this is the second time they are requesting a loan from Kiva. This group is made up of thirteen members who live in the city of Temuco. Their businesses are: a dessert shop, sewing, a hair salon, food preparation, clothing sales, hardware store, and Internet center.

The group member interviewed for this borrower profile is Olga, who is the group’s treasurer. In the photo, Olgo is pictured in the second row, standing to the left, with shoulder-length hair and bangs.

Olga’s business is a dessert shop: she primarily makes chocolate lollipops, cookies, and fruit tarts. She also fills special orders for cakes and other desserts. She has a number of regular clients among the people she knows, and through them she makes contact with other clients.

Olga plans to invest this loan in materials and ingredients to prepare her desserts, particularly using a wider variety of figure molds to make her chocolates.

Olga’s dream is to have her business in an established locale in the center of the city, because this would bring her more clients. Her greatest motivation is her family, especially her 16-year-old son who hopes to attend university in two years.

What Olga has enjoyed most about working with Fondo Esperanza have been the workshops that focus on “autoconocimiento”, or self-awareness, because through these she has been able to discover her weaknesses and her strengths and to identify how to overcome the former and maximize the latter. She also very much enjoys her contact with the other group members, and how quickly she was able to get her loan through Fondo Esperanza.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region. It is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (the capital of Chile) and possesses a series of lake-side spa resorts and striking native flora and fauna. This region is also noteworthy for being the region where 50% of Chile's existing indigenous Mapuche community lives, some of whom are members of Fondo Esperanza communal banks.

loans.use: To buy materials and ingredients to prepare her desserts

loans.name: Clara

texts.es: Clara, de 30 años vive con su esposo Juan y sus 4 hijos, en la vivienda de sus suegros, ubicado en la ciudad de Tarma, ya que sus hijos tienen mayores oportunidades académicas. Su habilidad hace que cada cosecha, se comercialice de manera rápida y a buen precio, pues Clara, es una de las mejores productoras de papa, por eso los mayoristas ya la conocen y le compran los tubérculos en el mercado de su ciudad. La  calidad de sus frutos es incomparable y esto gracias a los 13 años de experiencia, tiempo que le ha dedicado a la agricultura. Su esposo, quien la ayuda en el trabajo, procuran sembrar papa y de la variedad yungay, única y de diferentes colores, pues cada color tiene otro sabor. Lo que más le gusta es ofrecer su producto al mercado central de Tarma  y a la ciudad de La Merced. Clara se considera una mujer de negocios, es por eso que planea tener una tienda de comestibles en su casa propia, que pronto construirá y de esa manera logrará obtener una mejor calidad de vida. Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y reafirma que le gusta laborar con los integrantes de su grupo comunal, porque son personas unidas y responsables. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará fertilizantes, que le ayudará a obtener una buena producción.
texts.en:
Clara is 30 years old and lives with her husband Juan and their four children in the home of her in-laws located in the city of Tarma, which allows her children to have more academic opportunities. Clara’s job is to produce her crops as quickly and cheaply as possible. She is considered to be one of the best potato producers since she is already known among the wholesalers who buy her tubers at the city market. The quality of her produce is incomparable thanks to her 13 years of experience in agriculture. Her husband, who helps with the work, grows the Yungay variety of potato which is unique because it comes in different colors and each color has a different flavor. What she enjoys most about her job is selling her products at the central market in Tarma and in the city of La Merced. Clara considers herself to be a businesswoman, so she plans to build and open a grocery store in her home so that she can achieve a better quality of life.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. She reaffirms her joy of working with the other members of her Communal Bank because they are close-knit and responsible people. With the loan she requested, Clara will buy fertilizers to help her achieve good production.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es:
Claudia Patricia Álvarez B. es una mujer que vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de 8 años en un municipio muy cerca de Cartagena; de 26 años y de naturaleza artesana, aprendió esta actividad por tradición familiar ayudada por sus vecinos; ahora Claudia, produce mochilas hechas a mano y bolsos tejidos en telar vertical y también hamacas tejidas por su mama. Se dedicó a esta actividad debido a que son pocas las fuentes de empleo y con estos productos genera ingresos para su hogar, aunque también trabaja tres horas en la mañana prestando el servicio de aseo a una empresa de la población y con todo esto y los ingresos de su esposo, que es moto taxista (un sistema de transporte muy utilizado en esta población), se sostienen como familia. Ella dice que debe  trabajar mucho y duro para sostener y criar a su hijo, y también para poder capacitarse y llegar a tener un futuro mejor. Para Claudia, una vez murió su padre, la vida se tornó mas dura  sin él, quien  la ayudaba mucho y siempre estaba pendiente de su familia y esto aunque hace 3 años, ha marcado su vida para siempre.
Ella ya había recibido 1 préstamo  de la Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, y desde que los recibió el negocio ha generado mas ingresos para el sostenimiento de la familia, compraron un lote y muebles para el hogar, y  en estos momentos tienen una moto de su propiedad. Está aplicando con este préstamo a un monto de $1.100.000 COP, que  invertirá en compra de hilaza para tejer hamacas, hilo para mochilas y bolsos. Siguiendo adelante, su meta es tener su casa propia y un negocio con su local sea de artesanías o una droguería (en lo cual tiene experiencia) ya que se ha capacitado en cursos de administración de medicamentos de droguería.
texts.en:
Claudia Patricia Álvarez B. lives with her husband and eight year old son in a town near Cartagena. She is 26 years old and a naturally talented craftswoman. Claudia learned this traditional skill from her neighbors. She currently produces woven satchels and handbags on a vertical loom, while her mother makes woven hammocks. Claudia started this business because there were few employment opportunities and these products allow her to generate income from home. In addition, she works three hours in the morning providing cleaning services to a local business. Combined with the income of her husband who works as a motorcycle taxi driver (the most common form of transportation in this area), Claudia is able to support her family. She says she must work long and hard to support, raise, and teach her son so that he can have a better future. After her father passed away, Claudia says life was much harder without him since he had been a great help and was an outstanding presence in her family. Even though he died three years ago, his mark on her life will last forever.

Claudia has already received one loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and since then, her business has generated more income to support her family. She was able to buy a plot of land and furniture for her home. Her family even has their own motorcycle. Claudia is applying for a loan in the amount of 1,100,000 COP to invest in the purchase of yarn for making hammocks, satchels, and handbags. To continue moving forward, her goal is to have her own house and her own business location for either a craft shop or a drugstore since she has previous experience and pharmacy training.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase yarn for making hammocks, satchels, and handbags

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria, de 44 años, vive en su casa que es propia, al lado de  su esposo Florentino (55) y a sus 3 hijos de los 5 que tiene, pues sus hijos mayores trabajan y viven independientes.Se dedica al cultivo de papa, de diferentes variedades, pues en el lugar donde vive por la altura, sólo produce tubérculos, que cuida con esmero, por eso es considerada una de las mejores productoras de este producto, y  asegura que  su cosecha es exitosa, porque siempre labora junto a su esposo. Además  cría animales como carneros, vacas, caballos y cerdos, que vende cuando necesita salir de algún apuro económico, y  lo que más le gusta de la chacra es cosechar con esmero y cuidar de sus animales, mientras comen a lo largo de los verdes pastizales. Además considera que su oficio es muy  rentable, y para el futuro, quiere seguir sembrando, pero en mayor cantidad para lograr  disfrutar de mejores ganancias.Esta es la cuarta vez, que tiene un préstamo con MFP y le gusta laborar en su banco comunal, porque ya conoce la metodología de su  trabajo y lo que más le gusta es participar de las charlas educativas en las que aprende bastante.Gloria tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono que necesita para proteger sus cultivos de papa de las constantes amenazas, como las plagas, que muchas veces echan a perder sus producciones.
texts.en:
Gloria is 44 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Florentio (age 55) and three of their five children. The older children work and live independently. Gloria grows potatoes of different varieties since the place where she is lives is located in high altitude. She only produces tubers and provides them great care, which is why she is considered one of the best producers of this product. To ensure that her harvest is successful, she always works together with her husband. Gloria also raises animals such as sheep, cows, horses, and pigs and sells them as needed based on her financial needs. What she enjoys most is raising her crops and taking care of her animals by allowing them to feed on green pastures. She considers her work to be very profitable and wants to continue farming in the future, but in larger quantities so that she can enjoy greater income.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. She enjoys working with her Communal Bank because she is familiar with its work methodology and likes participating in the educational seminars. Gloria plans to invest the money she requested in the purchase of several sacks of compost that are needed to protect her potato crops from constant threats, such as pests, that can ruin her production.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of compost

loans.name: Petrona Del Carmen

texts.es:
la sra. Petrona del Carmen L. tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, la cual la realiza en su casa de habitacion, tiene la ayuda de sus hijas para elaborar su producto.
las rosquillas las distribuye en diferentes negocios de la zona.
con los ingresos que le genera el negocio cubre los gastos en el hogar en un 100%  tiene tres hijas a su cargo y cursan la secundaria en centros  deducativos de la localidad,
a logrado sembrar maiz lo que le permite bajar los costos para elaborar su producto. 
gracias a las ganancias que le a brindado su negocio ella y su familia han mejorado las condiciones de vida. 
tiene a una de sus hijas estudiando en la universidad la cual es pasante de clases de administracion de empresas y una de sus ideas es que cuando ella se  gradue es apoyar a su madre en su pequeña fabrica mejorando el sistema de produccion y promocion de su productos.
texts.en:
Sra. Petrona del Carmen L. has been baking for several years. She works from home and makes her product with the help of her daughters. Her donuts are distributed to different businesses in the area. With the earnings from her business, Petrona is able to cover 100% of her household expenses. She has three daughters in her care who attend school in the area. Petrona also grows corn in order to lower some of her production costs.

Thanks to the income she has earned from her business, Petrona and her family have improved their living conditions. One of her daughters is studying business administration at the university and plans to support her mother after she graduates by opening a small factory to improve the production system and the marketing of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase butter, flour, sugar, eggs, margarine, cheese, and firewood

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es:
La Sra. Griselda es soltera con una hija menor , ella se dedica a compra y ventas de pescado , tiene su negocio en su domicilio. Ella se inicio en el rubro con su padre , ya que se dedica a lo mismo , con un poco de su ahorro pudo montar su  propio negocio y se  independizo.

Ella  necesita de este crédito para la compra mas pescado , ya que tiene varios pedidos. En el futuro  desea abrir otra pescaderia y dar fuente de trabajo.
texts.en:
Sra. Griselda is single and has a young daughter. She buys and sells fish and has a business in her home. Griselda started working with her father who is in the same line of business. After some time, she used her savings to start her own business and become independent. She needs a loan to buy more fish since she has several orders. In the future, she hopes to open another fish shop that will provide an additional source of work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fish to sell

loans.name: La Almendra Group

texts.es:
El grupo “LA ALMENDRA”  nombrado así por que enfrente de sus casas hay una planta de Almendra. Es integrado por 2 mujeres y 2 hombres. Los representa doña Martha Alicia Méndez D. tiene 2 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de comida, refrescos, bisutería realizando sus pedidos en la ciudad de Nacajuca, para vender en el parque principal del mismo municipio. Doña Norma tiene 2 hijos, tiene su venta de refrescos. Don Jesús Lázaro Álvarez se dedica a la mudanza y fletes para esto tiene su camioneta para realizar su actividad y Jesús Lázaro Pérez se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado.   

Doña Marthita como así la conocen, comprara más refrescos como coca cola, Fanta, jumex,  agua, Chivacola, sabritas, mamut, además vende comida en su domicilio, bisutería, trabaja también por las mañanas de cocinera, sueña con tener un puesto de comida y  que sus hijos puedan estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Son muy trabajadores y sus actividades son diferentes, es un grupo solidario y se conocen desde hace años y todos son vecinos.  

Agradecen el apoyo que le brinda la Fundación y KIVA por darles la oportunidad de ser  clientes que se suman a la lista de ser  apoyados mediante un crédito para poder realizar sus pequeños negocios.
texts.en:
The “Almendra” (Almond) Group is aptly named because the members have almond trees in front of their houses. Two women and two men make up this group. Doña Martha Alicia Méndez D. has two children. She sells food, soft drinks, and jewelry by order in the city of Nacajuca, primarily from the main municipal park. Doña Norma has two children and sells soft drinks. Don Jesús Lázaro Álvarez has a moving business and owns a truck for hauling cargo. Jesús Lázaro Pérez buys and sells cattle.

Doña Marthita, as she is known, plans to buy more refreshments such as Coca-Cola, Fanta, Jumex, water, Chiva Cola, Sabritas (a brand of snack food), and Mamut (a brand name of marshmallow chocolate cookie). She also sells food and jewelry out of her home. In the mornings she works as a cook, but she dreams of having her own food stand and seeing her children study for a college degree.

Despite engaging in different business activities, they are a close-knit group of hard workers who have known each other for years and are neighbors. They are grateful for the support provided by Fundación Realidad and Kiva and for having the opportunity to be among the list of clients who have received the help of a loan to maintain their small businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks & snack foods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase anti-parasitic medicines, weight loss remedies, ointments, natural herbs, salves, etc.

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
la sra. ANITA S. Se dedica al comercio cuenta con una pulperia y  ventas de variedades,  actividad a la que se dedica desde hace  mas de 36  años, su negocio y su familia son bien conocidos en el municipio ya que son de los primeras familias en instalarse en Trojes. Doña Anita y su esposo han sacado adelante a su familia  y fue 
mediante este negocio que ellos comenzaron a dedicarse al comercio ahora aparte de tener su tienda tambien 
se dedican a la ganaderia y caficultura ya que la zona tiene muy buenas condiciones por ser zona humeda y de pastos verdes y tambien predominan las elevadas montañas . Doña Anita se ha sabido ganar la clientela gracias a su amabilidad y respeto.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Anita S. is a businesswoman who manages a grocery and variety store. She has been in business for more than 36 years. Both her business and her family are well known in town since they were one of the first families to settle in Trojes. Doña Anita and her husband have used this business to move their family forward. In addition to running a store, her family also engages in livestock and coffee production since the area has very good conditions. The humidity and green pastures dominate this high-elevation mountain region. Doña Anita has been able to attract customers by showing them kindness and respect.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise to restock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: Jaime, de 31 años, es soltero y  vive en la casa de sus padres.Desde hace algunos años es profesor de un colegio secundario, pero también  es agricultor y lo dice orgulloso, pues lleva 15 años dedicado al cultivo de papa, de diferentes variedades. Los fines de semana  en su tiempo libre siembra con la ayuda de su padre. En la actualidad, lo que más le gusta de su chacra es mantenerla limpia, sin embargo, le disgusta cuando las inclemencias del tiempo o las plagas atacan sus sembríos de papa. Como es una persona de retos, que desea salir adelante, ha pensado en iniciar un proyecto – sembrar yuca – producto que crece en la selva, y también para  más adelante, quiere comprarse  una hacienda ganadera.Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y le agrada laborar en su banco comunal, porque esta integrado por personas muy responsables y honestas como él.Jaime tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes que necesita para la próxima siembra de papa.
texts.en:
Jaime is 31 years old, single, and lives with his parents. For a few years he has been a high school teacher, but he is proud to say he is also a farmer. For fifteen years, he has grown a many varieties of potatoes. In his free time on the weekends, he tends his crops with the help of his father. Right now, what he likes most about his work is keeping his field tidy. He really dislikes it when bad weather and insects affect his crops. As he is a person with goals and is determined to get ahead, he is thinking about beginning a new project, planting the native crop yuca. In the future he would like to buy a cattle farm. This is Jaime’s fourth loan from MFP, and he enjoys working with his communal bank because it is comprised of responsible and hard-working people like him. Jaime plans to invest this loan in the purchase of bags of fertilizer that he needs the for next time he plants potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Digmar

texts.es: Digmar, es un hombre muy trabajador, tiene 35 años, vive feliz en su casa propia a lado de su esposa Enafilia de 34 años, y sus dos pequeños hijos, quienes son su motivación para esforzarse cada día. Junto a su esposa, se dedican al cultivo de coco, plátano, café, maíz,  yuca y frutas cítricas, sobre sus fértiles terrenos que posee. Cuando decidieron hacer una vida en común, valoraron el aprendizaje que le dieron sus padres, además porque estos frutos son los que mejor producen en esta zona de la Selva Central del Perú. Cada mañana de manera ordenada Digmar, sale a limpiar y cuidar sus cultivos, porque sabe que la recompensa de su ardua labor vendrá en la cosecha. Él confiesa que le fascina ver sus plantaciones fuertes, sin maleza que interrumpa su crecimiento. Su mayor anhelo es que sus hijos puedan estudiar una carrera profesional en la ciudad y no dependan de las labores agrícolas solamente, a pesar de ser muy rentable. Por el momento desea aumentar la cantidad de plantaciones de café y naranjas que tiene. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP y como presidente de la junta directiva de su grupo, es quien hace cumplir las normas y reglas de su grupo comunal, para que todo marche muy bien como hasta ahora. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará diversas herramientas de trabajo como machetes y javas, también contratará operarios para que limpien los terrenos que acaba de comprar.
texts.en:
Digmar is a very hard-working man. He is 35 years old and lives very happily in his own house with his wife Enafilia, who is 34, and their two small children, who are his motivation to work hard everyday. With his wife, he grows coconuts, bananas, coffee, corn, cassava and citrus fruits on fertile land that he owns. When Digmar and Enafilia decided to make a life together, they chose these crops because they valued the teaching his parents gave him, and also because these crops are the ones that grow best in this zone of Peru's Central Jungle. Every morning, according to his routine, Digmar goes out to weed and take care of his crops because he knows the payment for his hard work will come in the harvest. He confesses that it fascinates him to see his plants grow strong, without any disease that interrupts their growth. His greatest desire is for his children to be able to study a professional career in the city and not depend on agricultural work, despite its being very profitable. For the moment he wants to increase the number of coffee fields and orange fields that he has. This is Digmar's second loan with MFP, and as president of the board of directors of his group, he is the one to makes his communal bank follow its rules. For this reason everything has gone very well until now. With the loan he is requesting, Digmar will buy various work tools like machetes and crates. He will also hire workers to clear the fields he has just bought.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy machetes and crates, and hire workers to clear his fields

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
El señor Andres tiene 49 años. Tiene dos hijos mayores de edad. Su conyuge actulmente se encuentra y trabajando en España ya de esa forma puede ayudar para el bienestar de su familia.
Por su parte, don Andrès es taxista desde el año 2007, prestando sus servicios en una parada ubicada en la ciudad de Fernando de la Mora.
 Don Andrès necesita de este crédito para adquirir un nuevo automóvil para su actividad de taxi, pues desea brindar un buen servicio a los pasajeros que diariamente atiende, y el vehículo con el que cuenta actualmente ya no resulta seguro, rentable y cómodo para  el efecto. 
 En el futuro desea poder ser dueño de dos automóviles  tipo taxi para entregar uno a su hijo asì como también la adquisición de una nueva parada para este ultimo.
texts.en:
Andres is 49 years old. He has two adult children. His wife is currently living and working in Spain to help with the family's well-being. For his part, Andres has been a taxi driver since 2007, offering his services at a taxi stand in the city of Fernando de la Mora. Andres needs this loan to acquire a new automobile for his taxi service, since he wants to offer good service to the passengers he assists daily, and the vehicle he currently uses is no longer safe, profitable and comfortable enough for him to do this. In the future, he wants to be the owner of two taxis so he can give one to his son. He also wants to acquire a new stand for the second taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an automobile

loans.name: Nueva Integracion Group

texts.es:
Miryam es la socia entusiasta, responsable y alegre que representa la Alcancía Comunal “Nueva Integración” ella se dedica  a la comercialización de vinos, que además lo reparte a pedidos, lo trae desde la ciudad de  Ica, al sur de Lima, Luz es otra de nuestras socias que trabaja como profesora en un colegio, hace varios años, ella desea aperturar una librería en casa que le permita mejorar sus ingresos.

Benny tiene una tienda en casa donde lo aperturo con mucho esfuerzo ella vende diversos productos de librería y ropa esto le permite aportar con los gastos en casa. Gracias a los préstamos los socios pueden invertir en diferentes negocios que les permitan contribuir con los gastos y la manutención de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Miryam is the enthusiastic, responsible and happy member who represents the Nueva Integración Communal Bank. She works selling wines, which she also distributes on order. She brings the wines from the city of Ica, south of Lima. Luz is another of our members who has worked for several years as a teacher in a high school. She wants to open a bookstore in her house, which would help her increase her income. Benny has a store in her home which she opened with great effort. She sells several bookstore-type products and clothing. This allows her to contribute toward household expenses. Thanks to the loans, the members can invest in different businesses which permit them to contribute to household expenses and support their children.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products and supplies

loans.name: Nerida Geovana

texts.es: La Sra. Nerida Geovana F. R. de 39 años de edad es madre soltera. Vive en casa de su madre con sus hijos, el cual uno de ellos ya es independiente. Trabaja como obrera de planta en la empresa Iqf del Peru desde hace 8 años. Solicita el crédito para terminar de construir su casa ya que su madre le ha donado un terreno. Es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable que ha brindado una buena educación a sus hijos con mucho esfuerzo y pretende tener una mejor calidad de vida. Su sueño es poder concluir con la construcción de su casa. La Sra Nerida Geovana F. R., agradece la ayuda que le podamos brindar a trávez de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Ms. Nerida Geovana F. R., 39 years old, is a single mother. She lives in her mother's house with her children, one of whom is independent. She has been employed for 8 years as a factory worker for IQF [a business focusing on activities such as freezing and preserving food for export]. She is requesting this loan to finish construction of her house now that her mother has provided a piece of land to build on. She is a very hard working and responsible person who, through much effort, has provided a good education to her children and hopes to have a better quality of life. Her dream is to be able to complete the construction of the house. Ms. Nerida Geovana F. R. is grateful for the assistance that we have been able to provide her through this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Housing improvements.

loans.name: Henry Daniel

texts.es:
el sr. Henry Daniel Gonzales se dedica al comercio tiene una tienda en la cual vende ropa, sombreros, zapatos, y otras cosas mas. Henry a sabado administrar bien su tienda, le a dado muy buenos resultados, anteriormente tenia su negocio en su carrito y vendia ambulante, ahora ya tiene su propio local, el cual esta ubicado en la calle del comercio de este municipio. El sr. Henry se caracteriza por que da los precios mas bajos de la zona y por la amabilidad con la que atiende a sus clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para surtir mas su negocio ya que entre mejor surtido esta son mayores las oportunidades de vender y asi sus clientes se sentiran satisfechos.
texts.en:
Mr. Henry Daniel G. has a store where he sells clothing, hats, shoes, and other things. Knowing how to run his store well has given Henry very good results. He used to run his business out of a mobile cart, but now he has his own store located on the commercial street of his town. Henry is known for having the lowest prices in the area and for his friendliness when serving his customers. He will use this loan to increase stock at his store, because having a better selection will increase his opportunities to make sales and to satisfy his customers’ needs.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, skirts, blouses, underwear, umbrellas, belts, hats, and shoes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl, de 44 años, está casado con Gisela de 44 años también, ambos tienen 5 hijos pero sólo viven con 4 de ellos, juntos viven en su casa propia. Todos los días desde que salen los primeros rayos de sol hasta cuando se oculta, trabaja junto a su esposa, cultivando  café, frutas cítricas, plátanos, achiote y maíz. Disfruta mucho su trabajo, como cultivar y limpiar sus plantaciones durante los meses de Junio, Julio, Agosto y Septiembre, debido al buen clima que se presenta durante esos meses. Sin embargo, trasladar sus pesados productos, en invierno le es muy difícil, porque el río “Perene” incrementa su caudal y sólo pasan haciendo uso de lanchas, ya que no cuentan con un puente que facilite su traslado. Asegura que su oficio le es rentable porque en los 14 años que tiene dedicados a la agricultura nunca le faltó que comer, sino por el contrario les pudo brindar a sus hijos lo mejor que puede. En adelante, quiere incrementar su producción e iniciar con plantaciones de cacao, pues observa que es un fruto muy solicitado y bien pagado en el mercado de su ciudad. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP y esta muy satisfecho de trabajar con su grupo comunal, por ser todos responsables y trabajan de manera organizada. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará 8 sacos de fertilizantes, asimismo pretende comprar herramientas de trabajo como machetes para la limpieza de sus tierras agrícolas.
texts.en:
Raúl is 44 years old and is married to Gisela, also 44. They have 5 children together, but only 4 live with them in their own house. Every day from sunrise to sunset he works with his wife growing coffee, bananas, achiote, and corn. He really likes his work, especially maintaining his crops in the lovely weather in June, July, and August. Nevertheless, transporting his heavy goods in winter is very difficult because the Perene River floods its banks and can only be crossed by boat, since there is no bridge. He attests that his work is profitable, as in his 14 years as a farmer he has never wanted for food. Instead, it has enabled him to provide very well for his children. In the future he would like to increase his production and begin planting cacao, which is in high demand and commands a high price in his city’s market. This is Raúl’s second loan from MFP, and he is very happy to work with his communal bank since all its members are responsible and well-organized. He will use the loan to buy 8 bags of fertilizer as well as some tools like machetes to help maintain his fields.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase machetes to keep his fields tidy

loans.name: Petrona Isabel

texts.es:
En el Municipio de Sabanagrande localizado en la región centro oriental del Departamento del Atlántico a 20 kilómetros de su Distrito Capital Barranquilla, vive y tiene su negocio Petrona M.: una mujer, madre de 3 jóvenes de 18 a 27 años, que a fuerza de trabajo en su negocio, los ha sacado adelante; Petrona   fabrica     fritos  como arepuelas, caribañolas y empanadas y también una especie de amasijos de maíz blanco o amarillo  llamado bollo limpio y de mazorca respectivamente, usando como materia prima el mismo maíz y adicionándole ingredientes como el queso, el aniz entre otros que inventa día a día; este es su negocio principal del que recibe ingresos todos los días, pero también prepara pasteles y sopas los fines de semana y días festivos para las familias, que tienen por costumbre descansar de las actividades domésticas alimentarias los domingos y días festivos y comprar la comida ya elaborada.

Petrona aplicará a su tercer crédito en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, por valor de $2.000.000 COP,  y lo utilizará para comprar materia prima por volumen y lograr adecuaciones locativas y nuevos enseres para la cocina; está muy contenta de haberle podido inyectar capital de trabajo a su negocio  pues ha tenido muchos beneficios y ha mejorado su vida personal y familiar 
 
Ella sueña con construir un local independiente con todas las normas de salud exigidas porque su desafío mas grande es la falta de un local y el dinero suficiente para adecuarlo como ella sueña, sin embargo dedicará todos sus esfuerzos para mas adelante lograrlo.
texts.en:
In the Municipality of Sabanagrande located in the central eastern region of the Atlántico Department, 20 kilometers from its District Capital Barranquilla, Petrona M. lives and has her business: a woman, mother of 3 from the ages of 18 to 27, who by working in her business, has given them a good start in life. Petrona makes fried food like arepuelas (corn bread), caribañolas (dumplings) and empañadas and also a type of bread with white or yellow corn called "bollo limpio" and "de mazorca" respectively, using the same corn as a raw material and adding ingredients to it like cheese and aniseed among others that she makes up day by day. This is her main business from which she receives a daily income, but she also prepares pies and soups in the weekends and holidays for the families, whose custom it is to have a rest from domestic cooking activities on Sundays and holidays and buy prepared food. Petrona is applying for her third loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to the value of $2,000,000 COP, and will use it to buy bulk raw materials and manage to adapt the premises and have new fittings for the kitchen. She is very happy to have been able to inject working capital into her business as she has had a lot of profits and has improved her personal and family life. She dreams of building independent premises with all the required health regulations because her biggest challenge is the lack of premises and sufficient money to adapt it as she dreams of, nevertheless she will put all her efforts into achieving it in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bulk raw materials and manage to adapt the premises and have new fittings for the kitchen

loans.name: Ines Magdalena

texts.es:
Inés de 42 años, vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil, tiene cuatro hijos y su esposo es albañil, ella tiene una tienda pero por la inseguridad que hay en el sector por donde vive a tenido con enrejar casi todo el local y dejar solo un espacio para atender a los clientes. 

Por la falta de oportunidades ella hace tubo que invertir sus ahorros y empezar a vender los productos en su casa. Poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación ha agrandado su tienda. Ahora trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. 

Para tener mas oportunidades de incrementar su tienda ella quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz y bebidas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener mas grande su negocio y así asegurar el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Inés is 42 years old and lives in the suburbs of Guayaquil. She has four children and her husband is a mason. She owns a store but because of the lack of security in the area where she lives, she had to put metal grating up around almost the whole store, leaving only a small window to serve her customers through. Because of the lack of opportunities available to her, Inés decided to invest her savings and start to sell products from her house. Little by little, with much effort and dedication, she has expanded her store. Now she works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. In order to have more opportunities to grow her business, she would like to use this loan to buy rice and drinks for her store. In the future, she wants to expand her business so that she can secure her family’s future.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and drinks to sell

loans.name: Miriams Ildilcia

texts.es:
la sra. Miriams Ildilcia C. O. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacioon la cual opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería "LOS GEMELOS".
tambien vende ropa, calzado, articulos de plastico para la cocina.
con los ingresos que le genera este negocio contribuye a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y juntos sacan adelante a su famlia pues tienen dos hijos que cursan la secundaria, uno de los retos como padres de familia es heredarles una preparacion universitaria a sus hijos si Dios a si lo permite.
Han mejorado las condiciones de vida de ella y de su familia.
con las ganancias piensan hacerle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Miriams Ildilcia C. O. sells basic goods and groceries in her store, called "Los Gemelos". It is located in a room in her house. She also sells clothing, footwear, and plastic tupperware. With the income she earns from her business, Miriams helps her husband pay household expenses and together they support their family. They have 2 children who are in secondary school. As parents, they face the challenge of preparing their children to go to college, God willing. They have improved their family's quality of life, and with the rest of their earnings they hope to improve their home.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, butter, blouses, soccer shoes, toilet paper, beans, tortillas, salt, coffee, and cookies.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Estrellas De Fatima Group

texts.es:
Los socios D. esta Alcancía Comunal se dedican a diferentes negocios que les permiten contribuir con la economía en  casa. Teresa trabaja vendiendo ropa hace varios años además venD. ropa a pedidos con sus ingresos aporta con los gastos familiares.

Graciela es concesionaria en un club español hace 11 años, con varios años D. trabajo pudo comprar algunos artefactos que le permiten mejorar su negocio, pero eso no es suficiente así que con el préstamo desea adquirir otros artefactos que necesita para atender a sus clientes. El esfuerzo y la dedicación que ponen en su trabajo hace que los socios se sientan satisfechos ya que su objetivo es el bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
The members of this community bank are involved in different businesses which allows them to contribute to their household economies. Teresa has been selling clothes for years, and she also sells clothes upon request. Her earnings proviD. for her household costs. Graciela is a concessionaire at a Spanish club, where she has been for 11 years. Through years of work, she has been able to buy some appliances that have let her improve her business, but it has not been sufficient, so with this loan she hopes to add other appliances that she needs so as to better serve her customers. The effort and the dedication that they give to their work make the members feel satisfied since their goal is the well being of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es: Marcelo, de 32 años, vive con Manuela (28), con quien tiene 4 hijos, juntos habitan su acogedora casa que es  propia.Sus pequeños hijos, lo impulsan para trabajar cada día desde muy temprano en busca de una producción fructífera, pues se dedica al cultivo de papa, desde  hace 10 años. Según sus palabras su pareja es más trabajadora que él, “con ella, puedo pensar en tener grandes cosas, porque es luchadora, y sobre todo ahorrativa, en la casa nunca nos falta que comer, porque sabe administrar bien el dinero” asegura. Lo que más le gusta es proporcionarle guano a sus sembríos, porque así los protege de las inclemencias del tiempo. Marcelo está agradecido con sus tierras fértiles, porque le permiten cubrir los gastos del hogar, por eso quiere continuar sembrando, pero en mayor cantidad, para brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos.Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está contento de laborar en su banco comunal, porque en todo este tiempo ha logrado ahorrar regular cantidad de dinero.Marcelo tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes, insecticidas y plaguicidas, con los cuales asegurará sus cosechas.
texts.en:
Marcelo is 32 years old, and lives with Manuela (28), in their own cozy home with their four children. It is for their small children that they are driven to work every day from very early in the morning in search of fruitful production. He has been cultivating potatoes for 10 years. In his words, his wife is more hard-working than he is: "With her, I am able to think about having big things, because she is a fighter, and above all, thrifty. At home, we never miss eating, because she knows how to manage the money well," he assures.

What he likes most is to provide guano (a kind of fertilizer made from bird or bat dung) to his sown fields, because this way he can protect them from the inclemencies of the weather. Marcelo is grateful for his fertile lands, because they allow him to cover the expenses of the home, and for that he wants to continue sowing, but in greater quantity, in order to offer the best to his children.

This is the fourth time that he has a loan with MFP, and he is happy to work in his community bank, because in all this time, he has been able to save a fair amount of money. Marcelo has planned to invest the requested money in the purchase of several sacks of fertilizers, insecticides, and pesticides, with which he can insure his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and insectides for his crops

loans.name: Prosperidad Y Exito Group

texts.es:
Madeleine es la propietaria D. su propio minimarket que tiene por nombre “RAQUELITA” este negocio empezó poco a poco lo inicio su mama con una pequeña bodega, ella invirtió sus ahorros para convertirlo en lo que ahora es, por otro lado ella continua con su negocio D. fabricación y venta D. calzado  que es su negocio principal, con sus ganancias  ha podido mejorar la construcción D. su casa y mejorar el negocio del minimarket, compro una exhibidora y otros enseres necesarios, lo que ella quiere para mas adelante es tener una tienda mas granD. y  distribuir sus productos al por mayor sabe que algún día cercano lograra su objetivo .El grupo al cual pertenece se llama “PROSPERIDAD Y ÉXITO” lleva 02 años como miembro del grupo y como presidenta, su préstamo obtenido lo usara para comprar productos para su tienda y ofrecer variedad a su clientela.


* LA Sra Madeleine es la 5ta D. las sentadas, en la foto aparecen 2 socias pasivas
texts.en:
Madeleine is the proprietor of a convenience store named “RAQUELITA”. She started this business little by little with her mother with a small warehouse. She invested her savings to convert it into what it is now. She also continues with her business of making and selling shoes, which is her main business. With her earnings, she has been able to improve her house's construction and improve the convenience store business. She bought a display case, among other necessary things. What she wants for the future is to have a bigger store and distribute her products wholesale. She knows that one day soon she will meet her goal. The group she belongs to is called “PROSPERIDAD Y ÉXITO”. She has been a member and president of the group for 2 years. She will use the loan to buy products for her store and offer variety to her customers. * Madeleine is the 5th of the seated women. There are 2 passive members in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products for her convenience store.

loans.name: Gloria Azucena

texts.es:
la sra. Gloria Azucena S. se dedica la venta de ice cream y conos, su negocio opara bajo el nombre de  "LA GLORIA" esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion, Gloria es casada y madre de 3 hijos, 2 dependen de su matrimonio y estudian en la primaria de los centros educativos publicos de la ciudad de danli. 
La  Sra.Gloria  tiene  experiencia en el manejo de este tipo de negocio ya que son 3 años de dedicarse a la venta de helados que hacen bien en estos tiempos de tanto calor, sus clientes estan satisfechos con su esmerada
y fina atencion. 
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas ice cream y conos,
tiene la ayuda de su esposo para atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Gloria Azucena S. sells ice cream and cones. Her business operates under the name "LA GLORIA", and is located in her own home. Gloria is married and the mother of three children, two of which depend on her still and study in the elementary school of the public schools in the city of Danli. Gloria has experience in the management of this kind of business, since she has been selling ice cream for three years, which do well in these times of such heat. Her customers are satisfied with her merit and attention to fine detail. The loan will be used to purchase more ice cream and cones. She has the help of her husband to serve her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ice cream and boxes of cones

loans.name: La Unidad Group

texts.es:
El grupo “LA UNIDAD” decidieron ponerle el nombre de LA UNIDAD debido a que es un crédito familiar y todos los integrantes se dedican al negocio. La representante es la señora María Jesús Pérez L., el negocio de este grupo es el la elaboración de artesanías ellos realizan flores, abanicos, petates, canastos, forros para botellas, sombreros, bolsas de mano, tiene 2 hijos, que estudian la preparatoria y sus hijas mayores le ayudan en esta actividad ya que es un trabajo tedioso. Doña Janet no esta casada y su actividad dentro del negocio es elaborar las flores para adornar los productos que realizan, doña Severina es viuda ya no tiene hijos que dependan de ella más sin embargo, ella se encarga de hacer la costura tanto de forros como de los sombreros que elaboran, doña María Jesús se encarga de realizar el pintado y secado de las hojas de maíz, del pantano, del guano y de hacer el cortado de cañita para elaborar los petates, doña María Elena es la encargada de realizar las compras de joloche (hojas de maíz), del pantano, del guano, de listones y demás materia prima que necesitan para realizar sus productos. Este grupo vende sus productos a los artesanos que se ubican en la ciudad de Villahermosa, así como en eventos que realiza el gobierno estatal o municipal. 

Doña María Jesús, su madre y sus hijas, utilizan su crédito para la compra de materia prima tales como pegamentos, listones, guano, pantano, cañitas, pinturas, alambres, telas para forros, hilos, hileras, agujas y demás accesorios que necesiten para adornar los productos que realizan, Este grupo sueña con tener a largo plazo un local amplio en la ciudad de Villahermosa y bien ubicado para que sus productos tengan una demanda y que su negocio sea autosostenible. Son mujeres  muy trabajadoras  y responsables es un grupo familiar por lo que su lema es “la unión hace la fuerza” de ahí se deriva su nombre.  

Están agradecidas con el apoyo que le brinda la Fundación y KIVA ya que el crédito otorgado les ha servido de mucho para salir adelante en sus actividades, y de seguir trabajando con este crédito ven cada vez mas cerca la realización de su sueño.
texts.en:
The group "LA UNIDAD" (The Unity) decided to give themselves the name LA UNIDAD because this is a family loan, and all of the members work in the business. The representative is Sra. María Jesús Pérez L.. This group's business is the making of crafts, such as flowers, fans, knapsacks, baskets, coverings for bottles, hats, and handbags. She has two children, who study in the preparatory school, and her older daughters help her in her work, since it is a tedious job.

Janet is not married, and her activity within the business is to make the flowers that decorate the products that they make. Severina is a widow and doesn't have any children that depend on her anymore. She is in charge of the sewing of the coverings as well as the hats that they make. María Jesús is in charge of the painting and drying of the corn leaves, marsh leaves, palm leaves, and to cut the sticks to make the knapsacks. María Elena is in charge of buying the joloche (corn leaves), marsh leaves, palm leaves, ribbons, and other raw materials that they need to make their products. This group sells their products to the artisans that are located in the city of Villahermosa, as well as in events that the state or municipal government put on.

María Jesús, her mother, and her daughters, will use the loan for the purchase of raw materials such as glue, ribbon, palm leaves, marsh leaves, kabob sticks, paint, wire, fabric for coverings, thread, string, needles and the rest of the accessories that they need to decorate the products that they make. This group has a long term dream to have a spacious and well-located place in the city of Villahermosa where their products have demand and where their business can be self-sustainable. They are very hard-working and responsible women. It is a family group, and therefore their motto is: "There is strength in numbers", and it is from there that they derive their name.

They are grateful for the support offered by the Foundation and KIVA, since the loan granted has served them a lot to get ahead in their activities, and by continuing to work with this loan, every time they see themselves closer to realizing their dream.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sticks, paints, glue, wire, thread, palm leaves, and silicon

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto, es un hombre trabajador que tiene 50 años, vive en su casa propia con sus dos hijos de los cuatro que tiene. Él esta separado de su pareja, desde hace 3 años, aún así no deja de estar pendiente de ella. Casi sin descanso, labora a diario, en su chacra, en busca de un futuro mejor para sus hijos; pues continua apoyándoles económicamente, es por eso que desde muy temprano empieza su jornada laboral, en donde cuenta con hectáreas extensas donde produce café, plátano, frutas cítricas, cacao y achiote. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su hijo, quien inspecciona cuidadosamente las plantaciones. Lo que más le gusta a Roberto, es retirar la maleza de sus chacras y así mantenerlos limpios, también le agrada poner trampas para que los animales no malogren sus cosechas y las pueda vender a buenos precios en el mercado de su ciudad, porque los frutos que produce son muy requeridos y por tal considera que su actividad es muy rentable. En adelante quiere ser uno de los mejores productores de cacao, bananas y café para poder obtener mayores utilidades que le favorezcan. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y está seguro que cumplirá con cada pago puntualmente, como lo hizo en el primer crédito, además le gusta trabajar con su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de plantas de plátanos para plantarlas en 3 hectáreas de terreno que recientemente compró.
texts.en:
Roberto is a hard-working man who is 50 years old. He lives in his own house with two of his four children. He has been separated from his wife for three years, although he is still dependent on her. Almost without rest, he works every day in his small farm, in search of a better future for his children, as he continues to support them economically. It is for this reason he begins his daily work very early, in which he has extensive hectares where he produces coffee, bananas, citrus fruits, cocoa, and annatto (makes a red paste used in cooking for color and flavor).

On occasion he receives the help of his son, who carefully inspects the plants. What Roberto likes most is to pull out the weeds from his farm and likewise keep them clean. Also he likes to put traps out so that the animals don't spoil his harvests, and he can sell them at good prices in the market in his city. The fruits that he produces are highly demanded and as such, he considers his business very profitable. Going forward, he wants to be one of the biggest producers of cocoa, bananas and coffee in order to be able to earn greater profits.

This is his second loan with MFP and he is sure that he can complete each payment punctually, as he did with his first loan. Additionally, he likes to work with his commnity bank. With the loan he is requesting, he will invest it in the purchase of banana plants to plant them in three hectares of land that he recently bought.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy banana plants

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Anita nos manifiesta que con mucho esfuerzo logro aperturar una bodega en su casa, Ella  es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos dependientes y es por eso que tiene que trabajar dia a dia. El prestamo solicitado lo invertira en la compra D. mercaderia para su negocio. 

Todas son muy entusiastas y trabajadoras gracias a ello siguen adelante incrementando sus ingresos ya que tienen como objetivo la mejora económica para sus familias. Saben que tienen mucha competencia pero ellas se esfuerzan por tener productos D. primera calidad. Todas las socias aprenden a administrar sus fondos ya que es D. beneficio para ellas y sus familias.
texts.en:
Our member, Anita, says that with much effort she opened a grocery store in her house. She is a single mother with three dependent children. That is why she has to work every day. The requested loan will be used to buy merchandise for her business. All of the members are very enthusiastic and hard-working. Because of that they continue getting ahead and increasing their earnings. Their objective is to improve their families’ economies. They know that they have a lot of competition, but they work hard to have high quality products. All of the members learn to manage their funds because it is beneficial to them and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Dancy Rosa

texts.es:
Dancy tiene 26 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos, uno en edad escolar y otro menor; vive junto a su familia en el caserío Granja Sasape, una zona rural y agrícola situada en el distrito de Túcume, conocido por ser uno de los principales ejes turísticos de la región gracias a la abundancia de ruinas que datan de periodos anteriores a los Incas, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de tres años a la venta de platos típicos de la zona y de chicha (bebida típica de la zona hecha a base de maíz), ella ofrece estos productos en su domicilio y los vende a los pobladores y trabajadores de la zona en donde vive, el negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos por lo que trata de mantenerlo dando lo mejor de si.

Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de cabritos, con este negocio obtiene un igreso adicional que es de mucha importancia para su familia. Ella desea implementar con sillas el local donde vende comida para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Dancy es una joven trabajadora y que siempre busca la manera de ayudar a su familia a salir adelante, su mayor anhelo es lograr instalar un pequeño restaurante para poder percibir mas ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida. En la imagen aparece junto a los cabritos que comercializa.
texts.en:
Dancy is 26 years old. She is married and has two children; one is schoolaged and one is younger. She lives with her family in the hamlet of Granja Sasape, a rural and agricultural area located in the district of Túcume. It is known for being one of the main tourist hubs in the region, thanks to its abundance of ruins that date from the Incas. It belongs to the province of Lambayeque and it is located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. For more than three years, she has been selling traditional food from the area and chicha (a traditional drink of the area made from a corn base). She offers these products from her home and sells them to villagers and workers in the area where she lives. The business is her main source of income and she tries to maintain it, giving the best of herself. She also raises and sells young goats. With this business she obtains additional income, which is very important to her family. She wants to outfit the locale where she sells the food with chairs in order to offer better service to her customers. This is why she has found it necessary to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for the first time, for 1000 nuevos soles. Dancy is a hardworking young woman who is always looking for the way to get her family ahead. Her greatest wish is to be able to set up a little restaurant to be able to have more income and improve her quality of life. The goats that she sells appear in the image.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chairs to outfit her restaurant.

loans.name: Reina De La Paz ( Cuenca ) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Reina de la Paz, esta formado por mujeres trabajadoras, luchadoras y emprendedoras quienes hacen su trabajo con entusiasmo, para sacar adelante a sus familias, viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por su belleza colonial, arquitectura,  gastronomía y su gente; es considerada la tercera ciudad mas importante económicamente a nivel nacional y la mas bella del país.

La Sra. Alexandra Tucto es socia del banco comunal Reina de la Paz, vive en  la ciudad de Cuenca, se encuentra en su tercer ciclo de  crédito,  ha sido invitada por su cuñada a formar parte de este grupo de mujeres luchadoras. Se dedica a la venta de productos de  belleza  Yanbal, el negocio empezo con su primer crédito, trabaja sin horarios y todos los días de la semana ya que cada vez que se encuentra con algún conocido es una oportunidad de realizar una venta. 
Nuestra socia es muy joven con apenas 23 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 2 hijos quienes se encuentran de 7 y 4 años de edad, su primera hija esta estudiando en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo trabaja como chofer para una empresa, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus suegros, su crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar mas cosméticos Yanbal, su ilusion es poder hacer un cuarto en la casa de sus suegros para su hija menor.


La Sra. Luz se encuentra trabajando con los créditos de la Fundación Espoir hace tres ciclos, vive en la parroquia del Valle, tiene 43 años de edad, es viuda hace 4 años, su esposo murió por un accidente de transito, en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos quienes se encuentran de 23, 20, 18, 16, 13, 10 y 8 años de edad, su primer y tercer hijos son casados y viven de manera independiente, sus hijos de 20, 16, 13 trabajan  y son quienes ayudan económicamente en casa, sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad, vive arrendando ya que su casa es lejos y trasladarse hasta allá le cuesta mucho en transporte.
Nuestra socia se dedica al arreglo de casas en donde  lava, cocina, etc., empieza sus labores desde las 8 a.m. hasta las 2 p.m., y por la tarde labora en otra casa, trabaja ya 4 años, también tiene animalitos como vacas, chanchos, borregos y  su nuera es quien los cuida. Con su nuevo crédito va a pagar unos muebles que adquirido, lo único que le pide a Dios es que nunca le falte el trabajo para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos. 

NOTA: EN LA FOTO ESTAN 9 SOCIAS, Y 2 FOTOS ADJUNTAS DE LAS 2 SOCIAS QUE FALTAN EN LA FOTO.
texts.en:
The communal bank Reina de la Paz is made up of hardworking, enterprising women who are fighters. They do their work with enthusiasm to get their families ahead. They live in the city of Cuenca. This city is characterized by it colonial beauty, its architecture, its cuisine and its people. It is considered the third most important city economically in the country and its most beautiful. Mrs. Alexandra Tucto is a member of the communal bank Reina de la Paz. She lives in the city of Cuenca. She is in her third loan cycle, invited by a sister in law to join the group of women fighters. She sells Yanbal beauty products. The business started with her first loan. She works without a set schedule everyday of the week. Every time she sees someone she knows, it's a chance to make a sale. Our member is very young, just barely 23 years old. She lives in a common law marriage and has had 2 children who are 7 and 4 years old. Her oldest daughter is in a school in the city. Her husband works as a driver for a business. She doesn't have her own home and lives with her parents in law. She will use the loan to buy more Yanbal products. Her dream is to be able to build a room in her parents in law's house for her younger daughter. Luz has been working with loans from Fundación Espoir for three cycles. She lives in the Valle parish. She is 43 years old and has been a widow for 4 years. Her husband died in a traffic accident. She had 7 children from her marriage, who are 23,20,18,16,13 and 8 years old. Her first and third children are married and live independently, Her 20, 16 and 13 year old children help out financially at home. Her two yongest children study in a city elementary school. They rent since their house is far away and communting from their costs a lot in transportation. Our member cleans houses where she washes, cooks, etc. She works from 8 a.m. until 2 p.m., and in the afternoon she works at another house. She has been working for 4 years. She also has animals such as cows, pigs, and sheep, Her daughter in law takes care of them. With the new loan, she will pay for some furniture she adquired. The only thing she asks of God is to always have work so she can get her children ahead. NOTE: THERE ARE 9 MEMBERS IN THE PHOTO AND 2 ATTACHED PHOTOS OF THE 2 MEMBERS THAT ARE MISSING IN THE PHOTO.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lipsticks, cerams, perfumes, etc/ pay for chairs, table, bed, etc.

loans.name: Señor Cautivo De Ayabaca Group

texts.es:
SEÑOR CAUTIVO DE AYABACA
La Alcancía Comunal Señor Cautivo de Ayabaca  es un grupo solidario y viene trabajando varios años con EDAPROSPO. Nuestra socia Nancy empezó su negocio de venta de carne y quesos en forma ambulatoria, con los préstamos recibidos en estos años pudo alquilar un local donde ahora tiene una tienda, además con muchos años de esfuerzo logro comprarse un terreno que empezara a construirlo con la ayuda de sus hijos.
La venta de productos de belleza le ayuda con los gastos en casa a Rosa que se desempeña en este negocio hace muchos años, ella tiene hijos a los que educar asi que se esfuerza por incrementar sus ventas, además su esposo es su compañía y la ayuda en este duro reto. Las socias invertirán los préstamos en la compra de mercadería, para incrementar sus negocios y así poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias. Seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.
texts.en:
SEÑOR CAUTIVO DE AYABACA The communal bank "Señor Cautivo de Ayabaca" is a solidarity group that has been working with Edaprospo for several years. Our member, Nancy, started her business selling meat and cheese, as an ambulatory merchant. With the loans received over the years, she was able to rent a place to have a store. She has also, after many years of hard work, been able to buy herself some land that she will begin to build on with help from her children. Selling beauty products helps Rosa with the household expenses. She has had this business for many years. She has kids to educate which is why she is trying to increase her sales. Her husband is her company and helps her with this difficult goal. The group's members will invest the loans in the purchase of merchandise to grow their businesses and in this way be able to provide their families with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods.

loans.name: Mariza

texts.es: María, de 30 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, en una casa alquilada ubicada en  una comunidad de la sierra peruana.Por estos meses trabaja en un proyecto de construcción fomentado por el estado peruano, mientras su esposo es docente en un colegio secundario. Desde hace 8 años se dedica  al cuidado de la chacra y para que éstas sean más productivas, como en cada cosecha, les brinda los cuidados necesarios, sobre todo durante los fines de semana. Trabaja desde muy temprano sin descanso, junto a su pareja, ambos aman la agricultura a pesar de tener otras actividades económicas. A María le gusta que sus terrenos estén bien cultivados y protegidos de las plagas, aunque el traslado al mercado de su ciudad sea difícil por el peso de los sacos de tubérculos. Como es una mujer muy laboriosa, para más adelante quiere sembrar en mayor cantidad la papa nativa, que está siendo muy solicitada en el mercado por sus propiedades anticancerígenas, además quiere construir su casa propia, para darle una adecuada calidad de vida a su familia.Esta es la cuarta vez, que tiene un préstamo con MFP y agradece a todos los integrantes de su banco comunal, con quienes le gusta trabajar, porque le han  permitido ser parte de  este grupo honesto y trabajador.María tiene planeado invertir el dinero  solicitado en la compra de  varios sacos de abono, con el que brindará  el mantenimiento adecuado a  sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Thirty-year old María lives with her husband and two children, in a rented home, in a community in the mountains of Peru. She has been working on a construction project started by the Peruvian government for a few months while her husband works as a docent in a high school. She has been taking care of a piece of land for eight years. She takes care of the land's needs to make it more productive with its harvests, mostly on the weekends. She starts working very early and doesn't rest. Her and her partner both love farming in spite of the fact that they also have other jobs. Maria likes her land to be well cultivated and protected from insects even though transporting [the crops] to her city's market is difficult because the sacks of potatoes are heavy. Because she is a hard worker, she wants to plant greater quantities of native potatoes, which are being sought after in the market for their anti-cancerous properties. She would also like to build her own home to provide her family with an adequate quality of life. This is her fourth loan with MFP and she thanks all of the members of her communal bank, with whom she likes working, because they have allowed her to be part of this honest and hardworking group. Maria plans to use the loan to buy several sacks of fertilizer which will provide adequate maintenance for her potato crops.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to maintain her crops.

loans.name: Sandra Virginia

texts.es:
Sandra R. es una mujer muy activa empresarialmente, se dedica a la elaboración de almuerzos y también ofrece el servicio de alquiler de lavadoras. Antes de tener negocio trabajó  como empleada doméstica, pero siempre soñó con ser independiente y poder dedicarle mas tiempo a sus hijos,; así fue que con su liquidación montó dos negocios, pues  además de comprar una maquina lavadora para alquilarla , empezó a hacer almuerzos y venderlos entre los vecinos y   ahora Tiene 3 lavadoras, vende almuerzos en el sector donde vive y también atiende domicilios en empresas y construcciones  en el norte de la ciudad, algunas de las cuales les pagan semanalmente.

Ha recibido dos prestamos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que le han permitido aumentar su capital de trabajo y desde que montó  su negocio, tiene mas tiempo para su familia especialmente para su hijo  menor,  pues cuando trabajaba como doméstica tuvo que acudir a familiares para que la ayudaran en la crianza de los dos mayores, porque solo venia los fines de semana a su casa.

Con su nuevo crédito por valor de $ $1.500.000 COP, va a   comprar insumos al por mayor  y otra maquina, también  va a  montar un nuevo negocio en un colegio cerca del lugar de residencia: va a atender su cafetería.  Su sueño es direccionarse en una sola actividad, que sea lo suficientemente rentable y le genere estabilidad para poder terminar de educar a sus hijos. Su nuevo desafío es lograr sostenerse en el colegio donde va a atender la cafetería y tiene esa gran ilusión de salir adelante siempre con su nuevo proyecto..
texts.en:
Sandra R. is an active business woman who makes lunches for a living. She also rents washing machines. Before having her own business, she worked as domestic help, but always dreamed of being independent and being able to spend more time with her children. She started both businesses with her severance pay. So in addition to purchasing a washing machine to rent out, she began to make lunches and sell them to her neighbors. She now has three washing machines, sells lunches in her neighborhood, and also takes care of houses and businesses in the northern part of the city. Some of them pay her weekly. She has received two loans from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo that have allowed her to increase her working capital. Since she started her business, she has more time for her family, particularly for her youngest son. When she worked as a maid she had to ask relatives for help raising her two oldest kids because she only came home on weekends. With her new loan of $1.500.000 COP, she will buy supplies at wholesale and another machine. She is also going to start another business in a high school near her home -- she is going to take care of the cafeteria. Her dream is to only have one business that is profitable enough, and provides enough stability, to to be able to finish educating her kids. Her newest challenge is to be able to make a go of it in the high school where she will take care of the cafeteria and she has great hopes of being able to get ahead with her newest project.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale supplies and another washing machine.  She is also going to start a cafeteria in a high shool near her home.

loans.name: Lidia Susana

texts.es:
Lidia tiene su casa en la Asociación Los Olivos en donde tiene una ferretería, vende materiales de construcción, inicio como la venta de algunos productos y ahora ha surtido su negocio con mas productos, con sus prestamos surtió con tuberías, tiene un carro con el cual su esposo trae materiales de construcción y reparte a domicilio.
Lo que mas le gusta a Lidia de su Banco Comunal es el incentivo al ahorro, Lidia solicita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido para comprar ladrillo. Con el tiempo su negocio ha crecido y su local le es insuficiente, por lo que sueña con ampliar su local y su ferretería.
texts.en:
Lidia has a house in the Los Olivos Association. That is where she has a hardware store. She sells construction materials. She started selling some products, and now she has stocked her business with more products. With her loans she has stocked up on pipes. She has a car, which her husband uses to get the construction materials and deliver them home. What Lidia likes most about her communal bank is the incentive to save. Lidia is requesting a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy bricks. In time her business has grown, and her place is not big enough. She dreams of expanding her hardware store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bricks

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: Blanca tiene 42 años, es separada, tiene un hijo, juntos vive en casa de su madre que ya es anciana. Inicialmente vivía de manera precaria, con esteras y sin servicios básicos en este terreno, es por ello que se mudo a casa de su madre, de quien ahora Blanca se hace cargo. Es multifacética, parte de sus renumeraciones se ve reflejado en esta construcción que de a poco levantó  las vigas y paredes con el apoyo moral de su hijo, es así que durante 15 años viene forjando arduamente su fin.  Blanca está feliz  por sus logros, pronto retornaran con su hijo  a esta su casa y vivirá dignamente. Por el momento su mayor anhelo es que instalen el  agua y en seguida proseguirá  con el vaciado del piso de esta su casa. Este es primer crédito que tiene con MFP y sabe que este préstamo le será  muy beneficioso para el acabado del piso de su casa, por ello se compromete a pagar todas las cuotas oportunamente. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará arena fina y bolsas de cemento, asimismo desea pagar el trabajo de albañil.
texts.en:
Blanca is 42 years old, and she is separated. She has one child, and they live together in her elderly mother’s house. She initially lived on the land in a meager way with a straw mat and without basic services. That is why she moved to her mother’s house. Now Blanca takes charge of her mother. It is multifaceted. Part of her remuneration can be seen in this construction. A little while ago she raised the beams and the walls with her son’s moral support. During 15 years she has been arduously building towards the end. Blanca is happy with what she has achieved. She and her son will soon move to this house, and they will live decently. For the moment her greatest desire is to install water, and then she will build the floor in this house. This is her first loan with MFP. She knows that this loan will be very helpful in finishing the floor of her house. She pledges to make all of her payments on time. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy fine sand and bags of cement. She also wants to pay the labor expenses for a bricklayer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sand and bags of cement

loans.name: Cresenciana

texts.es:
Cresenciana es soltera y tiene 1 hijo, es socia del Banco Comunal Los Claveles y lo que mas le gusta son los prestamos fáciles que le ayudaron a ampliar sus negocios y el incentivo del ahorro.
Cresenciana vende cereales y viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región de donde compra los cereales como maíz, trigo, cebada, luego los transporta a la ciudad de Ayacucho y los vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad. Además Cresenciana en sus tiempos libres trabaja haciendo limpieza un centro educativo. Su préstamo será destinado para la compra de trigo y maíz.
Cresenciana tiene su casa de material rustico y su mayor sueño es tener una casa de material noble y brindar mas comodidad a su hijo.
texts.en:
Cresenciana is single and has one child. She is a member of the Los Claveles Communal Bank. What she likes the most are the terms of the loans that help her expand her businesses and the incentive to save. Cresenciana sells grains. She travels to the different regional fairs, which is where she buys the grains like corn, wheat, and barley. She then transports them to the city of Ayacucho and sells them in the city’s wholesale market. In her free time Cresenciana works cleaning an educational center. The loan is to buy wheat and corn. Cresenciana has a house made from rudimentary materials. Her biggest dream is to have a house made of sturdy material and to make her son more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wheat and corn

loans.name: Marciana

texts.es:
La señora Marciana vive con su ultimo hijo que esta estudiando en la universidad y su mayor deseo es que termine sus estudios y sea un profesional exitoso. Marciana pertenece al Banco Comunal Los Claveles es socia hace 12 años y durante este tiempo ahorro y con ese dinero educo a sus hijos.
Marciana tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, carnes, verduras, con la ayuda de su hijo. Marciana también viaja a las ferias llevando frutas y de las ferias compra cereales que luego procesa en su molino, productos que reparte a las tiendas de su zona. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de trigo, cebada, maíz.
texts.en:
Marciana lives with her youngest son who is studying at the university. Her main desire is for him to finish his studies and become a successful professional. Marciana belongs to the communal bank "Los Claveles." She has been a member for 12 years; during this time she saved, and with this money she educated her children. Marciana has a store in her home where she sells groceries such as meat and vegetables with the help of her son. Marciana also travels to the markets where she takes fruit to sell, and where she also buys cereals that she later processes in her mill and distributes to the stores in her area. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of wheat, barley and corn.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy wheat, barley and corn

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia pertenece al Banco Comunal Los Claveles y lo que mas le gusta es el incentivo al ahorro, es socia hace muchos años y con sus ahorros construyo su casa, además que la capacitaron en temas de negocio, temas que le ayudaron mucho para crecer.
Julia es casada y tiene 4 hijos que estudian, Julia vive en la comunidad de Huayllapampa que se encuentra a 30 minutos de la ciudad de AyaC., tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras y carnes. Además Julia se dedica a la compra de tara y cochinilla que acopia para venderlos a un intermediarios. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de cereales y trigo.
Julia sueña que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
