Julia belongs to the Communal Bank “Los Claveles” (The Carnations). What she enjoys most is having the incentive to save. She has been a member for many years and used her savings to build her house. In addition, the business training she has received has helped her to grow.

Julia is married and has four children in school. She lives in the community of Huayllapampa, which is 30 minutes away from the city of AyaC.. Julia has a store in her home where she sells groceries, vegetables, and meats. She also sells tara and cochineal (natural sources of dye) that she collects and sells them to intermediaries. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of grains, such as wheat.

Julia dreams of seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grain

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha junto a su esposo tienen un restaurante con especialidad en comida china, en un local alquilado ubicado en la alameda del cementerio, lugar con mucha afluencia de personas, Martha cuenta que inicio su negocio con una carpa y se ubicaban en la calle, luego paso a asociarse con otra persona y abrieron un local, actualmente tienen un negocio mas grande  que le generará mas ingresos, la atención es por las noches hasta la madrugada.
Martha es socia del banco Comunal Los Claveles y lo que le agrada son los prestamos fáciles y el incentivo al ahorro, Martha con sus ahorros y prestamos logro construir su casa y ahora esta realizando los acabados de su casa, Martha solicita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido para el tarrajeo de su casa y comprara cemento.
Los sueños de Martha son comprar su carro y que su hijo culmine sus estudios.
texts.en:
Martha and her husband have a restaurant specializing in Chinese food, which operates from a rented location along an avenue that is next to a cemetery, a place where many people gather. She started her business out a tent located on the street, but she later partnered with another person and opened her restaurant. Her business is now larger and generates more income. She serves customers starting at night until dawn.

Martha is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Claveles” (The Carnations) and likes that the loans are easy to work with and that she has the incentive to save. She used her savings and loans to build a house and now she is completing the finishing touches. Martha is requesting a loan of 1400 PEN so that she can whitewash her house and buy cement.

Martha dreams of buying a car and seeing her son finish his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Whitewash her house & purchase cement

loans.name: Francisco Pacheco ( Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
La señora Vilma M. forma parte del Banco Comunal Francisco Pacheco en la ciudad de Portoviejo, sus reuniones son cada quince días, la mayoría de las socias tienen sus hogares por el sector de reunión.
La señora VilM. tiene como actividad la costura, hace 5 años, le gusta mucho este negocio, también tiene la venta de productos  Avon, los clientes le buscan en su casa; nuestra socia está casada y tiene 4 hijos todos casados, es abuela, su esposo trabaja como chofer.
La señora Vilma lleva 7 años siendo parte de los créditos de la Fundación, y le va muy bien.
 Con este nuevo crédito podrá invertir en sus negocios, siempre divide el crédito para comprar los productos de Avon y para las telas, hilos, cierres, botones y encajes; sin salir de casa vende los productos de belleza,  cuando le llega el pedido nuestra socia llama a sus clientes y lo retiran de su casa, su tiempo lo dedica a la costura, cuando tiene que entregar varias prendas sus nueras se encargan de ayudarle en las tareas del hogar, es una gran ayuda ya que así puede entregar a tiempo las costuras, nos comentó nuestra socia que el mes que mejor le va en el negocio es diciembre. Compra al contado los productos y deja a sus clientes a crédito en dos o tres pagos. Ella nunca se ha atrasado en los pagos de la fundación se considera una persona muy responsable y dedicada a sus trabajo, el sueño es poder hacer algunos arreglos a su casa ya que lo está necesitando.
 
La señora Glenda es socia del banco comunal Francisco Pacheco desde hace 3 años, le va muy bien con los créditos que ha recibido, está casada, tiene dos hijos mantiene un hogar muy estable y feliz, la actividad que ella realiza es la venta de productos de belleza  Yanbal desde hace 5 años,  mantienen un negocio junto a su esposo, venden utensilios del hogar, actividad que vienen realizando desde hace 7 años.
La señora Glenda junto al esposo han salido adelante con sus negocios, cuando empezaron  a vender los utensilios del hogar no les fue nada bien, salieron en contra porque no sabían bien del manejo de las ventas, muchos de los clientes le quedaron mal y nunca les pagaron pero no se dieron por vencidos y continuaron, aprendieron y desde entonces les va muy bien, en los actuales momentos tienen un negocio establecido ya que lo ha surtido con electrodomésticos como, televisores, refrigeradoras y mas, todos estos electrodomésticos los entregan puerta a puerta, dejando a crédito, las cuotas van desde un dólar hasta 10 dólares por semana. El esposo es el que se encarga de realizar los cobros, el negocio lo han extendido a varios cantones de la provincia como Tosagua, 24 De Mayo, Jipijapa entre otros, tienen un aproximado de 5000 clientes durante estos 7 años que llevan con el negocio.
 Con este nuevo crédito que esta solicitando a la Fundación nuestra socia podrá invertir en sus negocios, por lo general ella comparte el crédito comprando los productos de belleza como maquillaje y perfumes y en los utensilios de cocina y los electrodomésticos. Para la señora Glenda el mayor de su sueño es terminar sus estudios y comprarse una casa ya que en los actúale momentos está alquilando.
texts.en:
Vilma M. belongs to the communal bank "Francisco Pacheco," in the city of Portoviejo. The members of this bank meet every 15 days, and the majority of them live in the neighborhood where they meet. Vilma has had a dressmaking business for 5 years, and she enjoys this work very much. She also sells Avon products to her customers from her home. She is married and has 4 married children. She is a grandmother, and her husband works as a driver. Vilma has been taking loans from the Fundación for 7 years, and it is going very well. With this new loan she will be able to invest in her businesses. She always divides her loans by purchasing Avon products as well as fabric, thread, fasteners, buttons and lace. She sells her beauty products without leaving the house; when her orders arrive she calls her customers and they come to get the products, so she can dedicate her time to sewing. When she has to deliver her garments, her daughter-in-laws help her with the household tasks, which is a great help, and this way she can deliver her garments to her customers on time. She tells us that the best month for her business is December. She buys her products with cash, and she allows her customers credit in 2 or 3 payments. She has never gotten behind in her payments to the fundación, where she is considered to be a very responsible person who is dedicated to her work. Her dream is to be able to make some repairs to her house which are needed. Glenda has been a member of the communal bank "Francisco Pacheco" for 3 years, and she is doing very well with the loans that she has received. She is married and has 2 children. She maintains a very stable and happy home. Her activity is the sale of Yanbal beauty products; she has been doing this work for 5 years. She also maintains a business with her husband selling household utensils, which they have had for 7 years. Glenda, along with her husband, has made progress with her businesses. When they started to sell household utensils it was not going well because they did not know how to manage their sales; many of the customers were unreliable and never paid them, but they were not defeated. They continued on, learning, and after a while it started to go better. At this moment they have an established business that is well-stocked with household appliances such as: TVs, refrigerators, and other items. They deliver all of these appliances door to door, and extend credit at payments that go from 1 to 10 dollars a week. Her husband is in charge of making the collections, and their business has expanded to various cantons in the province such as Tosagua, 24 De Mayo, Jipijapa, and others. They have had approximately 5,000 customers over the 7 years that they have run this business. With this new loan that she is requesting from the Fundación, Glenda will use part of the loan to buy beauty products such as makeup and perfumes, and with the other part she will buy cooking utensils and appliances. Glenda's main wish is to finish her education and buy herself a house, since at the moment they are renting.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, fabrics, buttons, fasteners, pots, blenders, large frying pans, etc.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora es soltera y tiene 1 hijo que esta estudiando, Teodora vive en la comunidad de Huayllapampa que se encuentra a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde tiene una tienda en su casa y vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todo los días, también compra tara y cochinilla que luego de acopiar los vende a un intermediario y la tuna lo envía a la ciudad de Lima. Además Los días domingos vende comida en el estadio de su comunidad. Los sueños de Teodora son construir otra casa de material noble y tener una tienda mas grande porque el que tiene es muy pequeño.
Teodora necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
texts.en:
Teodora is single and has one son, who is studying. She lives in Huayllapampa, 30 minutes outside the city of Ayacucho. She has a small shop at her house where she works every day selling groceries, including vegetables and meat. She also buys 'tara' plants and cochineal [a natural dye that grows on the leaves] which she then gathers and sells to a middleman, and sends the prickly pear fruits to the city of Lima. On Sundays she also sells food at the local sports ground. Teodora dreams of building a new home out of better materials, and having a bigger shop, as the one she has is very small. She needs a loan of 1000 soles ($375), which she will invest in buying rice and sugar.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Aide

texts.es:
Aide pertenece al Banco Comunal Los Claveles hace 12 años y lo que mas le gusta es el incentivo del ahorro, le enseñaron a ser responsable y puntual.
Aide es casada, tiene 4 hijos que están estudiando, Aide tiene un Multiservicios llamado Angélica que esta en su casa, vende abarrotes en general, artículos de escritorio, gas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos. Además Aide brinda los servicios de cocina para diferentes eventos. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de gaseosas, detergentes y gas.
Aide con sus ahorros construyo su casa y ahora sueña con construir el segundo piso de su casa, terminar los acabados de su casa y comprar un carro.
texts.en:
Aide has belonged to the communal bank "Los Claveles" for 12 years, and the thing she likes most in the incentive of saving money. They have taught her to be responsible and punctual. Aide is married and has 4 children who study in school. She has a multiservice business called Angelica, which she runs from her house. With the help of her children, she sells groceries, stationery, and gas. Furthermore, Aide provides cooking services for various events. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of soft drinks, detergent, and gas. With her savings, Aide built her house, and now her dream is to build the second floor of her house, tie up other loose ends in her house, and purchase a car.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, detergent, and gas for her store

loans.name: Sulpicia

texts.es:
Sulpicia es casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive con una hija y sus nietos, Sulpicia se dedica a la venta de anticuchos de manera ambulatoria en una calle céntrica llamada 5 esquinas y vende todos los días por las noches y los domingos vende comida en la feria de ganados de la ciudad, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hijo y esposo. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de carne, pescado, pollo, papa y gas.
Sulpicia menciona que en Finca aprendió a ahorrar y su mayor sueño son comprar una camioneta para llevar su negocio y terminar de construir su tercer piso.
texts.en:
Sulpicia is married, has 3 children, and lives with one of her daughters and her grandchildren. She makes a living by selling kebabs, traveling along a central street called 5 Corners. She sells them every night, and on Sundays she sells food at the city's livestock fair, with the help of her son and husband. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of beef, fish, chicken, potatoes, and gas. Sulpicia mentions that through Finca she learned to save money, and her greatest dream is to purchase a truck for her business and to finish construction on the third floor of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beef, fish, chicken, potatoes, and gas

loans.name: Katia Dolores

texts.es:
Katia es casada y tiene 1 hijo, estudia en la universidad, tiene una tienda de ropa llamada Chikokos en un local alquilado que se encuentra en el centro de la ciudad, cuenta con la ayuda de personas que se encargan de las ventas, además Katia tiene un taller de confecciones a medida y también tiene personal. Katia trabaja en una empresa como supervisora. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de telas para cumplir los pedidos de polos que tiene.
Los sueños de Katia son tener una empresa de confecciones y terminar su carrera.
texts.en:
Katia is married and has one son. She is currently studying in college and has a clothing store called Chikokos in a rented space located in the downtown area of the city. She depends on the help of other people who are in charge of sales. Additionally, Katia has a tailoring workshop with her own staff. She works for a company as a supervisor. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of fabrics to fulfill her requests for polo shirts. Her dreams are to own a dressmaking company and to finish her college studies.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas pertenece al Banco Comunal Los Claveles en donde aprendió a ahorrar. Felicitas es casada y tiene 3 hijos. 
Felicitas al inicio viajaba a las ferias y vendía frutas y cereales, actividad que dejo de realizar porque debía de cuidar a sus hijos, actualmente se dedica a la crianza de cuy y a la siembra de papa en sus terrenos de Simbapata, además en el ultimo año inicio con la siembra de maíz negro y salió bien su cosecha. Su préstamo será destinado en la compra de abono. 
Los sueños de Felicitas es construir su casa de material noble pues la que tiene es de material rustico, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y sembrar en mas extensión de tierras.
texts.en:
Felicitas belongs to the Los Claveles communal bank, where she learned to save up. She is married and has three children. Felicitas used to travel to markets, selling fruit and cereals, but she gave this up to look after her children. Now she raises guinea-pigs and grows potatoes on her plot of land at Simbapata. In the last year she also started growing maize, and had a good harvest. This loan will be used to purchase fertilizer. Felicitas' dreams are to improve her house, because hers is built of rough materials; to give her children a good education; and to farm a bigger area of land.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Roberta

texts.es:
Roberta es viuda, tiene 7 hijos y solo uno de sus hijos esta estudiando porque los demás ya son profesionales, Roberta tiene una tienda en su casa 4en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Roberta se dedica a la siembra de maíz en el distrito de Acosvinchos, productos que luego lleva al mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Roberta es socia del Banco Comunal Los Claveles y necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas, arroz y azúcar.
Roberta sueña con que su ultima hija culmine sus estudios y vivir en Acosvinchos para dedicarse a la agricultura.
texts.en:
Roberta is a widow and has 7 children; only one is studying since the rest are already professionals. Roberta has a store in her home where she sells general groceries like vegetables and meat. She does this every day. She also plants corn in the district of Acosvinchos, which she then brings to the wholesale food market in the city of Ayacucho. Roberta is a member of the Community Bank Los Claveles, and needs a loan of 1200 soles to invest in the purchase of soft drinks, rice and sugar. Her dream is for her youngest daughter to finish her studies, and to live in Acosvinchos to do agriculture.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Soft drinks, rice and sugar

loans.name: Betulia Lourdes

texts.es:
Betulia Lourdes M. C. tiene 46 anos de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos y reside en Colonia Los Angeles en Juticalpa, Olancho.  Con la ayuda de su esposo se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano en su casa y de forma ambulante.  Hace dos anos empezo su negocio de venta de ropa de segunanda mano con unas amigas pero ahorra trabaja sola y su negocio esta creciendo.

Con el prestamo de 15,000 Lempiras comprara dos fardos de ropa de segunda mano para aumentar sus ingresos.  Con el apoyo del prestamo su negocio sera mas grande, podra mantener su familia y apoyar a su hija en el colegio.      

Su sueno es superar con sus ventas y seguir creciendo su negocio para soportar a su familia.  Es el tercer ciclo de prestamos con FAMA y ha pagado sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Betulia Lourdes M. C. is 46, married, has 4 children and lives in Colonia Los Angeles in Juticalpa, Olancho. With her husband's help she sells second-hand clothing, in her home and on foot. Two years ago she started her business with some friends, but now she works alone and her business is growing. With this loan of 15,000 Lempiras she will buy two bundles of second-hand clothing to increase her income. With the aid of this loan her business will grow, she will be able to maintain her family and help her daughter in school. Her dream is to increase her sales and for her business to continue growing to support her family. This is her third loan cycle with FAMA and she has repaid her quotas punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Two bundles of second-hand clothing for sale

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina tiene 62 años D. edad, es viuda y vive junto a su hijo en el distrito agrícola D. Cayaltí, una zona ubicada a una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

La necesidad D. hacerse cargo D. su familia hizo que empezara a trabajar criando y vendiendo animales menores. Agustina suele criar sus animales en unos corrales ubicados en la parte posterior D. su domicilio y cuando estos ya ha alcanzado un buen punto D. desarrollo los venD. a los negociantes que siempre frecuentan  la zona en donD. vive. Con las ganancias D. este negocio pudo ahorrar dinero para adquirir una mototaxi (vehículo conformado por una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para transportar pasajeros y carga) la cual utiliza actualmente en brindar servicio D. transporte en la zona donD. vive.

El contínuo uso otorgado al vehículo y el estado accidentado D. las carreteras D. la zona ha hecho que este empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que necesitan D. reparación urgente para garantizar el correcto funcionamiento D. su unidad móvil, por ello Agustina se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles.

Agustina es una mujer luchadora,ella ha sabido salir adelante a pesar D. las dificultades que se le han presentado. Su mayor anhelo es poder adquirir en el futuro otra mototaxi.
texts.en:
Agustina is 62, widowed, and lives with her child in the agricultural district of Catalti, a zone located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. Out of the need to care for her family she started raising and selling small animals. Agustina usually raises her animals in pens located in the back part of her home, and when they have reached a good point of development she sells them to the dealers who always frequent the area where she lives. With the earnings from this business she was able to save money for a mototaxi (a vehicle consisting of a motorcycle that has an attached cabin for transporting passengers and cargo) which she currently uses to offer a transportation service in her area. The continual use of the vehicle and the rough state of the roads in her area have maD. the vehicle start to experience various issues that require urgent repair to ensure proper functioning. Because of this, Agustina has found it necessary to apply, for the first time, to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 soles. Agustina is a fighter. She has managed to get ahead despite the difficulties that have arisen. Her greatest wish is to be able to buy another mototaxi in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintenance of mototaxi

loans.name: Maria Martha

texts.es:
La Sra. María B. es socia del banco comunal 14 de Agosto, vive en la comunidad de Guayan, que pertenece a la parroquia de Zhidmad, Ubicada al sur occidente del cantón Gualaceo, la agricultura y la ganadería son las actividades a las que se dedican los pobladores de esta parroquia, su iglesia parroquial es el principal atractivo turístico, en ella se guardan reliquias muy antiguas. El mirador del Cerro Borma, donde se encuentra una pirámide de los militares, es otro hermoso lugar para disfrutar de la naturaleza.

La Sra. María B. es socia fundadora del banco comunal, se encuentra trabajando con los préstamos de la fundación hace 5 años,  los mismo que le han beneficiado para crecer en su actividad de cría de animales, como son pollos, cuyes, chanchos, borregos, ganado, los mismo que vende en su comunidad, también se dedica a la agricultura sembrando hortalizas, papas, etc.

Nuestra socia tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y ha concebido 4 hijos, 3 son casados y viven de manera independiente, su última hija de 14 años estudia en el colegio, su esposo se dedica a la profesión de albañil, tiene casa propia y fue construida con el esfuerzo conyugal, con su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono para mejorar sus poteros y cultivos, su meta es apoyar a sus hijos en lo que les pueda ayudar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria B. is a member of the 14 de Agosto Communal Bank. She lives in the community of Guayan, which belongs to Zhidmad Parish, in the southwest part of Gualaceo District. Agriculture and raising livestock are the main activities of parish residents, and their parochial church (which contains many old relics) is the main tourist attraction. The lookout point on Cerro Borma, where you can find a military pyramid, is another beautiful place to enjoy the outdoors. Mrs. Maria B. is one of the founding members of the communal bank and has been working with Fundación ESPOIR for five years. Her work with the foundation has helped her expand her business raising animals like chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, sheep, and cattle. She sells the animals in her community, and also raises vegetables and potatoes. Maria is 46 years old and married. She has four children, of whom three are married and live independently. Her youngest daughter, who is 14, is in high school. Her husband is a mason, and the couple built their own house together. Maria plans to invest this new loan in the purchase of fertilizer to improve her fields and her crops. Her goal is to support her children with everything she can.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Staff

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Rosa Carmelia

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa corte es socia del banco comunal 14 de Agosto, vive en la comunidad de Guayan, que pertenece a la parroquia de Zhidmad, Ubicada al sur occidente del cantón Gualaceo, la agricultura y la ganadería son las actividades a las que se dedican los pobladores de esta parroquia, su iglesia parroquial es el principal atractivo turístico, en ella se guardan reliquias muy antiguas. El mirador del Cerro Borma, donde se encuentra una pirámide de los militares, es otro hermoso lugar para disfrutar de la naturaleza.

Nuestra socia se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, y a la cría de animales como son cuyes, gallinas, chanchos, vacas, los mismos que los vende en su comunidad

La Sra. Rosa tiene 49 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión ha concebido 4 hijos, quienes se encuentran de 29, 27, 18 y 9 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos trabajan y es solo para sus necesidades, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, con el esfuerzo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia, es su tercer ciclo en la banca comunal y fue invitada por su hija que ya era socia, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono para sus potreros, semillas para sus cultivos. Su meta es mejorar su casita.
texts.en:
Rosa C. is a member of the community bank "14 de Agosto". She lives in the Guayan community, in the Zhidmad parish, in the southwest of the Gualaceo Canton. The residents of this parish work in agriculture and livestock. Their parish church is the main tourist attraction; in it are kept very ancient relics. The Cerro Borma viewpoint, where there is a military pyramid, is another beautiful location to enjoy nature. Rosa does housework and raises animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, pigs, and cows which she sells in her community. Rosa is 49 and married; they have 4 children who are 29, 27, 18 and 9. Their three oldest children work to support themselves. Her husband works in agriculture. Their combined efforts built their own home. This is her third loan cycle with the community bank. She was invited by her daughter who was a member. The requested loan will be invested in the purchase of fertilizer for their pastures and seed for their crops. Her goal is to improve her little house.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Cayaltí, una zona agrícola situada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella es enfermera de profesión y adicionalmente se dedica a trabajar en la crianza de vacas, ella trabaja en esta actividad junto a su esposo, actualmente cuenta con dos vacas en producción; la leche que producen la ofrece en venta a los vecinos de la zona y con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad se generan algunas ganancias adicionales.

Alejandrina desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar la producción de sus vacas y obtener mayor rentabilidad, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Alejandrina es una mujer responsable y trabajadora, sus hijos ya están independizados. Ella desea dedicarse por completo a la crianza de vacas cuando se jubile. En la zona donde vive es una persona muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 48, married and lives with her husband in the district of Cayalti, an agricultural zone an hour from the city of Chiclayo. She is a nurse and also raises cows with her husband. They currently have two cows; the milk that they produce is sold to neighbours, and the earnings from this activity generate an additional income. Alejandrina wants to buy balanced feed to improve the production of their cows and obtain higher returns. For this reason she is requesting, for the first time, a loan of 500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve her goal. Alejandrina is a responsible and hard-working woman. Her children are already independent. She wants to fully devote herself to raising cows when she retires. In her area, she is well-known and respected by her neighbours.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Balanced food for cows

loans.name: Godofreo Lucio

texts.es:
Godofreo es un padre de familia de 47 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, un distrito agrícola ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de 10 años a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexa una cabina y que es utilizada para brindar servicio de transporte). El brinda su servicio en la ciudad donde reside y los anexos que la rodean, como es su unica fuente de ingreso económico Godofreo trabaja todos los dias desde muy temprano y da lo mejor de si para sacar a su negocio adelante.

El continuo uso brindado a su vehículo y el estado accidentado en que se encuentran los caminos de la zona han hecho que este empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la reparación y mantenimiento de su vehículo.

Godofreo es una persona tranquila y trabajadora, anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Godofreo is 47-year-old family man who lives with his wife and their children in Cayalti, an agricultural district located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. For more than 10 years, he has made a living by providing a transportation service for cargo and passengers in a mototaxi (a vehicle that consists of a motorcycle with a cabin attached). He provides this service in the city where he resides, as well as the surrounding areas. Since this is his only source of income, Godofreo works every day, starting in the early morning, and he gives his best in order to keep his business moving forward. The continuos use of his vehicle and the rough state of the roads in his area have caused some malfunctions that require immediate repair to guarantee their proper working condition. For this reason, he has requested a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which he plans to use for the repair and maintenance of his vehicle. Godofreo is a hardworking and laid-back person who has worked previously with our institution and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility when it comes time to make his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expenses for repairing and maintaining his vehicle

loans.name: Leang

texts.en: Leang P., age 57, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She sells groceries and raises chickens at home for an income of about USD 5 per day. Her husband is a farmer and sells palm products, earning an income of USD 1 per day.  P. is requesting a loan of USD 750 to purchase a sugar cane squeezer to produce sugar cane juice for sale. She would like to use any additional profits to support the education of her children.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a sugar cane squeezer to produce sugar cane juice.

loans.name: Khut

texts.en: Khut C., age 37, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She weaves Cambodian traditional silk for an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is a teacher at a local high school, earning an income of USD 3 per day. C. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a mechanical plow to help plow the rice field. She will use any additional profit to support the education of her children.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a mechanical plow.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng P., 54, is married and resides with her husband and seven children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She raises pigs and chickens for an income of USD 1.5 per day. Her husband is a Christian teacher, earning an income of USD 3 per day.  P. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase chickens and a water pump. She will use the additional profits to support the children’s education.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. P.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy chickens to raise and a water pump.

loans.name: Pheoung

texts.en: Pheoung K., 51, is widowed and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She sells traditional medicine for an income of USD 3 per day. One of her children is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 2 per day.  K. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike to transport her medicine to sell. She hopes to use any additional profit to repair the house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. K.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport medicine to sell.

loans.name: Phun

texts.en: Phun L., 50, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She sells fish and earns about USD 3 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 3 per day.  L. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a mechanical plow to help plow their rice field. She plans to use any additional profits to support the children’s education.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. L.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy a mechanical plow to help plow the rice field.

loans.name: En

texts.en: Mrs. En P., a 28-year-old married mother caring for two school-aged children, is a domestic cultivator who raises pigs and crops on her own land in the village. She has a life partner in her husband (on the right in the photo), who works with her in the business. The coming rainfall season allows for farming but En P. does not have enough supplies to use on her field. Because she doesn’t have enough money, En P. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and crop seeds to grow. With any remaining cash from the loan, she will add pigs to her stall.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and crop seeds to grow

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Phan S., 28, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She weaves Cambodian traditional silk for an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband produces rice wine, earning an income of USD 3 per day.  Phan is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase pigs to raise for sale. She would like to use any additional profits to support the children’s study.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise for sale.

loans.name: Phourng

texts.en: Phourng T., age 49, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She weaves Cambodian traditional silk and sells groceries and meat for an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 1.5 per day.  Phourng is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more raw silk to produce silk products for sale. She will use any additional profits to support the children’s education.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy raw silk to produce more silk products.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok M., age 66, is married and resides with her husband and a young child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean temples. She raises pigs for an income of USD 1.5 per day. Her husband buys silk products for resale, earning an income of USD 2 per day.  M. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase silk products for her husband to resell. She would like to use any additional profits to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy silk products for resale.

loans.name: Peng

texts.en: Peng S., 30, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She weaves Cambodian traditional silk for an income of USD 1.5 per day. Her husband buys silk products for resale, earning an income of USD 2 per day. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more silk products for resale.  She plans to use any additional profit to support the children’s study.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more silk products for resale.

loans.name: Lun

texts.en: Lun P., age 29, is married and resides with her husband and a five-year-old child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She produces fabric for an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 3 per day.  P. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a trailer to attach to the motorbike to transport workers from the factory. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a taxi trailer to transport larger groups of people.

loans.name: Ean

texts.en:
Ean N., 43, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. It is an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She and her husband produce clay pigs and chickens to sell for an income of $1 each per day. 

N. is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase a motorbike for the family to use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support the children’s study. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: Produce clay pigs and chickens

loans.name: Sourng

texts.en: Sourng C., 25, is married and resides with her husband and a young child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She grows rice to sell for an income of USD 0.5 per day. Her husband sells salt, earning an income of USD 4 per day. C. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a trailer to transport salt to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. C.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy a trailer to transport salt for sale.

loans.name: Chen

texts.en: Chen P., 27, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She is employed at a garment factory, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband sells ice-cream, earning an income of USD 3 per day.  P. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a new ice-cream box. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support her children’s education. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. P.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy a new ice-cream box.

loans.name: Hen

texts.en: Mrs. Hen K. H., 50 years old, is a crop grower from the Kompong Cham Province. She runs her business on her own farmland where she grows different kinds of crops, like rice and potatoes. In additional to her farming business, Hen K. H. works as a building laborer. She currently earns an average income of $2 a day. She is married and has four school-aged children. Her husband, on the left in the photo, earns money by working as a requirement worker. He is hired by people to plow fields. To alleviate the hard physical labor on the farming, Hen K. H. has requested a loan to purchase a couple of cows to plow her farmland.

loans.use: To purchase a couple of cows to plow her farmland.

loans.name: Pring

texts.en: Pring Y., 40, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She sells groceries at home for an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband is a rice field farmer, earning an income of USD 1 per day. Y. is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to support her children's education. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok O., 38, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She sells groceries at home for an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is a broom seller, earning an income of USD 3 per day. O. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase more brooms for resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to expand her current business. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more brooms for resale.

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Um O., 46, is widowed and lives with her mother and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She grows mushrooms and raises chickens at home for an income of USD 3.30 per day. One of her children is employed at a local garment factory and earns USD 1 per day.  O. is requesting a loan of USD 350 to grow more mushrooms for resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan frO. CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to grow more mushrooms for resale

loans.name: Chet

texts.en: Chet S., 42, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She is a midwife and earns USD 3 per day. Her husband produces rice wine and raises pigs, earning USD 6.60 per day.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase rice to produce more rice wine. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support her children’s study.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy rice to produce more rice wine

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong D., 31, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She raises pigs for an income of USD 1 per day. Her husband is a teacher at a local high school and earns USD 3.3 per day.  D. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase pig food. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support her children’s study.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy pig food

loans.name: Chang

texts.en: Chang C., 27, is married and lives with her husband and child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She sells groceries from home for an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband is a logger and earns USD 6.60 per day.  C. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries

loans.name: Pol

texts.en: Pol S., 33, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She sells groceries from home for an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is a carpenter and earns USD 6.60 per day.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support her children’s study.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. N. is 50 years old and resides in a rural area of Kompong Cham Province. She has a small business producing and selling skewers. She buys raw materials (bamboo) and turns them into batches of skewers for sale. By doing this, N. is able to generate an average of $2.40 a day to cover the daily expenses of her family. She is married with four children: two are now married and the other two are single.


Her husband has been operating a taxi service in the local community. Currently he faces the problem that his motor-taxi breaks down often during passenger pick-ups. To avoid this, N. decided to ask for a loan to renovate the broken taxi.

loans.use: To renovate the broken taxi.

loans.name: Chhy

texts.en:
Mrs. S. is 28 years old and resides with other family members in a wooden house located in a rural area of Kompong Cham Province. She got married many years ago to Sarim, 31, who currently breaks stone block and sells it to earn a living. The couple is blessed with a lovely baby. 

S. is a domestic farmer who has been planting crops since she was single. It is an annual business she has done for a long time. The coming rainfall season allows for farming, but S. does not have enough supplies to use on her field. Because she doesn’t have enough money, S. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and crop seeds to grow.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and crop seeds to grow

loans.name: Manh Tan1-1 Group

texts.en:
Ngan T. D. was born in 1957. She has three children who are grown up. The oldest child and the second are married; the youngest child is working for Electric Power. Her husband is a worker. Not only does she grow rice, but also she raises seven pigs and poultry.  Her family has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 Vietnamdong. This is the first time she is participating in SEDA, hoping to have a better life. She needs 5,014,000 VND to breed pigs and poultry.

 About other borrowers in her group:

Thom V. D. was born in 1981. He is married with two sons. His wife is a worker who makes shoes. He has a hairdressing shop. He is a hairdresser. He has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND. He wants to expand his shop. So he participates in SEDA. He wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND and tries to repay punctually.

Huong T. H. was born in 1988. She has a daughter. She is a farmer and she sells bread in the morning. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to expand her small business.

Thiet T. V. was born in 1990. Her husband is a carpenter. She sells fast food in the market. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to expand her business.

Quyen N. P. was born in 1980. He sells chicken in the market. He has a daughter. He has a monthly income of about 4,500,000 VND. He wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND for his small business.

loans.use: To breed pigs and poultry.

loans.name: Un

texts.en: S. is 60 years old and resides with other family members in a wooden house. She got married many years ago to Oan, age 65, on the left in the photo. He currently assists her with the business. The couple is blessed with four children; all are now married and live independently. S. has been a domestic farmer planting crops since she was single. It is the only business she has ever done for a long time. The coming rainfall season allows for farming, but S. does not have enough supplies to use on her field. Because she doesn’t have enough money, S. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and crop seeds to begin planting.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and crop seeds to begin planting.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby C. has fruitfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASHI. This previous loan was used to purchase more stock for her sari-sari (variety) store. She is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory of foodstuffs for her store. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Ruby from ASHI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.

In 2009, Ruby joined ASHI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. With the chance given to her family by ASHI, a KIVA partner, the couple believes they are getting closer to the achievement of their family dreams. Her long -term goals are to build a profitable business, send her two children to college, and invest in her home.  With the support of Kiva lenders, Ruby is committed to continue her enterprise and determined to achieve economic stability for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for her store.

loans.name: Cuc

texts.en: Cuc T. H. was born in 1962. She has two children (a son and a girl). Her son is a carpenter and the girl is going to school. She and her husband are farmers. They not only grow rice, they also raise 200 chickens. Her husband is disabled. Her life is difficult. She has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 Vietnamdong. This is the first time she is participating in SEDA and tries to repay punctually. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy food for her chickens.

loans.use: To buy food for her chickens.

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en: Mrs. R. is a 40-year-old woman. Her husband appears on the left in the photo. R. works hard every day on her farming operation. It is the only business she has ever done with great success. The coming rainfall season allows for farming but R. does not have enough supplies to use on her field. Because she doesn’t have enough money, R. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and crop seeds to begin growing. R. has seven children who are employed at different jobs. Her husband owns a machine that he uses to plow the farmland for a fee and also works with her on the farming action.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Du

texts.en: Du T. D. was born in 1961. She lives in Manh Tan village, Dong Anh district. She has two children (a son and a girl). She not only grows rice, but she also raises poultry (about 400 chickens). She has had this job for many years. She has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). She needs a loan to invest in livestock. So, she participates in SEDA. For her first loan, she wants to borrow 5,014,000 Vietnamdong (VND) to buy food for the chickens.

loans.use: To buy food for chickens.

loans.name: Van

texts.en: In the photo are Mrs. VA. A. and her husband. This couple earns a living by cultivating a potato crop. They harvest and sell the crops to a private company when they come to maturity. They have six children who are now married and have already started new homes. VA. A. says that this is the annual business she has always done with great success. The coming rainfall season allows for farming but VA. A. does not have enough supplies to use on her field. Because she doesn’t have enough money, VA. A. is applying for a loA. to buy fertilizer and crop seeds to plant.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa T. T. was born in 1983. She is married with a son. Not only does she grow rice, but also she raises pigs and sells noodle soup in the morning with her husband. Now, she raises seven pigs and some chickens. They have a monthly income of about 4,500,000 Vietnamdong (VND). This is the first time she is participating in SEDA. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her restaurant and buy food for pigs. She hopes she can participate in SEDA forever and try to repay punctually.

loans.use: To invest in her restaurent and buy food for pigs

loans.name: Roza's Group

texts.en:
Roza Z. is the leader of the group. She is 33. Her husband works as a security guard in a Regional Military Department; his monthly salary is 2040 soms ($44.23). They have two daughters and a son. The son and the older daughter are at school and the second daughter is not yet. Roza has been farming for 18 years. When the husband is free, he helps her with this activity.  They grow rice, potatoes and onions. By selling the harvest, it is possible to make 12,000 soms ($260.19) per month. With money received from the loan, Roza wants to purchase some land, fertilizer and various seeds. In the future, she plans to finish building her house.

Dilmuradzhon K. is 40. He breeds cattle to make money. He started this activity ten years ago by saving some money and purchasing a calf. Now he has two cows, a calf and seven sheep. Having sold some cattle, he started to build his house. His wife also makes money by cooking for students and selling food near a school. They have two sons and a daughter and all of them study at school. Dilmuradzhon applied for the loan, because he needs money to purchase two calves and increase the number of cattle.

Adalathan A. is 54. She has a parcel of land where she grows rice. Her husband helps her with this activity. They have been doing it since 1992. Adalathan annually grows 1500 kilograms of rice and sells it for 70 soms per kilogram. In this way, she makes 8750 soms ($189.72) per month. Adalathan has three daughters and two sons. The younger son is 22. He helps his parents with housework and the other children are married and live separately with their families. With money received from the loan, Adalathon plans to purchase various seeds and fertilizers for farming. In the future, she plans to save some money to contribute to her son’s wedding and build a new house for him. 

Dilbarhan Z. is treasurer of the group. She is 38. Dilbarhon and her husband grow rice and make money by selling it. They grow 700 kilograms of rice a year and the price is 70 soms per kilogram. In this way, Dilbarhon makes 4080 soms ($88.46) per month. There are five children in their family: four sons and a daughter. The older sons and a daughter work in Bishkek in a sewing workshop and the other children study at school. When the children are free, they help their parents with the business. Dilbarhon hopes to get a loan and with that money, she wants to purchase 50 hectares of land for farming. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young, ambitious and socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). Mol Bulak is the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the Mol Bulak Finance staff.

loans.use: To purchase land, seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Mr. Ny M. and his wife, Mrs. Sotheary Chheng, have been married since 2006 and have two young sons. They are living across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Ny is not in the photo; his wife is pictured instead. 

Ny and his wife are teachers. Besides teaching, Ny also raises cows at home and his wife weaves silk. Unhappily, his cow died, so he is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase one more cow to raise. He also will use a part of the loan to buy silk materials for his wife’s weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase cows and silk materials

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung T. N. was born in 1977. She is a farmer and has two children (a son and a girl) who are going to school. Now she raises 25 pigs and makes wine. Her husband is a mechanic worker.

They have a monthly income of about 5,000,000 Vietnamese Dong (VND). This is the first time she has participated in SEDA. She needs 5,014,000 VND to invest in livestock and buy rice to make wine.

loans.use: to invest in livestock and buy rice to make wine

loans.name: Lann

texts.en:
The photo shows the family members of Mrs. Lann T., who is 31 years old and married with four small kids, most of whom are enrolled in the primary school.

Lann T. became a crop grower when she was single, a skill she learned from her grandmother. She owns medium land where she cultivates a potato crop, which she will harvest and sell the crop to buyers when they are mature. Her husband assists her in growing crops.

The coming rainfall season allows for farming but Lann T. does not have enough supplies to use on her field. Because she doesn’t have enough money, Lann T. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds to grow.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds to grow.

loans.name: Simorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Simorn H. (in the photo) is a widow with four sons and two daughters. Three of her children are married and live outside of the family home and the other three children work in a garment factory. The family lives along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Simorn has been selling fruit for more than twenty years. She buys fruit from her villagers and transports to sell at a market in Phnom Penh. Simorn applied for a Kiva loan one time already. Now she wants to build a kitchen because she does not have a proper place to cook.  Therefore, she is she requesting another loan in the amount of $500 to use for the project.

loans.use: To build a kitchen where she can cook.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanna V. (51 years old and pictured here) and her husband, Mr. Sen Ros, 62, have been married since 1979 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. Two of them are married and live in their own homes and the other four attend school. The family lives in a Phnom Penh suburb.

Vanna has been renting a space in her house to a garment factory worker for ten years. Because her house is located near the garment factory, it’s easy for her to operate the business. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. 

Vanna is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,200 to buy a motorbike for her children to get to school and to repair the roof of her house.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children to get to school and to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Mrs. Seng O. operates her own small trade out of her home. She makes traditional noodles to sell to buyers who come to purchase directly from her house. She is married and blessed with four school-aged kids, while her husband works on their farm fields. Recently, Seng O. got orders from her regular clients but her inventory is not adequate to fill them. Because she has no money, Seng O. requests a loan to purchase ingredients to produce noodles to meet her customers' requirements.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to produce noodles.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Mr. Sokhom E., 45 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Sophal Sdoeng, 42 years old, have been married for twenty years and have three children: two sons and one daughter. Two of them are in school. The family lives in a suburb about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Sokhom was not available for the photo, so his wife is in the photo instead. 

Sokhom has been an electrician for ten years. His wife stays at home. He is requesting his first loan of $400 to purchase a motorbike for his children to drive to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his children to drive to school.

loans.name: Chieu

texts.en: Chieu T. D. was born in 1965. She has two children (a son and a daughter). Not only does she grow rice but she also is raising five pigs and two cows. Her family has difficulties. She wants to have a better life. So, she joined SEDA to have the opportunity to borrow money. This is the first time she has borrowed money from SEDA. She wants 5,014,000 VND to buy food for the pigs and she will try to repay punctually.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs

loans.name: Savet

texts.en:
Mrs. Savet Vior, age 28, and her husband, Mr. Sinoeun Kloeng, age 23, have been married since 2005 and have a young daughter. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Savet has been selling fish in her village since 2008. Her husband has been a construction worker since 2002. She is asking for her first loan in the amount of $500. She will use $200 of the loan to build a new staircase and $300 to put an addition on her house.

loans.use: To build a new staircase and put an addition on her house.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha R., 43, and her husband, Mr. Sear Chea, 42, have been married since 1984 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. Two are garment factory workers, one is a security guard and the other two assist their parents in their business. They live in a small village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Chantha and her husband have been raising ducks for three years. When the ducks lay eggs, they sell the duck eggs in their village. The couple wants to increase the number of ducks they raise, and they will be able to earn more income from selling duck eggs as well. 

Hence, Chantha is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase more ducks to raise.

loans.use: To purchase more ducks to raise.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Mrs. Seng L. is one of many Cambodian people who earn a living by planting crops. She is 58 years old and is the mother of four children, all of whom have already married and started new homes. She has a life partner in her husband who owns a machine that he uses to plow the neighbor’s land for fees. 

The coming rainfall season allows for growing but Seng L. does not have money to buy any supplies to use on her field. Thus, she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and crop seeds to begin growing.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide, and crop seeds.

loans.name: Maxsim

texts.en:
Maksim is 40 years old and an internally displaced person from the region of Khalbadjar. He now lives in the Absheron region. He is the sole provider for his family and has two teenage boys. In his store he sells cooking pots and dishes, a business he learned from his brother ten years ago.

Maksim is asking for a loan of 2,000 AZN to update his merchandise. He hopes that having more (and newer) merchandise in his store will help him sell more competitively. To buy new items, he would travel to the Logbatan region.

loans.use: to update his merchandise

loans.name: Azer

texts.en:
Azer is 39 years old and an internally displaced person from the region of Nagorno-Karabaka. He lives in the Absheron region and has three children. Azer’s business is a small vegetable and fruit store that provides his neighborhood with produce. Azer is committed to selling his produce at affordable prices to his neighbors. To do this, he must wake up early on many mornings and drive long distances to buy from suppliers with the best prices. Azer has been in this business for many years and enjoys it greatly. 

He first learned about the different varieties of produce when he worked in a Ukrainian bazaar for nine years.  Since returning home to Azerbaijan, Azer has sold dishes and cooking pots. Four years ago he started selling vegetables. He prefers selling vegetables and is asking for a loan of 2,000 AZN to increase the variety of the produce he sells. This would be his first loan.

loans.use: to increase the variety of the produce he sells

loans.name: Eleanor

texts.en:
Eleanor S. is from the town of Surallah. She is 53 years old and married with six children. To make a living, she plants and harvests rice to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately $43 a month from these activities.

Eleanor joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Eleanor is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and other farm supplies. This will be her 6th loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

H. Nguyen Thị H. (20211020037) is a 45 year-old woman living in the town of Huyen Yen Phong - tỉnh Bac Ninh.  H. is the group leader of a 5-member group L. offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual L., they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Ngo Noi nhom 08 (Nhom 08).

H. is married and has 2 adult -aged children.  To making a living, H. owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing food services to local community members.  H. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a new L. of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory & used as working capital.  The L. will be the 1st L. taken out by Hoat from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.name: Dinara's Group

texts.en:
Dinara S. is the leader of the group. She is 49 years old, divorced and has raised two daughters and a son. All the children are married and the daughters live separately with their families. The son is doing multiple jobs to earn money. When he is free he helps Dinara with the housework. Ten years ago Dinara’s parents presented her with a calf and some sheep, and from that moment she started to breed cattle. She also sells milk and in this way she earns 1600 soms per month. With money received from the loan Dinara wants to purchase some sheep to increase the number of livestock.

Gulmira K. is 51 and married. She works as a teacher at school. Her monthly salary is 4300 soms. She has two daughters; the older one is married and lives separately with her family. The second daughter lives and works in Bishkek. Gulmira applied for the loan, because she needs money to purchase fabrics to make quilts and pillows for her daughter’s wedding. In the future Gulmira plans to contribute some money for her daughter’s wedding and purchase household appliances.

Kalyima S. is 56 and a widow. Sixteen years ago with the initial investment of 500 soms she began to take orders and make and sell  traditional cloths and dressmaking supplies. In this way she earns 4800 soms per month. Kalyima has three daughters and two sons. The older son and the daughters are married and live separately with their families. The sons works on construction to earn income. Kalyima also owns a section of land She wants to get a loan to purchase fuel which is needed for farming. In the future she wants to save money and improve her living conditions.

Parisa C. is the treasurer of the group. She is 43 and married. Eighteen years ago, with an initial investment of 5000 soms, Parisa bought a calf and started to breed cattle. She also sells milk to earn additional income In this way she earns 3800 soms per month. She has three sons and they are students. Parisa’s husband works in Kazakhstan as an electrician. When the sons have spare time they try to help their mom with housework. With money received from the loan Parisa wants to purchase some sheep for breeding. In the future she plans to save money to contribute to her older son’s wedding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young, ambitious and socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). Mol Bulak is the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the Mol Bulak Finance staff.

Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & C. xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

Agnes is a 53-year-old married lady. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for four years while her husband is retired. She also farms to earn extra income.

Agnes belongs to Loyal Group in Faulu Kenya whose members do the same kind of business. Through the group, she has learnt how to manage her finances by saving her money on a weekly basis. The photo of Agnes was taken near a gas cylinder store where the group members hold their weekly meetings.

Agnes has requested a loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell. She hopes to expand her business for better earnings in the future.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials needed to make additional handicrafts

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Thirty-nine-year-old Lilian D., from the town of Sto. Niño, is married and has a seven-year-old child. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She also owns a farm upon which her husband cultivates rice. Lilian has been engaged in her business for over three years, earning approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Lilian joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan from CEVI, she is now requesting a new loan, her ninth, of 18000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, and plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Fifty years old and married. Ann has been selling fruits and vegetables for the past 18 years. She also farms to supplement her income. Ann is an active member of Loyal group in Faulu Kenya, attending the group meetings consistently and paying her weekly dues faithfully.

So far, she has been able to service one loan from Faulu Kenya which she used to boost her business. She is now requesting a new loan for Kes. 30,000 to buy more fruits and vegetables for sale. Ann hopes that this loan will help her business to grow, as she is determined to open more outlets in the future.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian S., 38 years old, is from the town of Surallah. She is married and has three school-aged children. Lilian owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale and also raises hogs in her backyard. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. Lilian joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Lilian is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, and hog feeds. This loan will be her sixth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, such as manure, and hog feeds

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en: Arnel D. is from Barangay Quezon, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 45 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Arnel owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 45,000 PHP per harvest. In 2009, Arnel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Arnel is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase his crop yield. This loan will be his second from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase his crop yield

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Mr. Sen S. is an older man whose wife appears on the left in the photo. He is the father of five children, all of whom are single and live at home. To help be responsible for the family, one of his children is employed in the construction sector.

Sen S. is engaged in a business buying and selling corn. He also buys the corn in bulk from growers and sells it to companies that need it for food products. He has a life partner in his wife who assists with him in the business.

Besides their current job, this couple also takes time to raise pigs and a rice crop to accumulate additional income. Sen S. is taking out his loan to purchase a piglet for his stall as well as to support growing rice during the coming farming season.

loans.use: To purchase a piglet for his stall and to support his rice-growing

loans.name: Ith

texts.en:
Mrs. Ith V. was born in 1951 and has established a small family home with other members. She has spent a long time in her job of which the main operation is cultivating various crops in the village. Through this, she has had the ability to earn money to feed her kids since they were very young. She now has four teenage children, while another one is now married and lives away from home. Her husband is a good manager who works with her in the field.

In the past, Ith V. needed to pay fees for plowing her farmland, but now she hopes to cut down on the expense. This is why she is asking for a loan to purchase a cow which she will use to plow her field.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for plowing her field

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en: Emilia S. is from the village of San Jose. She is 44 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Emilia owns and operates a business raising pigs for breeding. She has been engaged in her business for over twelve years and earns approximately 8,200 PHP a month. In 2006, Emilia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. Emilia is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her twelfth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Kou

texts.en:
Kou M. is married and lives with his wife and a young child in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, known as the most populated city in the country. He rents parts of his house to workers for an income of USD 3 per day. His wife stays at home as a housewife.

M. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to build more rental rooms. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to expand his business. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To build more rental rooms
